SUMMARY:
The Great Indian Laughter Challenge is a show on Star India which has a celebrity judge in the form of Akshay Kumar, who has done his share of comedy.
And had three mentor judges ‚Äî Zakir Khan, Hussain Dalal and Mallika Dua ‚Äî who would choose 12 stand-up comics as finalists for the show.
The opening credits of the episodes with Dua, Dalal and Khan had Akshay Kumar repeatedly tickle Mallika Dua.
Now this treatment wasn't reserved for Mallika Dua.
Through it all, Akshay Kumar laughed uproariously.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

When did it become okay for men to tickle their female colleagues or give them a full-body hug from behind or sandwich them between each other in the workplace? I don't think even wrestlers do so, right?

But hey, it seems a little slap and tickle is more than kosher on the sets of 'The Great Indian Light Molestation', sorry, I meant 'Laughter Challenge'.

Far more disturbing than the alleged sexist slur on The Great Indian Laughter Challenge and the ensuing controversy between Mallika Dua and Akshay Kumar, are the opening credits of the show ‚Äì as I found out over the last two weekends. For all of you who've missed the show, let me bring you up to speed. The Great Indian Laughter Challenge is a show on Star India which has a celebrity judge in the form of Akshay Kumar, who has done his share of comedy. And had three mentor judges ‚Äî Zakir Khan, Hussain Dalal and Mallika Dua ‚Äî who would choose 12 stand-up comics as finalists for the show. The show's anchor is Katrina Kaif-doppelganger and Bigg Boss contestant Eli Avram.

All good till now. It's not a manel, there's female representation, and the judges and mentors are all directly connected to comedy. (The three mentor judges have been removed as of last week, to be replaced by that doyen of comedy, Sajid Khan and the saving grace that is Shreyas Talpade.) The format of the show is that if you want to choose a contestant, you have to ring a bell or "bell bajao" ‚Äì a take on the Hindi aesthetic phrase, "bell bajaana". Or to take the mickey out of someone.

The week of the three mentors being summarily removed from the show, there was a brouhaha because journalist Vinod Dua wrote a Facebook post about the sexist remarks made by the "cretin" Akshay Kumar about his daughter Mallika when she was ringing the bell for a contestant. Kumar said, "Tum uska bell bejao, mein tumhara bell bajaata hu" (literally translating to - you ring his bell and I'll ring yours). Mallika posted about it, got trolled by Akshay fans, and deleted the post soon after.

This was followed by a video being released of a comic who imitated Narendra Modi and Rahul Gandhi to wide applause (and was the same person Dua was ringing the bell for). This comic's act was deleted from the show and he was asked to perform a new act. Everyone cried censorship, blue murder, we love comedy - the usual noises were made and forgotten.

Which is what made me tune into this show to see what the kerfuffle was all about.

And I must admit none of these controversies match up to what were the opening credits of the show, or how the female mentors and anchors (I'm sure with their permission) are physically treated in the programme.

The opening credits of the episodes with Dua, Dalal and Khan had Akshay Kumar repeatedly tickle Mallika Dua. Because that's what grown men are supposed to do to grown women on a show about comedy. Tickle them. Not tickle the male mentors, though. That would be too 'gay', right? If there was something to be offended by, one would think it would be this. But these are concessions one must make for getting a toehold in mainstream entertainment, I suppose.

None of these controversies match up to what were the opening credits of the show, or how the female mentors and anchors (I'm sure with their permission) are physically treated in the programme.

Now this treatment wasn't reserved for Mallika Dua. In the episode in which Sajid Khan and Shreyas Talpade came on as judges, there was no one to tickle in the credits. But the producers, director and I'm assuming Kumar thought outside the box and came up with a routine which left me goggle-eyed. Eli Avram, the anchor, came on the stage only to have Sajid Khan hold a red heart-shaped balloon against her chest, while Talpade held it against her back. They then sandwiched her between them, with Khan facing her and jumping to and fro while holding the said balloon to her bosom. Through it all, Akshay Kumar laughed uproariously. Avram also giggled. And finally, Kumar hugged Avram from the back.

This is a workplace which seems tailor-made for Harvey Weinstein, Dustin Hoffman, Shakti Kapoor, and Brett Ratner.

We all know that jokes about Mr Modi may not pass muster on most channels. But that really is the least of our concerns right now. Going by 'The List' being released, and the unending stories of powerful men who have gotten away with sexually harassing women at the workplace, there are far greater worries than not being able to crack a joke about Modi. The rampant sexism and manhandling of women, which seems to pass off as normal in Hindi films and TV shows, is actually what we should be concerned about while discussing The Great Laughter Challenge. What's worse is that the women seem to be loving the inappropriate touching and attention, much like in horrendous films like Grand Masti and Judwaa 2 and so on. This is the sexual and sexist tripe that male audiences watch and then emulate. The one thing you can be sure of, there was nothing to laugh at by the end of it. A pity, since the comedy acts were quite good. But when you have a lewd and sexist sideshow headlined by a superstar, it's hard to pay attention to the main act.

If you'd like a lesson in how not to behave with female colleagues, do watch The Great Indian Laughter Challenge on Saturday and Sunday at 8pm on Star India.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Comedy Show 'Laughter Challenge' Could Have Treated Its Women Hosts Better

Le conseil des religieux a rapidement r√©agi sur son compte Twitter en affirmant que la lutte contre la corruption √©tait "aussi importante que le combat contre le terrorisme".
Le royaume ouvre une nouvelle √®re et une politique de transparence" Mohammed al-Jadaan, ministre des finances saoudienParmi les personnes arr√™t√©es figure le prince et milliardaire Al-Walid ben Talal, selon des sites web saoudiens.
Le cours de la soci√©t√© internationale d'investissement du prince, Kingdom Holding Company, a chut√© de 9,9% √† l'ouverture dimanche.

Dans le m√™me temps, il a oeuvr√© pour renforcer son emprise politique sur le pouvoir, proc√©dant notamment en septembre √† une vague d'arrestations de dissidents, dont des religieux influents et des intellectuels.
TEXT:
Anadolu Agency via Getty Images

ARABIE SAOUDITE - Des dizaines de princes, de ministres (anciens et actuels) et d'hommes d'affaires, ont √©t√© arr√™t√©s samedi 4 novembre dans la soir√©e en Arabie saoudite, selon des m√©dias, au cours d'une purge sans pr√©c√©dent qui doit permettre au jeune prince h√©ritier de consolider son pouvoir.

Parall√®lement, Metab ben Abdallah, chef de la puissante Garde nationale saoudienne, un temps consid√©r√© comme pr√©tendant au tr√¥ne, ainsi que le chef de la Marine Abdallah Al-Sultan et le ministre de l'√âconomie Adel Fakih ont √©t√© abruptement limog√©s dans le cadre de cette purge sans pr√©c√©dent.

Ces arrestations et limogeages sont intervenus quelques heures apr√®s la cr√©ation, par d√©cret royal, d'une commission anticorruption dirig√©e par le prince h√©ritier et homme fort du royaume ultra-conservateur, Mohammed ben Salmane, √¢g√© de 32 ans et surnom√© "MBS".

Des avions priv√©s clou√©s au sol

Selon la cha√Æne satellitaire Al-Arabiya, √† capitaux saoudiens, onze princes, quatre ministres et des dizaines d'anciens ministres ont √©t√© arr√™t√©s alors que la commission a lanc√© une enqu√™te sur les inondations qui ont d√©vast√© en 2009 la ville portuaire de Jeddah (ouest), sur la mer Rouge, √† la suite de pluies torrentielles, faisant une centaine de morts.

L'agence de presse officielle saoudienne SPA a indiqu√© que le but de la commission √©tait de "pr√©server l'argent public, punir les personnes corrompues et ceux qui profitent de leur position". Le conseil des religieux a rapidement r√©agi sur son compte Twitter en affirmant que la lutte contre la corruption √©tait "aussi importante que le combat contre le terrorisme".

Le royaume ouvre une nouvelle √®re et une politique de transparence" Mohammed al-Jadaan, ministre des finances saoudien

Parmi les personnes arr√™t√©es figure le prince et milliardaire Al-Walid ben Talal, selon des sites web saoudiens. Cette information n'a pas √©t√© confirm√©e officiellement.

Une source a√©roportuaire a par ailleurs indiqu√© √† l'AFP que les forces de s√©curit√© avaient clou√© au sol des avions priv√©s √† Jeddah, pour emp√™cher que certaines personnalit√©s quittent le territoire.

Avec ces arrestations, "le royaume ouvre une nouvelle √®re et une politique de transparence, de clart√© et de responsabilit√©", a d√©clar√© dimanche le ministre des Finances Mohammed al-Jadaan, ajoutant que ces actions "d√©cisives pr√©serveront le climat pour les investissements et renforceront la confiance dans l'√âtat de droit".

√âtouffer les contestations internes

"L'√©tendue et l'ampleur de ces arrestations semblent √™tre sans pr√©c√©dent dans l'histoire moderne de l'Arabie saoudite", a affirm√© √† l'AFP Kristian Ulrichsen, sp√©cialiste du Golfe √† l'institut Baker de l'universit√© Rice, aux √âtats-Unis.

"Si la d√©tention du prince Al-Walid ben Talal se confirme, elle constituera une onde de choc sur le plan int√©rieur et dans le monde des affaires internationales", estime cet expert. Le cours de la soci√©t√© internationale d'investissement du prince, Kingdom Holding Company, a chut√© de 9,9% √† l'ouverture dimanche.

L'indice Tadawul All-Shares (Tasi), la Bourse la plus importante des pays arabes, √©tait √©galement en baisse, de 1,6%, une minute seulement apr√®s son ouverture, √† la suite de la vague d'arrestations.

Contr√¥lant les principaux leviers du gouvernement, de la d√©fense √† l'√©conomie, Mohammed ben Salmane semble chercher √† √©touffer les contestations internes avant tout transfert formel du pouvoir par son p√®re, le roi Salmane, √¢g√© de 81 ans.

Fin octobre, MBS, issu de la jeune g√©n√©ration princi√®re saoudienne, a promis une Arabie "mod√©r√©e", en rupture avec l'image d'un pays longtemps consid√©r√© comme l'exportateur du wahhabisme, une version rigoriste de l'islam qui a nourri nombre de jihadistes √† travers le monde. "Nous n'allons pas passer 30 ans de plus de notre vie √† nous accommoder d'id√©es extr√©mistes et nous allons les d√©truire maintenant", avait-il assur√© sous les applaudissements des participants √† un forum √©conomique baptis√© le "Davos dans le d√©sert" qui avait attir√© 2500 d√©cideurs du monde entier.

Une vague d'arrestations de dissidents en septembre

Il a lanc√© plusieurs chantiers de r√©formes -droit de conduire pour les femmes et ouvertures de cin√©mas notamment- qui marquent le plus grand bouleversement culturel et √©conomique de l'histoire moderne du royaume, avec une marginalisation de fait de la caste des religieux conservateurs.

Dans le m√™me temps, il a oeuvr√© pour renforcer son emprise politique sur le pouvoir, proc√©dant notamment en septembre √† une vague d'arrestations de dissidents, dont des religieux influents et des intellectuels.

Selon des analystes, nombre de ces dissidents critiquaient la politique √©trang√®re muscl√©e du jeune prince h√©ritier, comme le boycott du Qatar, ainsi que certaines r√©formes comme la privatisation d'entreprises publiques et la r√©duction des subventions de l'√âtat.

TITLE: En Arabie saoudite, le prince h√©ritier proc√®de √† une purge "sans pr√©c√©dent dans l'histoire moderne du pays"

SUMMARY:
Un furore che poco serve a migliorare le miserie della vita quotidiana ma che ha l'indubbio pregio di incanalarne l'indignazione distraendola dalla realt√†.
Perch√© la realt√† oggi sono delle ragazzine di 14 anni stuprate da un tizio conosciuto in chat.
Che oggi √® quella della piccola star che denuncia la stella di prima grandezza.
Che non sono i giornalisti.
Una societ√† civile analizza i singoli casi: ascolta le ragioni e il dolore delle vittime e ascolta le ragioni dell'imputato.
TEXT:
Non c'√® mattina, da un po' di settimane a questa parte, in cui svegliandoci dal sonno (anche della ragione) non scopriamo che qualcuno di molto potente/molto famoso non sia finito sulla prima pagina di un giornale, svergognato per un suo comportamento meschino da una donna. Ottimo, direi: √® giusto che chi abusa del proprio potere o della propria posizione finisca denunciato. Per√≤ non lo dico, ottimo intendo. Perch√© quelle che finiscono sulle prime pagine dei giornali ultimamente non sono denunce alle forze dell'ordine, alla magistratura: no sono denunce al popolo che, avendo fame e non potendo nutrirsi di aristocratiche brioche, si nutre di indignato furore. Un furore che poco serve a migliorare le miserie della vita quotidiana ma che ha l'indubbio pregio di incanalarne l'indignazione distraendola dalla realt√†.

Perch√© la realt√† oggi sono delle ragazzine di 14 anni stuprate da un tizio conosciuto in chat. Meno fama e meno lustrini, meno pagine patinate e red carpet. Ma denunce, di quelle vere. Denunce davanti a un carabiniere o a un poliziotto che ascolta un racconto raccapricciante di violenza appena consumata. Denunce di chi ha subito un oltraggio indescrivibile e non ha molta voglia di sbandierarlo in favore di telecamera. Che non accetter√† foto e compensi con un po' troppi zeri per risultare eticamente accettabili e che per questo riuscir√† a suscitare l'indignazione solo di coloro che azzannano la cronaca per trasformarla in politica. Poche femmine e femministe accanto a delle sconosciute ragazzine, pochissime se si pensa a quante si siano schierate, lancia in resta e mano sul cuore, accanto a delle donne ricche, molto pi√π potenti e famose delle vittime anonime del quotidiano che del resto, ormai, vengono registrate come un episodio tra i tanti per cui si sospira per passare a leggere la notizia dopo. Che oggi √® quella della piccola star che denuncia la stella di prima grandezza. Con almeno 20 anni di ritardo sull'abuso che ha patito e non davanti a uno sbirro, ma di fronte al microfono (o a un registratore) di un giornalista. Perch√©? Perch√©, mi chiedo io queste donne molestate hanno atteso tanto, cos√¨ tanto da rendere inefficace la loro denuncia in termini di legge? Perch√© si accontentano delle condanne forcaiole del tribunale popolare e non cercano quelle vere della giustizia dei tribunali dei magistrati?

A chi serve una denuncia in prima pagina se non alla notoriet√† di colei che la promuove?

Oggi che le battaglie si combattono con gli hashtag e con le chiacchiere sulle piazze virtuali le condanne sono quelle del popolo, e pazienza se chi avrebbe potuto indagare e fare giustizia per le vittime si dovr√† girare i pollici: abbiamo un hashtag e le pacche sulle spalle di mezzo mondo che, improvvisamente, si ricorder√† che esistiamo e torner√† a pagare il biglietto per il nostro prossimo film. Tanto basta e, in qualche caso, avanza pure.

Solo che questa nuova giustizia social e patinata non serve a cambiare i costumi che, ancora oggi (e avanti di questo passo chiss√† per quanto), legittimano un uomo di potere a chiedere del sesso in cambio di un lavoro. Una prassi (s√¨, prassi, consuetudine, uso parecchio comune) ignobile che prevede una punizione a norma di legge. Perch√© √® illegale molestare una persona ed √® fondamentale, se vogliamo migliorare la societ√† in cui vivranno le nuove generazioni, denunciarla agli organi competenti a perseguirla. Che non sono i giornalisti.

Sar√≤ cinica io, ma in questa fiera delle vanit√† in cui nel fal√≤ finiscono degli uomini che potevano invece finire in galera, io trovo poca etica e un po' troppo calcolo. Ora che ogni cronista anche del pi√π piccolo quotidiano di provincia √® alla caccia della vittima di un molestatore (famoso, anche se la sua fama dovesse fermarsi al circolo del paese) il rischio che corriamo √® di ghigliottinare chi non ha nemmeno avuto la possibilit√† di difendersi. Cos√¨ faceva Robespierre durante il Terrore, cos√¨ fin√¨ Robespierre al termine del Terrore.

Una societ√† civile e matura non fa processi di massa e non seppellisce i condannati nelle fosse comuni dello sdegno. Una societ√† civile analizza i singoli casi: ascolta le ragioni e il dolore delle vittime e ascolta le ragioni dell'imputato. Lo fa senza preconcetti, senza indignazione e senza moralismi e poi decide: condanna o assoluzione. Non mediatiche ma giurisprudenziali.

Ma si sa: il popolo √® quello che vuole il sangue. √à quello che andava al Colosseo a veder sbranare i Cristiani, che assisteva alle decapitazioni nel centro di Parigi e oggi sgranocchia popcorn leggendo di quella volta (30 anni fa) in cui Dustin Hoffman mise una mano sul culo a una stagista e di quell'altra (20 anni fa) in cui Giuseppe Tornatore attacc√≤ al muro quella bella figliola di Miriana Trevisan.

Tutti contenti. Tutti impuniti.
TITLE: Lasciate perdere per un attimo le star e concentratevi sulla realt√† delle ragazzine stuprate

SUMMARY:
Il cardinale Agostino Vallini √® il neo Legato Pontificio delle basiliche papali in Assisi.
La scelta del papa rivela il forte legame tra Assisi e Roma.
Come vicario generale di Sua Santit√† per la diocesi di Roma ogni giorno avevo accanto l'immagine di san Francesco a Roma.
La seconda considerazione √® che la Chiesa sente il bisogno di san Francesco.
L'ultima considerazione √® che il pellegrinaggio che il cardinal Vallini richiama, all'et√† di 8 anni, ci ricorda l'amore della nostra gente per il Patrono d'Italia.
TEXT:
La Sala Stampa della Santa Sede alle 12 annuncia la scelta di Papa Francesco. Il cardinale Agostino Vallini √® il neo Legato Pontificio delle basiliche papali in Assisi. Succede al cardinale Attilio Nicora, scomparso pochi mesi fa.

Il primo commento √® dei rispettivi Custodi, Padre Mauro Gambetti e Padre Giuseppe Renda poich√© la nomina riguarda le due basiliche di san Francesco e di santa Maria degli Angeli che si rallegrano per la scelta, ringraziano il papa e affidano il ministero pastorale del neo Legato Pontificio all'intercessione di san Francesco.

La scelta del papa rivela il forte legame tra Assisi e Roma. Un legame che affonda le sue radici non solo nella vita di san Francesco, ma nel testo pi√π importante e pi√π autorevole degli Scritti, il Testamento, che annota come Francesco, morente, desidera che tutti i frati facciano riferimento a un cardinale che √® "Signore, protettore e correttore". Tre sfaccettature che non sono mai venute meno nella scelta e nella benevolenza dei papi per Assisi.

I cardinali legati che si sono succeduti, dal cardinal Giovanni Colonna fino ad Oddi e Nicora, sono stati sempre dei "signori", autorevoli, credibili, e quindi capaci di animare e orientare. Protettori perch√© hanno sempre difeso la famiglia francescana e la hanno corretta l√† dove era necessario.

Mi accingo poi a raccogliere le parole del Cardinale Vallini, appena nominato da papa Francesco, e "scopro" un uomo profondamente innamorato del Santo di Assisi. Infatti le sue prime parole sono state: "Come faremmo senza san Francesco? Sono un suo appassionato. Come vicario generale di Sua Santit√† per la diocesi di Roma ogni giorno avevo accanto l'immagine di san Francesco a Roma. Non solo nel mio ministero pastorale la sua figura mi ha accompagnato, ma anche ‚Äì ed √® questo il primo ricordo che affiora nel mio cuore ‚Äì quando nel 1948, a 8 anni, andai per la prima volta in pellegrinaggio ad Assisi con mia mamma".

Traggo cos√¨ tre considerazioni, che condivido con voi. La prima: in Assisi, nel cuore delle famiglie francescane, √® forte il desiderio di mantenere vivo il legame con la Santa Sede per vivere e promuovere l'amore del fondatore verso la Chiesa e verso il Papa.

La seconda considerazione √® che la Chiesa sente il bisogno di san Francesco. Agostino Vallini √® un cardinale di Santa Romana Chiesa, √® un uomo che ha guidato pastoralmente la pi√π importante tra le chiese. E quando si attinge nel serbatoio del francescanesimo si diventa uomini che sanno "riparare il tempio, scavare un serbatoio e fortificare le mura della stessa Chiesa", come disse il compianto cardinale Martini nella sua omelia pi√π bella.

L'ultima considerazione √® che il pellegrinaggio che il cardinal Vallini richiama, all'et√† di 8 anni, ci ricorda l'amore della nostra gente per il Patrono d'Italia.
TITLE: Quel legame tra Assisi e Roma che dura da otto secoli

SUMMARY:
Er ist dann wieder viel unterwegs und nicht zu Hause bei Lebensgef√§hrtin Miriam G√∂ssner (27) und T√∂chterchen Matilda, die gerade mal wenige Wochen alt ist.
Dem frischgebackenen Papa f√§llt das nicht leicht.
Und es tut weh, nicht zu Hause zu sein.
Sein neues Leben als PapaFelix Neureuther hat bereits Erfahrung in Kindersachen - holen Sie sich hier sein Kinderbuch "Auf die Piste, fertig, los!"
Das ist mir wichtiger als jede sportliche Herausforderung", sagt Neureuther.
TEXT:
F√ºr Ski-Star Felix Neureuther (33) beginnt in K√ºrze die Olympia-Saison. Er ist dann wieder viel unterwegs und nicht zu Hause bei Lebensgef√§hrtin Miriam G√∂ssner (27) und T√∂chterchen Matilda, die gerade mal wenige Wochen alt ist. Dem frischgebackenen Papa f√§llt das nicht leicht. "Ja, das ist absolut hart. Und es tut weh, nicht zu Hause zu sein. Ich vermisse die beiden nat√ºrlich, denke sehr oft an sie", erz√§hlt er im Interview mit der "Welt am Sonntag".

Sein neues Leben als Papa

Felix Neureuther hat bereits Erfahrung in Kindersachen - holen Sie sich hier sein Kinderbuch "Auf die Piste, fertig, los!"

Seit der Geburt seiner Tochter haben sich seine Priorit√§ten verschoben. "Wenn man Papa ist, geht man sicherlich nicht mehr jedes Risiko ein, sch√§tzt Herausforderungen auf und neben der Piste anders ein. Ich bin schon nachdenklicher geworden, das Vatersein hat mich ver√§ndert, das habe ich bereits jetzt nach den wenigen Wochen bemerkt", so Neureuther weiter. Das Skifahren spiele weiterhin eine gro√üe Rolle in seinem Leben, doch Tochter Matilda ist klar die neue Nummer eins.

Das Ski-Ass habe "verdammtes Gl√ºck", dass Miriam G√∂ssner "voll hinter mir und dem Sport steht". "Ich m√∂chte aber keinesfalls die Momente verpassen, wenn die Kleine anf√§ngt zu krabbeln oder zu laufen. Das ist mir wichtiger als jede sportliche Herausforderung", sagt Neureuther. Da er G√∂ssner das Stillen nicht abnehmen k√∂nne, sorge er daf√ºr, dass seine Lebensgef√§hrtin am Abend "auch mal ein oder zwei Stunden fr√ºher ins Bett gehen kann - dann schunkle ich die Kleine in den Schlaf. Das ist wunderbar". Der Spitzensportler geht in seiner Vaterrolle f√∂rmlich auf.

"Vater zu sein, ist einfach alles - auch eine v√∂llig neue und riesige Verantwortung f√ºr mich. Es ist das Sch√∂nste, das es gibt", schw√§rmt der 33-J√§hrige. Er habe "ein bisschen Respekt" vor dieser neuen Verantwortung, denn er wolle nichts falsch machen. Und eines w√ºnscht er sich besonders f√ºr Matilda: "Unsere Tochter soll auf jeden Fall ganz normal aufwachsen - so wie ich damals".
TITLE: Felix Neureuther: Sein neues Leben als Papa

The official, who declined to be identified under briefing rules, said billionaire Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, who owns investment firm Kingdom Holding, and former finance minister Ibrahim al-Assaf had been detained.

TEXT:
RIYADH, Nov 5 (Reuters) - One of Saudi Arabia's most prominent businessmen and a former finance minister are among dozens detained in a probe by a new anti-corruption body, a senior Saudi official said on Sunday.

The official, who declined to be identified under briefing rules, said billionaire Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, who owns investment firm Kingdom Holding, and former finance minister Ibrahim al-Assaf had been detained.

Neither man nor Kingdom Holding officials could be reached immediately for comment. Aside from being one of the largest shareholders in Citigroup, Kingdom owns stakes in Rupert Murdoch's News Corp and microblogging site Twitter.

Saudi King Salman announced late on Saturday the creation of a new anti-corruption committee chaired by his son Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. Saudi-owned Al Arabiya television said the body had detained 11 princes, four current ministers and tens of former ministers. The crown prince is spearheading an ambitious economic reform programme that aims to draw more foreign and private sector investment into the kingdom, which is the world's top oil exporter and the most powerful country in the Gulf Arab region.

In Saudi Arabia, 10 princes and dozens of ministers are detained by new anti-corruption body, state media report https://t.co/eXTSWd5Jbm ‚Äî BBC Breaking News (@BBCBreaking) November 4, 2017

King Salman also appointed two new ministers on Saturday to key security and economic posts, removing one of the royal family's most prominent members as head of the National Guard.

Prince Miteb bin Abdullah was replaced as minister of the National Guard by Khaled bin Ayyaf, while Economy Minister Adel Fakieh was removed in favour of his deputy Mohammed al-Tuwaijri, according to a royal decree carried by state-run media.

Prince Miteb, the preferred son of the late King Abdullah, was once thought to be a leading contender for the throne before the unexpected rise of Prince Mohammed two years ago.

The Cabinet reshuffle helped to consolidate Prince Mohammed's control of the kingdom's security institutions, which had long been headed by separate powerful branches of the ruling family.

A purge in Saudi Arabia leaves Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman with all levers of power https://t.co/04I5q5GRYC pic.twitter.com/DHyo8yZgzY ‚Äî Bloomberg (@business) November 5, 2017

Prince Mohammed, who has pledged to go after graft at the highest levels, will head the new anti-corruption body, which was given broad powers to investigate cases, issue arrest warrants and travel restrictions, and freeze assets.

"The homeland will not exist unless corruption is uprooted and the corrupt are held accountable," the royal decree said. (Reporting by Katie Paul, Reem Shamseddine, and Stephen Kalin, and Rania El Gamal in Dubai; Writing by Sylvia Westall; Editing by Andrew Torchia and Paul Tait)
TITLE: Saudi Arabian Billionaire Among Dozens Detained As Part Of Corruption Crackdown

SUMMARY:
Some groups in Canada and the United States are doing more than just dread the end of daylight saving time ‚Äî they're trying to end it for good.
Daylight saving time ends on Sunday in most parts of the country, with many Canadians dreading the darkness that will come earlier every night until the solstice on Dec. 21.
Still, those opposed to the system can always point to Saskatchewan, which rejected daylight saving when the idea took hold more than 50 years ago.
In September, a special commission in Massachusetts recommended the state ‚Äî now in the eastern time zone ‚Äî should extend daylight saving year-round, but only if the other states in the region follow suit.
The main goal, according to proponents, would be to add an extra hour of afternoon daylight in the winter.
TEXT:
Some groups in Canada and the United States are doing more than just dread the end of daylight saving time ‚Äî they're trying to end it for good.

Daylight saving time ends on Sunday in most parts of the country, with many Canadians dreading the darkness that will come earlier every night until the solstice on Dec. 21.

As usual, most people will turn their clocks back an hour on or before Sunday at 2 a.m. with little complaint. But there are rumblings across the continent that people are growing weary of moving their timepieces ahead one hour in the spring ‚Äîlosing an hour of sleep ‚Äî and then turning them back in the fall.

"Most people dislike having to change their clocks and lose an hour of sleep," said David Prerau, author of "Seize the Daylight: The Curious and Contentious Story of Daylight Saving Time" and one of the world's leading experts on the subject.

"It's a pain. They think it's easier just to get rid of it."

As a result, the daylight-optimizing system, largely standardized across North America in the 1960s, is facing a new wave of challenges.

Alberta failed to copy Saskatchewan

In Alberta, proposed legislation that would have ended the practice won overwhelming support in August when the public was asked to weigh in on the idea. Of the 13,000 submissions received, 75 per cent were in favour of scrapping the system.

However, the Alberta legislature shot down the idea this week after an all-party committee said the impact on business would be too onerous.

Still, those opposed to the system can always point to Saskatchewan, which rejected daylight saving when the idea took hold more than 50 years ago. To this day, turning clocks forward and backward is a foreign concept in all but a few corners of the province. Arizona is also an DST abstainer. Indiana held out until 2006.

Extra hour of afternoon daylight in the winter ... could increase productivity and curb on-the-job injuries and traffic fatalities, according to one Massachusetts study.

Meanwhile, opposition to daylight time, which extends from the second Sunday in March to the first Sunday in November, has been gaining ground among the six New England states, which could have repercussions for the Maritimes and Newfoundland and Labrador.

In September, a special commission in Massachusetts recommended the state ‚Äî now in the eastern time zone ‚Äî should extend daylight saving year-round, but only if the other states in the region follow suit. Some of the other states have already tabled bills to make the change, though it could take years to accomplish.

The main goal, according to proponents, would be to add an extra hour of afternoon daylight in the winter. Such a change could increase productivity and curb on-the-job injuries and traffic fatalities, according to one Massachusetts study.

However, plans to eliminate the twice-a-year time change have failed in the past, Prerau said.

In 1970's, U.S. tried DST year-round

When the United States was hit by an oil supply crisis in the early 1970s, the federal government decided to extend daylight time year-round for two years in a bid to save energy.

But the plan unravelled that first winter as schoolchildren headed off to classes in the dark, raising the ire of parents across the country.

"In more northern areas, not only would it be darker in the morning, it would be colder because the coldest hour in the day is the one before sunrise," said Prerau, who has coauthored three major U.S. government reports to Congress on the effects of daylight saving time.

"The issue became very unpopular ... Most people preferred having the daylight in the morning."

During the second year of the U.S. program, daylight time was lifted between November and February, the darkest months of the year.

Electric Time Company employee Dan Lamoore adjusts the color on a 67-inch square LED color-changing clock at the plant in Medfield, Mass. on Oct. 30, 2008.

As for the proposals emerging in New England, the one from Massachusetts calls for pushing back the start of the school day. Bills have been filed in Maine, New Hampshire, Connecticut, and Rhode Island.

Prerau said he's surprised these proposals have progressed as far as they have, considering the economic powerhouse in the U.S. northeast, neighbouring New York State, appears uninterested in the scheme.

"If New York didn't change, that would be a negative for Boston," he said.

However, if the proposals are adopted, New England would become part of the Atlantic standard time zone, which would mean that its clocks would be synchronized with those in the three Maritime provinces between November and March.

"There's some benefit to being in the same time zone with someone you're dealing with in a business relationship," Prerau said, suggesting the Maritimes would be under pressure to drop daylight time to stay in sync year-round.

In no secret that Canada, in general, has followed the United States in lockstep when it comes to making the most of daylight hours.

That's what happened in 2007 when daylight time was extended in the U.S. by a month in the spring and by a few days in the fall.

Also On HuffPost:
TITLE: Ending Daylight Saving Time: Groups In Alberta, Some U.S. States Want To Abolish Practice

SUMMARY:
2017 sees the 20th anniversary of Gay and Lesbian Memory In Action (Gala) -- an invaluable storehouse of South Africa's queer history, and home to some of the country's most passionate LGBTQ+ advocates.
Huffpost SA met Keval Harie, the director of Gala, ahead of their upcoming exhibition to celebrate this important milestone in their history.
As a young student, he tells us, the Gala archive was a safe space for him to be himself.
Harie holds the keys to South Africa's queer history ‚Äì‚Äì a history, he says, that tells an extraordinary story of the country's struggle toward equality for all its citizens.
"I'm just glad we can provide Eudy with some sense of a story, and know her legacy will never be forgotten."
TEXT:
2017 sees the 20th anniversary of Gay and Lesbian Memory In Action (Gala) -- an invaluable storehouse of South Africa's queer history, and home to some of the country's most passionate LGBTQ+ advocates.

Kept within its archives are touchstones of the LGBTQ+ struggle legacy ‚Äì‚Äì like apartheid activist Simon Nkoli's letters to his lover from prison; the boots of raped and murdered soccer player Eudy Simelane; and rooms full of books, posters, and recordings that capture the legacy of the LGBTQ+ journey from illegality to constitutional protection against discrimination.

Huffpost SA met Keval Harie, the director of Gala, ahead of their upcoming exhibition to celebrate this important milestone in their history. As a young student, he tells us, the Gala archive was a safe space for him to be himself.

"I think of being the closeted young person I was at the time, coming to Gala for the first time, and reading Simon Nkoli's letters whilst he was in prison, which were incredibly moving. " Harie says from the seventh floor of the University of the Witwatersrand's University Corner, where Gala's headquarters are located.

Harie holds the keys to South Africa's queer history ‚Äì‚Äì a history, he says, that tells an extraordinary story of the country's struggle toward equality for all its citizens.

"Our core purpose is to ensure against the erasure of LGBTQI history on the continent, and we do this by ensuring that we have a space that provides a platform for LGBTQI people, and activism, and a kind of movement-building." He says.

Gala's programmes, like the youth forum and LGBTI refugee forum, have also created a community space where people can feel safe in spite of the challenges they are facing.

"In this space, we try to provide an environment where young people can talk about their lives ‚Äì‚Äì and it ranges from questions of identity, to questions of bodies, and how they are dealing with that. A lot of people might not necessarily be out to their families, but at least this provides an opportunity for them to provide support for other queer youth."

For Keval, Eudy Simelane's boots are one for the most important aspects of the collection.

"One of the most powerful things we worked with while planning our upcoming exhibition belonged to Eudy Simelane, who faced the most horrible and gruesome death as a result of her gender identity and sexual orientation."

"The Similane family donated Eudy's boots to Gala, and her soccer togs. It's so moving to have them as apart of the archive, because I think it really speaks to the lives of Eudy and others, who really just wanted to be their best ‚Äì‚Äì and it speaks the innate tragedy in senseless deaths like Eudy's."

"I'm just glad we can provide Eudy with some sense of a story, and know her legacy will never be forgotten."
TITLE: Preserving South Africa's Queer Archive

SUMMARY:
Surtout, comment tenter de retourner la situation, pr√©tendre que le fr√®re Merah serait injustement accus√© et, par exemple, implorer que nous pensions √† la m√®re du terroriste, "par ce que c'est une m√®re" ?!
Comment tenter √† ce point la confusion des sentiments, entre des parents de victimes et les parents d'un assassin?
Il n'y aurait plus de fronti√®res, entre situation humaine des victimes et celle des assassins?
Et une question se pose: et si la cause que M. Dupont-Moretti d√©fendait avec tant de fougue outranci√®re n'√©tait pas, finalement, la sienne?
Elie Wiesel disait, √©voquant les crimes totalitaires, qu'il y a trois cat√©gories de gens quand l'id√©ologie du crime absolu entre en action: les victimes, les bourreaux, et les spectateurs.
TEXT:
Bien s√ªr, cela s'impose comme une √©vidence en toute d√©mocratie, tout accus√© a besoin d'un avocat, commis d'office s'il le faut. Cette proc√©dure d'avocat "commis d'office" est d'ailleurs pr√©cis√©e en notre droit et c'est l'un des honneurs de notre R√©publique de le mettre parfois en pratique. Dans le cas du proc√®s Merah, l'avocat Eric Dupond-Moretti √©tait particuli√®rement volontaire, il y a m√™me vu une cause formidable, "un honneur" a-t-il os√© m√™me proclamer sur France Inter, √† des centaines de milliers d'auditeurs qui n'en ont pas cru leurs oreilles, abasourdis d'entendre que "l'honneur" pouvait √™tre du c√¥t√© de ceux qui d√©fendent un associ√© du criminel terroriste, vous savez ce Merah qui a tir√© une balle dans le dos et dans la t√™te d'une enfant, dans une √©cole juive, apr√®s avoir abattu deux soldats musulmans.

L'honneur, Monsieur Dupont-Moretti, parlons-en quelques instants, au-del√† des envol√©es d√©clamatoires que tout avocat a pris l'habitude de mettre en sc√®ne, y compris devant micros et cam√©ras. Oui, parlons-en, vous concernant. Naturellement, l'Etat de droit dans lequel nous vivons n√©cessite de r√©unir des √©l√©ments factuels et tr√®s pr√©cis, des √©l√©ments de preuve ou des √©l√©ments approchants, ce qu'on appelle en droit des "faisceaux d'indices", avant de pouvoir juger. En l'occurrence, comment √™tre √† ce point aveugl√© - par sa propre et √©gocentrique cause d'avocat r√©put√© √©loquent? - pour ne pas reconna√Ætre le faisceau de tous les indices, ces signaux faibles qui traversent clairement une partie de la famille Merah, et qui font constater, apr√®s des mois d'instruction et des jours denses de proc√®s, que Mohamed Merah, criminel djihadiste en action, √©tait non seulement un assassin d'enfants (juifs) et de jeunes soldats (musulmans) mais qu'il √©tait entour√©, jusque dans sa famille, d'une complicit√© "id√©ologique" tr√®s prononc√©e, qui a contribu√© √† ce passage √† l'acte, le plus meurtrier et odieux.

Comment ne pas vouloir reconna√Ætre ce faisceau d'indices? Surtout, comment tenter de retourner la situation, pr√©tendre que le fr√®re Merah serait injustement accus√© et, par exemple, implorer que nous pensions √† la m√®re du terroriste, "par ce que c'est une m√®re" ?! Comment vouloir jouer, dans ce cas pr√©cis, la corde √©motionnelle parentale pour mieux tenter d'√©craser le souvenir de ces parents, qui ne se remettront jamais de l'assassinat, froid et m√©thodique, de leur enfant? Comment tenter √† ce point la confusion des sentiments, entre des parents de victimes et les parents d'un assassin? Serait-ce la m√™me chose, M. Dupont-Moretti? Il n'y aurait plus de fronti√®res, entre situation humaine des victimes et celle des assassins?

Comment, donc, M. Dupont-Moretti en est-il arriv√© l√†? Certes, tout avocat joue sur toutes les palettes de la subjectivit√©, pour d√©fendre sa cause du moment, qui peut √™tre √† g√©om√©trie tr√®s variable. Mais de quelle cause s'agit-il, pr√©cis√©ment? Celle de d√©fendre un ennemi public? Tout le monde est d'accord, ou presque, pour constater que la France n'est pas l'Iran, qui fait ex√©cuter des "coupables" sur la place publique, le pays des Ayatollahs et des fatwas criminelles nous renvoyant au temps de Terreur des guillotines les plus exp√©ditives.

Non, la cause de M. Dupont-Moretti n'est pas celle qu'on cro√Æt, ou qu'il invoque. Il a d'ailleurs estim√© lui-m√™me, toujours sur France Inter, que la cause de "l'islamisme radical", n'√©tait "pas d√©fendable", sa cause n'est assur√©ment pas celle de l'id√©ologie de l'assassinat individuel ‚Äì d'enfants et de soldats cibl√©s ‚Äì et de l'assassinat collectif ‚Äì au Bataclan par exemple. On respire. Non, sa cause est √† rechercher ailleurs. Et une question se pose: et si la cause que M. Dupont-Moretti d√©fendait avec tant de fougue outranci√®re n'√©tait pas, finalement, la sienne?

Et si celui qui, comme tout avocat, a perdu des combats judiciaires, du proc√®s d'Outreau au proc√®s Bettencourt, ne cherchait pas √† faire croire, quoiqu'il arrive et quelque soit le sujet, qu'il r√©ussissait √† "faire acquitter"? Une image me revient de lui, celle de ce "t√©nor" du barreau comme on dit comme on parle d'un Op√©ra comique, que j'ai connu quand il √©tait tout jeune et d√©j√† tonitruant sur les bancs de la Fac de Droit, √† Lille. On avait tous remarqu√© cet √©tudiant remuant, qui gueulait parfois en pleine amphi, devant mille √©tudiants de 1√®re et 2√®me ann√©e de droit. Ce "fils du peuple", il rigolait bien et on rigolait bien aussi de le voir interpeller les professeurs, il portait sur son torse corpulent un tee-shirt populaire, un "Marcel" comme on disait, pour mieux arborer sa condition sociale d'origine ouvri√®re (r√©elle) alors que tous les autres √©taient en chemises, et parfois en cravates. D√®s ces ann√©es l√†, la "grande gueule" Dupond-Moretti se faisait remarquer, et c'√©tait d√©j√† spectaculaire!

Plus tard, on √©tait quelques uns, ex-√©tudiants de cette fac de Droit, √† √™tre assez admiratifs de voir qu'il s'√©tait si rapidement trac√© un chemin au barreau de Lille, avant de devenir ce "t√©nor" c√©l√®bre que des clients, plus ou moins fortun√©s, s'arrachent pour tenter de d√©fendre leur cause. Mais 30 ans apr√®s ses √©clats de voix, qui remuaient des amphis endormis, Dupond-Moretti n'est-il pas aveugl√© par son propre spectacle, le com√©dien ne s'est-il pas beaucoup us√©, au point de ne pas voir, avec la lucidit√© qui devrait s'imposer √† tous - juges comme avocats - que l'id√©ologie islamiste est une id√©ologie qui peut tuer, √† tour de bras, qu'elle a provoqu√© une guerre civile ayant fait plus de 100 000 morts en Alg√©rie il y a une vingtaine d'ann√©es, qu'elle continue de tuer au Proche-Orient, en Afrique, dans une √©cole juive de France et des salles de concert √† Paris?

On s'interroge encore plus sur cet avocat, peut-√™tre boursoufl√© par son propre ego et un r√¥le th√©√¢tral sur-jou√©, quand il ose dire, sur les ondes de France Inter, que le proc√®s de Nuremberg, qui jugea les criminels nazis, √©tait "plus digne" que le proc√®s Merah?! Comment Dupond-Moretti a-t-il pu dire aussi, entre deux phrases sur cette antenne radio tr√®s √©cout√©e, que son client avait "√©t√© acquitt√©" de l'accusation de complicit√© d'acte terroriste alors que le jugement du tribunal venait de se traduire par une condamnation, 20 ans de prison (pour "association de malfaiteurs terroristes")? Non, Ma√Ætre, le fr√®re Merah n'a pas √©t√© "acquitt√©", il a √©t√© "condamn√©", excusez du peu, il y a plus qu'une nuance!...

Comment Dupond-Moretti peut-il ainsi faire mine de ne plus voir les r√©alit√©s, non seulement de cette d√©cision de justice (qui est d'ailleurs contest√©e et fait l'objet d'un appel) mais du danger que repr√©sente l'id√©ologie djihadiste en France comme ailleurs, id√©ologie dont certains membre de la famille Merah, un fr√®re, une m√®re, ont √©t√© manifestement les porteurs?

M. Dupond-Moretti devrait se reposer. Prendre du recul. Et peut-√™tre, un peu plus tard, avoir une pens√©e, une seule, le temps de sortir de son r√¥le, pour les parents de ces enfants assassin√©s dans une √©cole de Toulouse, pour ces parents, pas plus consolables, des soldats de la R√©publique tu√©s, ou pour ce soldat condamn√© √† vie, lui, √† rester peut-√™tre clou√© dans un fauteuil roulant pour avoir √©t√© l'une des cibles de Mohamed Merah. Ce criminel n'a assur√©ment pas agi tout seul, dans son coin de solitude m√©ditative, lui qui √©tait enivr√© d'images de djihadistes arm√©s, ces images que son fr√®re n'a non seulement pas filtr√©es pour sortir son fr√®re de ses d√©mons mais qu'il a lui-m√™me cautionn√©es, encourageant de fait toutes les d√©rives que cette id√©ologie propagandiste provoque, sur les esprits les plus faibles.

Elie Wiesel disait, √©voquant les crimes totalitaires, qu'il y a trois cat√©gories de gens quand l'id√©ologie du crime absolu entre en action: les victimes, les bourreaux, et les spectateurs. M. Dupont-Moretti s'est sans doute servi de sa cause, d'avocat en perte de rep√®res, pour √™tre aujourd'hui, non pas dans le camp des bourreaux djihadistes mais dans celui, condamnable, des spectateurs complices.

√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TITLE: Dupond-Moretti qui d√©fend Merah ou quand l'√©go th√©√¢tral prend le dessus

SUMMARY:
President Jacob Zuma and Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa during the ANC's 104th-anniversary celebrations in Rustenburg on January 9, 2016.
Thieves and liars will be removed from the ANC at its national elective conference in December, Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa promised on Saturday.
Speaking at a regional ANC rally in the Malamulele Stadium, Ramaphosa said in XiTsonga that the ANC will be "ruined" if the problems it's facing aren't "fixed".
"We will wash and clean the ANC, and it will be the ANC you know.
The ANC plans on holding its 54th National Conference in Gauteng from December 16 to 20 in Gauteng.
TEXT:
President Jacob Zuma and Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa during the ANC's 104th-anniversary celebrations in Rustenburg on January 9, 2016.

Thieves and liars will be removed from the ANC at its national elective conference in December, Deputy President Cyril Ramaphosa promised on Saturday.

Speaking at a regional ANC rally in the Malamulele Stadium, Ramaphosa said in XiTsonga that the ANC will be "ruined" if the problems it's facing aren't "fixed".

"We will wash and clean the ANC, and it will be the ANC you know. The ANC that will work for the people," Ramaphosa said.

"As we go to the conference, we must fix the ANC."

Ramaphosa also promised to "resuscitate" the tripartite alliance who has recently publically criticised the ruling party for not removing President Jacob Zuma.

The ANC presidential candidate ended his address by praising the Limpopo province for being the "laboratory on non-tribalism" in South Africa.

"Limpopo is the most fortunate province in South Africa because we've been [peacefully] living together as Pedis, VhaVenda, and as VaTsonga. We've always been united," Ramaphosa said.

He praised the people of the province for speaking both XiTsonga and TshiVenda which improves the unity in the province.

The ANC plans on holding its 54th National Conference in Gauteng from December 16 to 20 in Gauteng.

Ramaphosa faces stiff competition from former African Union chairperson Nkosazana Dlamini-Zuma who has been endorsed by the ANCYL and ANCWL.
TITLE: Ramaphosa: The ANC Will Remove Liars And Thieves At Its Elective Conference In December

SUMMARY:
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has rejected New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern's offer to take offshore asylum seekers from Nauru and Manus Island.
Addressing media after the meeting, Turnbull said the federal government would not take up New Zealand's offer to take 150 asylum seekers currently in PNG and Nauru.
"We thank New Zealand for making an offer, we are not taking it up at this time," Turnbull said.
@TurnbullMalcolm says he appreciates NZs offer to take 150 refugees, but will be pursuing the US settlement deal https://t.co/mkJkNUFPPB pic.twitter.com/ZML7HhV9bJ November 5, 2017Turnbull said while he appreciated New Zealand's offer his government would prioritise its existing refugee deal with the US.
"I did renewed New Zealand's offer to take 150 refugees from Manus Island and Nauru ...
TEXT:
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has rejected New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern's offer to take offshore asylum seekers from Nauru and Manus Island.

Ardern is in Sydney for a whirlwind visit after being elected New Zealand PM in October. The brief stop in Australia is the Labour leader's first overseas trip as Prime Minister.

Turnbull and Ardern met on Sunday morning at Kirribili House where they discussed a range of bilateral issues including terrorism, regional security, trade, North Korea and the crisis on Manus Island.

Addressing media after the meeting, Turnbull said the federal government would not take up New Zealand's offer to take 150 asylum seekers currently in PNG and Nauru.

"We thank New Zealand for making an offer, we are not taking it up at this time," Turnbull said.

.@TurnbullMalcolm says he appreciates NZs offer to take 150 refugees, but will be pursuing the US settlement deal https://t.co/mkJkNUFPPB pic.twitter.com/ZML7HhV9bJ November 5, 2017

Turnbull said while he appreciated New Zealand's offer his government would prioritise its existing refugee deal with the US. Under that agreement, 1,250 refugees from the two Pacific nations will be resettled in the US.

Ardern said the offer, originally made by her predecessor John Key, still stood.

"I did renewed New Zealand's offer to take 150 refugees from Manus Island and Nauru ... It is a very genuine offer," she said.

"From the perspective of New Zealand we want our offer to stay on the table so we can assist as much as we are able."

The comments come as roughly 600 asylum seekers on Manus Island remain without power, food and water in an attempt by authorities to encourage them to seek refuge on the island.

The situation emerged after the controversial PNG detention facility was shut down this week.

The crisis has escalated to the point where the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has labelled it an unfolding humanitarian crisis.

Opposition leader Bill Shorten has previously urged Turnbull to take up the deal, saying that it would not put "people smugglers back in business".
TITLE: Turnbull Knocks Back New Zealand's Refugee Offer

SUMMARY:
"Some people tried to ensure the contribution of Sardar Patel is forgotten," said Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Sardar Patel who used force against the Nizam of Hyderabad fits the bill.
"By invoking Sardar Patel, Modi invites us to see him as the integrator.
On National Unity Day it's worth remembering that Sardar Patel.
That's an idea of national unity that cannot be captured even in the biggest of statues.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel must be chuckling somewhere. Fifty-seven years after his death, the Iron Man of India has never been more in demand. Everyone wants to bask in his reflected glory.

"Some people tried to ensure the contribution of Sardar Patel is forgotten," said Prime Minister Narendra Modi. He added that his "momentous service and monumental contribution to India can never be forgotten."

Rahul Gandhi called him "an embodiment of integrity and strength, one of the architects of (the) idea of India."

President Ram Nath Kovind hailed him as "India's Man of Iron, of Integrity and of Integration."

While Bengal angrily rebuffed a directive from the UGC to send them video recordings of events marking Sardar Patel's birth anniversary in institutes of higher learning, Mamata Banerjee made sure to remember the "great Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel on his birth anniversary" and to greet all her brothers and sisters on National Unity Day.

In short, Vallabhbhai Patel has emerged as the man for all seasons for India's political parties.

It is undeniable that under the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty, the legacy of Patel, like all national leaders, got pushed into the background, while a hundred Nehru-Gandhis bloomed around us. An RTI application in 2009 showed that over 450 government projects and schemes were named after the Nehru Gandhi family ‚Äî 98 educational institutions, 51 awards, 39 hospitals and so on. October 31 became memorialised as Indira Gandhi's death anniversary as opposed to Sardar Patel's birth anniversary.

It is also undeniable as the Congress is now quick to point out that Patel said "The speeches of the Sangh leaders are poisonous. It is a result of this venom that Mahatma Gandhi has been assassinated." In fact, Patel, one of the last to speak to Gandhi before his assassination, was so shocked that within months he had a massive heart attack. He attributed it to his bottled up grief at the death of Gandhi. Patel banned the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). Patel also lifted that ban though with a rider, that the RSS should never participate in active politics.

This tug-o-war over Sardar Patel proves two things.

One, the Congress is paying the price for sidelining many leaders, or rather their legacies, because in the Indira Gandhi era, it started morphing into a party of yes-men and sycophants to one family. Nehru and Patel indeed sparred and publicly disagreed with each other. But they also dissuaded each other from resigning at key moments because they believed it would not be good for the country. The Bharatiya Janata Party has even launched a WhatsApp campaign in Gujarat cataloguing the insults meted out by the Congress to the two sons of Gujarat ‚Äî Sardar Patel and Morarji Desai.If the Congress had always accorded Sardar Patel enough respect and prestige, it would not now have to defend him from the claims of the BJP.

But the BJP is also betraying its hunger for its own icon of the Independence movement. Gandhi is obviously off limits. Nehru belongs to the other side. Shyama Prasad Mukherjee is not iconic enough for the masses. Patel is the only one it can lay any claim to. It's a shaky claim since Patel was a Congressman through and through, whatever his differences with the leadership. Unlike Mukherjee he did not leave the government to found his own party after falling out with Nehru.

"In this context it is imperative for a party bereft of a nation-building iconography to borrow an icon, who invokes the sacrificial sentiments of the freedom struggle," writes Rajesh Ramachandran. Sardar Patel who used force against the Nizam of Hyderabad fits the bill. As Mukul Kesavan has noted back in 2003, Modi liked to be called Chhote Sardar. "By invoking Sardar Patel, Modi invites us to see him as the integrator. His task is to keep India from disintegration." So desperate is the BJP that some in it even falsely claimed Nehru skipped Patel's funeral when, in fact, he was apparently so bereft and broken, Rajagopalachari had to deliver the oration.

In a way, the two men, both giants, sometimes at odds with each other, complemented each other and lived up to Gandhi's idea that India needed both of them. What's ironic now is that we are paying lip service to Patel by building giant statues and inaugurating a Run for Unity, but we forget that the strongest way to forge unity is to learn to listen to each other. We think that nation building is about playing the national anthem in movie theatres, building mega statues, axing comedy skits targeting the prime minister, hauling students to court for sedition. We want dissent to be immediately dubbed anti-national.

But the man being hailed as the counterpoint to Nehru had this to say about him: My services will be at your disposal, I hope, for the rest of my life and you will have unquestioned loyalty and devotion from me.... Our combination is unbreakable and, therein, lies our strength.

"Therein lies our strength". On National Unity Day it's worth remembering that Sardar Patel. Nehru and he might have come from very different milieus but they were united by their love for India and Gandhi. Patel understood their differences of opinion could actually strengthen India and not split it. At a time when dissent is quickly dubbed anti-national, it seems hard to believe that once it was possible to serve in a cabinet together and disagree with each other on a matter of principle and still serve together.

That's an idea of national unity that cannot be captured even in the biggest of statues.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: Sardar Patel's Idea Of National Unity Cannot Be Celebrated By Building Giant Statues

Aber dann geschah etwas, das ich nicht erwartet hatte.
Ganz traurig war das f√ºr mich." Ihr L√§cheln war verschwunden und Sie sagten einfach: "Das muss richtig weh getan haben, oder?
Die Stationen, die ich sonst immer Stop f√ºr Stop mitz√§hlte, rauschten jetzt unbemerkt an mir vorbei.
Ich war Ihnen in dieser Stunde im Zug n√§her als ich es den meisten meiner Freunde jemals gewesen bin.
TEXT:
Liebe Fremde,

vergangene Woche stieg ich nach einem langen Arbeitstag in den Zug. Ganz in Gedanken vertieft blickte ich aus dem milchigen Fenster, lie√ü den Tag sacken, als Sie sich neben mich setzten.

Sie sprachen mich an. Und ich warf Ihnen einen abweisenden Blick zu. Ich war wirklich nicht in der Stimmung f√ºr Smalltalk.

"Kommen Sie aus Stuttgart?", fragten Sie mich und deuteten auf meine Tasche, die tats√§chlich von einem kleinen Stuttgarter Label stammt. Ihr Blick ruhte erwartungsvoll auf mir.

Ich hatte eigentlich keinen Nerv f√ºr Smalltalk, aber Ihr L√§cheln l√∂ste etwas in mir aus.

Er lie√ü mich realisieren: Au√üer Ihnen l√§chelte niemand in dem ganzen Waggon. Die Gesichter der Menschen sprachen ihre eigene Sprache. Alle waren fertig von der Arbeit, der Uni, der Schule. Alle wollten nur nach Hause.

Ich dachte: Wieder eines dieser kurzen Gespr√§che, die man aus H√∂flichkeit f√ºhren muss

Die Stimmung f√ºhlte sich wie ein grauer Schleier an, der sich √ºber den ganzen Waggon gelegt hatte.

Nicht einmal die Kassiererin bei dm hatte zur√ºckgel√§chelt, als ich ihr ein paar Minuten zuvor am Bahnhof meine Payback-Karte gereicht hatte.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Ich habe eine Woche lang jeden Tag einen Fremden angesprochen - das ist mir passiert

Sie begannen also, √ºber meine Tasche zu reden und ich dachte: Na toll, wieder eines dieser kurzen Gespr√§che, die man aus H√∂flichkeit f√ºhren muss. Aber dann geschah etwas, das ich nicht erwartet hatte.

Die Smalltalk-Barriere war innerhalb k√ºrzester Zeit wie weggeblasen. Wir unterhielten uns √ºber unsere Familien, das Reisen und die Freiheiten meiner Generation. Zum ersten Mal seit Langem sa√ü jemand neben mir, der wirklich zuh√∂rte.

Zuh√∂ren, nicht um zu antworten

Nicht, um zu antworten. Nicht, um eine besondere Information herauszupicken, die Sie auf sich beziehen konnten, wie "Oh, du hast also gerade eine Trennung hinter dir? Also bei mir war es damals wirklich schwer, ich habe n√§chtelang geweint."

Sie waren jemand, der zuh√∂rt, um zu verstehen. Jemand, der nachhakt, mitf√ºhlt. Und das nicht, weil er auf irgendetwas hinaus ist.

Irgendwann fiel das Thema auf einen guten alten Freund von mir, der vor ein paar Wochen in einem Motorradunfall verungl√ºckt ist.

Von Ihnen kam kein: "Wow schlimm. Ich hatte da auch mal einen Freund, der in einen Unfall verwickelt war. Ganz traurig war das f√ºr mich." Ihr L√§cheln war verschwunden und Sie sagten einfach: "Das muss richtig weh getan haben, oder? Wie war das, als Sie es erfahren haben?"

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Schluss mit der Oberfl√§chlichkeit!

Ich muss Sie komplett entgeistert angesehen haben. So offen und unverstellt hatte mich das noch nie jemand gefragt. Nicht einmal meine engsten Freunde. Ich muss zugeben, Sie haben mich in dem Moment zu Tr√§nen ger√ºhrt.

Dabei kannte ich nicht einmal Ihren Namen

Auch Sie teilten etwas von sich mit mir. Sie erz√§hlten mir, wie Sie die Liebe ihres Lebens verloren und wie gerne Sie Oma geworden w√§ren. Es f√ºhlte sich an als w√ºrden wir uns seit Jahren kennen. Dabei kannte ich nicht einmal Ihren Namen. Es hei√üt ja oft: Ein Fremder kann dir manchmal n√§her als dein engster Vertrauter sein. An diesem Tag im Zug erlebte ich es am eigenen Leibe.

Wir fuhren etwa eine Stunde und redeten ohne Pause. Die Stationen, die ich sonst immer Stop f√ºr Stop mitz√§hlte, rauschten jetzt unbemerkt an mir vorbei.

Dann irgendwann kamen wir in Ebersberg an. Ihre Station. Sie erhoben sich und richteten Ihren Mantel. Ich wollte wirklich nicht, dass Sie gehen.

Gerade hatte ich Ihnen doch so ziemlich mein ganzes Leben anvertraut. Sie bedankten sich f√ºr das bereicherndeGespr√§ch und mit einem letzten L√§cheln schwanden sie durch die automatische T√ºr.

Da sa√ü ich. Wieder allein mit all den m√ºden und kaputten Gesichtern. Und Wehmut √ºberkam mich.

Liebe fremde Frau im Zug: Ich wei√ü weder Ihren Namen, noch wo Sie im Moment sind. Aber ich m√∂chte mich bei Ihnen bedanken - daf√ºr, dass Sie mir gezeigt haben: Es gibt noch Menschen, die wirklich zuh√∂ren. Nicht, um zu antworten, sondern um zu verstehen.

Ich war Ihnen in dieser Stunde im Zug n√§her als ich es den meisten meiner Freunde jemals gewesen bin.

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform f√ºr alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.

TITLE: An die Fremde im Zug, mit der ich in einer Stunde mehr teilte als mit meinen engsten Freunden

SUMMARY:
Australia Post is the national supplier of postal services in Australia.
Australia Post is putting on thousands of extra workers over the holiday period as the organisation gears up for its biggest ever Christmas.
Record parcel volumes were already being processed at major sorting facilities across the country, Australia Post said, even though Christmas was still 30 working days away.
The Christmas rush has already arrived at Australia Post.
WATCH: A surge in online shopping deliveries across the state has prompted Australia Post to trial a new vehicle.
TEXT:
Australia Post is the national supplier of postal services in Australia.

Australia Post is putting on thousands of extra workers over the holiday period as the organisation gears up for its biggest ever Christmas.

Record parcel volumes were already being processed at major sorting facilities across the country, Australia Post said, even though Christmas was still 30 working days away.

Group Chief Operations Bob Black said the organisation was hiring 2,000 additional workers to help manage the record influx of deliveries over the festive season.

The Christmas rush has already arrived at Australia Post. #9Today pic.twitter.com/UsaUtgLdRs November 3, 2017

"We'll also have an extra 200 vans, motorbikes and trucks out on the road -- that's over 15,000 vehicles out in total delivering those very special Christmas purchases," Black said on Saturday.

Australia Post was also introducing a SMS notification this year to assist with the history-making number of parcels expected to be sent in the run up to December 25, he said.

Many post offices will be extending their operating hours in an effort to handle the extra demand from to customers wanting to send greeting cards and send parcels.

WATCH: A surge in online shopping deliveries across the state has prompted Australia Post to trial a new vehicle. @ChelseaCarey_9 #9News pic.twitter.com/EuZRgmldhY ‚Äî Nine News Adelaide (@9NewsAdel) November 3, 2017

The moves come after Australia Post's parcel service was last month thrown into chaos after a meltdown in its shipping and tracking service.

Small business customers were reportedly met with an error message when trying to log into the eParcel service last month, temporarily stalling operations at warehouses and small businesses.
TITLE: AusPost Hires Thousands Of Workers For Christmas Parcel Rush

SUMMARY:
The most infuriating thing is when your boyfriend refuses to tell you what he wants for Christmas.
After all, you and him both know that he's getting a present whether he likes it or not!
While some men will eventually cave and tell you, there are still those stubborn few who will leave you clueless.
But before you start stressing out about what you're going to get your man, take a deep breath and have a look at our fun Christmas gift ideas for your boyfriend.
Whether your guy is a sophisticated businessman or a casual, cool geek, we have stylish finds for all that they'll actually like.
TEXT:

But before you start stressing out about what you're going to get your man, take a deep breath and have a look at our fun Christmas gift ideas for your boyfriend. TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

SONEBHADRA -- A German national was allegedly beaten by a railway contractor at the Robertsganj railway station in the district, police said today.

The incident comes days after a Swiss couple were attacked near the railway station at Agra's Fatehpur Sikri.

Holger Ereek was allegedly beaten by railway contractor Aman Kumar yesterday after which the station master informed the police.

Circle officer Vivekanand Tiwari said that the accused has been arrested.

However, the railway contractor alleged that when he greeted Ereek by saying "welcome to India", he hit him.

The victim refused to talk to the media.

On October 22, the Swiss couple from Lausanne in Switzerland, Quentin Jeremy Clerc (24) and his girlfriend Marie Droz (24), was chased and attacked with stones and sticks by a group of five youths in Fatehpur Sikri, triggering widespread outrage.

The couple was quoted as saying in a media report that they were strolling near the station at Fatehpur Sikri after a day in Agra when a group of youths started following them and later attacked.

The couple said as they lay on the ground bloodied and bruised, bystanders began taking videos of them on their mobile phones, the report said.

All the accused were arrested.

External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj had sought a report from the UP government on the attack.

Union Minister of State for Tourism K J Alphons had dashed off a letter to Yogi Adityanath, saying the incident could have a negative impact on the image of the country.

Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police Sulkhan Singh had issued a list of guidelines, including deployment of policemen in plain clothes, more patrolling and installation of CCTV cameras, to prevent such incidents.

The couple were also offered a free stay in 5-star hotel in the national capital as a "token of concern" by Alphons.
TITLE: After Attack On Swiss Couple, German Man Allegedly Assaulted In UP

SUMMARY:
Partout en France, des femmes et des hommes s'approprient le message.
Ce pourcentage plus √©lev√© signifie que les femmes travaillent encore un peu plus gratuitement: du 7 novembre √† 16h34, on est pass√© au 3 novembre √† 11h44.
Mais alors, que fait-on pour que l'ann√©e prochaine et celles d'apr√®s, la journ√©e pour l'√©galit√© salariale soit d√©cal√©e √† plus tard, toujours plus tard, pour enfin dispara√Ætre?
Comment rendre un peu plus √©galitaires les cong√©s parentaux, afin que la responsabilit√© de l'enfant incombe aux deux parents et que la femme n'en fasse pas seule les frais dans sa carri√®re professionnelle?
Ce n'est que comme cela que nous arriverons un jour, peut-√™tre, √† d√©caler la journ√©e de l'√©galit√© salariale √† plus tard.
TEXT:
Vous avez peut-√™tre entendu parler du #7novembre16h34. Lanc√©e en 2016 par l'association Les Glorieuses, l'initiative avait pour objectif de faire prendre conscience des in√©galit√©s salariales entre femmes et hommes. Pourquoi cette date et cette heure, pr√©cis√©ment? Tout simplement parce qu'en convertissant le pourcentage de diff√©rence salariale entre femmes et hommes -15,1% en 2010 selon Eurostat, organisme de statistiques de l'Union europ√©enne- nous avions conclu que les femmes travaillaient gratuitement pendant 38,2 jours de l'ann√©e. En d'autres termes, qu'elles n'√©taient plus r√©mun√©r√©es √† partir du 7 novembre, √† 16h34.

Quelques jours avant la date fatidique, l'appel est lanc√©. Le concept, emprunt√© aux Islandaises, qui avaient manifest√© le 24 octobre √† 14h38 pour la m√™me raison, frappe les esprits. Partout en France, des femmes et des hommes s'approprient le message. Le 7 novembre √† 16h34, ce sont des centaines de personnes qui se rassemblent sur les places de grandes villes fran√ßaises. Au-del√† de la mobilisation physique, l'op√©ration a un retentissement fort sur Internet et dans les m√©dias: la p√©tition pour faire du 7 novembre la journ√©e de l'√©galit√© salariale est sign√©e par plusieurs milliers de personnes. Pendant quelques jours, le sujet est au c≈ìur des d√©bats. Le temps d'un instant, l'in√©galit√© salariale entre femmes et hommes devient une patate chaude ‚Äìsur Twitter, le hashtag #7novembre16h34 est sur tous les fils, notamment ceux de femmes et hommes politiques de tous bords. Pourtant, une fois le souffl√© retomb√©, aucune mesure concr√®te n'est appliqu√©e pour affronter cette r√©alit√©. Ce n'est malheureusement pas tellement √©tonnant, mais cela reste dommage. D√©courag√©es, nous? Jamais! Le 7 novembre n'√©tait que le d√©but.

En 2017, Eurostat publie ses nouveaux chiffres, bas√©s sur l'ann√©e 2015. Avec le temps, l'√©cart s'est creus√©: ce n'est plus 15,1%, mais 15,8% de diff√©rence qui existe entre les salaires des femmes et des hommes en France. Ce pourcentage plus √©lev√© signifie que les femmes travaillent encore un peu plus gratuitement: du 7 novembre √† 16h34, on est pass√© au 3 novembre √† 11h44. C'est donc cette date et cette heure que nous avons choisies pour marquer le coup cette ann√©e.

Bien √©videmment, on pourra objecter que le gender pay gap d'Eurostat est calcul√© sans distinction de m√©tiers et de secteurs et n'est donc pas repr√©sentatif de l'√©cart qu'il peut exister entre deux personnes de sexe diff√©rent occupant le m√™me poste. C'est l√† que l'Observatoire des In√©galit√©s entre en jeu! En se basant sur les donn√©es de 2012, il fait √©tat d'un √©cart de salaire de 12,8% entre femmes et hommes, pour des temps complets √† m√©tier √©quivalent. En retirant les effets de structure qui peuvent expliquer une partie de cet √©cart (√¢ge, type de contrat, secteur d'activit√© et taille de l'entreprise), l'Observatoire des In√©galit√©s tire la conclusion suivante: √† m√©tier √©gal et dans un contexte similaire, 10,5% des √©carts de salaires entre femmes et hommes demeurent inexpliqu√©s. Si nous avons d√©cid√© de garder le chiffre d'Eurostat dans la mesure o√π il refl√®te une situation plus globale, il est √©galement important d'avoir ce deuxi√®me chiffre en t√™te qui, m√™me s'il est un peu plus bas, est peut-√™tre encore plus frappant.

Mais alors, que fait-on pour que l'ann√©e prochaine et celles d'apr√®s, la journ√©e pour l'√©galit√© salariale soit d√©cal√©e √† plus tard, toujours plus tard, pour enfin dispara√Ætre? Si nous souhaitons vraiment cela, il ne suffit pas de parler. Il existe des mesures concr√®tes, d√©j√† appliqu√©es par certains pays, qui pourraient √™tre mises en place en France. Par exemple, depuis avril 2017, au Royaume-Uni, les entreprises de plus de 250 salari√©s doivent publier un rapport annuel sur les √©carts de salaires entre leurs employ√©es et leurs employ√©s. Une pratique qui, mise en place depuis 2013 en Australie, semble avoir eu un impact fort sur la prise de conscience des in√©galit√©s entre femmes et hommes et avoir am√©lior√© certains comportements. Une telle r√©glementation (et on pourrait en imaginer d'autres) tendrait tr√®s probablement √† baisser le pourcentage d'√©cart salarial entre femmes et hommes en France.

Mais il faut aller encore plus loin. Il ne s'agit pas simplement d'appliquer des sanctions ‚Äìil s'agit de d√©raciner une habitude culturelle bien ancr√©e. Il est fondamental de prendre en compte les raisons de cet √©cart et d'envisager toutes les mesures qui permettraient de les faire dispara√Ætre. En vrac: comment briser le fameux plafond de verre, qui emp√™che les femmes d'acc√©der aux postes √† tr√®s forte responsabilit√© et donc tr√®s bien r√©mun√©r√©s? Comment faire en sorte que les hommes prennent en charge davantage de t√¢ches domestiques, afin que certaines femmes ne soient pas contraintes de choisir un emploi √† mi-temps? Comment rendre un peu plus √©galitaires les cong√©s parentaux, afin que la responsabilit√© de l'enfant incombe aux deux parents et que la femme n'en fasse pas seule les frais dans sa carri√®re professionnelle? Et puis, plus g√©n√©ralement, comment enrayer les discriminations que subissent les femmes dans de nombreux domaines, justifiant aux yeux de leurs employeurs un salaire moins √©lev√©? R√©pondre √† ces questions avec des mesures concr√®tes n'arrivera pas en un jour, ni en une ann√©e. Mais nous pouvons au moins commencer √† nous les poser et tenter d'y r√©pondre. Ce n'est que comme cela que nous arriverons un jour, peut-√™tre, √† d√©caler la journ√©e de l'√©galit√© salariale √† plus tard. Voire ‚Äìsoyons fous!- √† ne m√™me plus en avoir besoin.
