TITLE: Malusi Gigaba Did Not Memorise an 8,000 Word Speech -- In Case You Were Still Wondering

SUMMARY:
Ich erlebe es immer wieder: Eltern fragen ihr 4-j√§hriges Kind, ob es das Medikament nehmen wolle oder nicht.
Eltern sollten die Kinder nicht wie kleine Erwachsene behandelnSie bestimmen mit ihren Meinungen, W√ºnschen und Unzufriedenheiten die Richtung und die Stimmung in der Familie.
Manche Eltern sehen das mit Stolz und sind sogar so ehrlich und nennen ihr Kind "Chef".
Und irgendwann kippt die Situation und der vermeintliche Chef ist anderen Kindern hinterher, die sich an den Leitplanken der elterlichen F√ºhrung entlang entwickeln konnten.
Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.
TEXT:
Ich erlebe es immer wieder: Eltern fragen ihr 4-j√§hriges Kind, ob es das Medikament nehmen wolle oder nicht. Oder der unwissende Papa gibt die Frage des Kinderarztes an den 5-J√§hrigen weiter: "Hustest du nachts?"

Was gut gemeint ist, n√§mlich Kindern fr√ºh schon mit Respekt zu begegnen, ist an dieser Stelle kontraproduktiv: Eine solche Behandlung √ºberfordert die Kleinen. Denn sie k√∂nnen f√ºr Vieles noch gar keine Verantwortung √ºbernehmen. Und selbst wenn sie es vermeintlich k√∂nnen, tut es ihnen h√§ufig langfristig nicht gut.

Bei gewieften Kindern passiert n√§mlich Folgendes: Sie nutzen diese Situation aus und werden St√ºck f√ºr St√ºck zum Chef der Familie.

Eltern sollten die Kinder nicht wie kleine Erwachsene behandeln

Sie bestimmen mit ihren Meinungen, W√ºnschen und Unzufriedenheiten die Richtung und die Stimmung in der Familie. Manche Eltern sehen das mit Stolz und sind sogar so ehrlich und nennen ihr Kind "Chef".

Dabei sind die Kinder mit vier, f√ºnf Jahren in einem wichtigen Lebensalter, das ihnen auch (und das vor allem im Vorbild der Eltern) sinnvolles und ethisches Handeln, gesunde Lebensweise und richtige Entscheidungen mitgeben sollte.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Habt ihr originelle Eltern? Welcher Name in eurem Geburtsjahr am beliebtesten war

Behandeln Eltern ihre Kinder in dieser Zeit wie kleine Erwachsene, die ihre Entscheidungen selbst treffen, sind die Kleinen bei einem entscheidenden Entwicklungsschritt auf sich allein gestellt.

Es droht ein Entwicklungsstillstand

Das kommt einem Entwicklungsstillstand in diesem Bereich gleich. Und irgendwann kippt die Situation und der vermeintliche Chef ist anderen Kindern hinterher, die sich an den Leitplanken der elterlichen F√ºhrung entlang entwickeln konnten.

Trauen Sie sich also, Ihrem Kind gegen√ºber Chef zu sein. Das hat nichts mit mangelndem Respekt Ihrem Kind gegen√ºber zu tun. Sie als Eltern haben nun mal die Richtlinien der Erziehung in der Hand.

Ihr Kind braucht F√ºhrung und vor allem die Sicherheit, immer noch jemanden √ºber sich zu haben, wenn es nicht weiter wei√ü.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Ein Hirnforscher erkl√§rt, was Kinder mehr als alles andere von ihren Eltern brauchen

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform f√ºr alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.

(lk)
TITLE: Liebe Eltern, ihr seid die Chefs, also verhaltet euch auch so

SUMMARY:
In our almost 30 years of being together, we've moved more than 20 times.
How do I manage to get through this renovation ‚Äî something I didn't see myself doing ever again, on a property I never envisioned owning ‚Äî with my marriage intact?
First thing's first: when embarking on a renovation, whether it's one you're excited about or dreading, it is important to get your heart right.
Don't take the renovation personallyMeaning, you and your partner are not likely to agree on every single detail, and that is OK.
Everybody is entitled to their opinion, and just because yours might not be lining up on every aspect of the renovation doesn't mean your partner doesn't love you, or doesn't think that you've got good taste... most of the time, ha!
TEXT:
My husband and I used to flip properties back in the day before his work as an actor led to his latest television series being on air for what is now their 11th season. We flipped houses for two reasons: 1. because he is a naturally gifted handyman who has an incredible eye for detail, combined with impeccable taste; and 2. because it was how we made money in between his acting gigs.

In our almost 30 years of being together, we've moved more than 20 times. Most of these moves were into rentals. We've purchased and flipped four houses, three of which were total gut jobs. If you've ever renovated with your partner, even just one room in your home, you can appreciate how difficult it is to do that without losing your cool.

It has been more than four years since we've stood side by side renovating. The last project was when we built our main property in Toronto from 2012-2013. We had some minor renovations on our home in California three years ago, but for the most part I handled that project on my own because of my husband's filming schedule.

The result? We managed to avoid many of the normal renovation arguments that come with two people, each with their own opinions and visions, at the helm. It was probably the most enjoyable renovation I've ever lived through, and although it went smoothly, I still swore that I wouldn't do another one. I'd hit my max.

You and your partner are not likely to agree on every single detail, and that is OK.

Because, let me tell you: every single house of the 20-plus, rented or owned, that we've lived in needed some sort of TLC from us. And frankly, I'm over it. I'm 48 and I want to head into this next chapter of my life not discussing how many bedrooms I think are the right amount for a solid return on investment, or whether or not people will be able to tell the difference between man-made stone tile and marble.

Even though this was my commitment and conviction, I've somehow found myself as the brand-new owner of an uninhabitable shack in the woods on a lake in Northern Ontario. Which has landed me squarely back into reno-land, a land I swore I would never return to. So, now what? How do I manage to get through this renovation ‚Äî something I didn't see myself doing ever again, on a property I never envisioned owning ‚Äî with my marriage intact?

Never say never again

Well, I need to dig into my relationship archives for this one. First thing's first: when embarking on a renovation, whether it's one you're excited about or dreading, it is important to get your heart right. What I find myself struggling with at the moment is letting go of the promise I made myself to "never do this again." Life is a funny thing: When you think you know the direction you're headed in, it will always throw you a curve ball to check your "flexibility." So here I am, slowly getting my heart and mind behind this new cottage project.

Get on the same page financially

You and your partner need to sit down and set a realistic, firm budget for your renovation, and then add 25 per cent to that (for the inevitable overages). If you're willing to spend time researching finishing items, such as kitchen cabinets, appliances, etc. yourself instead of having a contractor source everything for you, you can save lots of money. Remember, everything your contractor does for you costs you money. Everything you can source yourself saves you money.

Don't take the renovation personally

Meaning, you and your partner are not likely to agree on every single detail, and that is OK. Them not liking the fact that you might think that a lime-green kitchen would be "bright and cheerful" doesn't translate into them thinking that you have terrible taste. Everybody is entitled to their opinion, and just because yours might not be lining up on every aspect of the renovation doesn't mean your partner doesn't love you, or doesn't think that you've got good taste... most of the time, ha!

Hear each other out

Whether it be about design ideas or budget concerns, it is important during a renovation for both parties to feel like their suggestions, fears or worries are being heard and respected.

Be grateful

It really is a fantastic blessing to have the means and the opportunity in life to be able to purchase and own property. Then, if you also have the ability to turn that property into your oasis, your own personal slice of heaven, it's the proverbial icing on the cake. Do don't forget to be grateful and express it often to your partner. If you focus on these few suggestions, take it from somebody who has "been there, done that" many times, it will help you not only survive your renovation, but thrive through them.

Follow HuffPost Canada Blogs on Facebook

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Our Marriage Has Survived Almost 30 Years Of Home Renovation Stress

SUMMARY:
Another such case has come to light from Maharashtra's Amaravati after a woman filed a missing complaint to the police for her husband and in-laws.
She said that while her husband, Varun, was not the problem, he had a hard time convincing his family.
The in-laws, Sangeeta has claimed, has stopped speaking to her after the birth of her baby in June.
While she is in Amravati, in her maternal home, the trio have gone missing from Virar (West).
The police are still trying to figure out where the six people have gone missing.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

Even as the government in India has campaigned to save the girl child with its Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao Yojana, ground reality has changed little. To this day mothers and girl children continue to be abandoned by families because of the baby's gender.

Another such case has come to light from Maharashtra's Amaravati after a woman filed a missing complaint to the police for her husband and in-laws.

Times of India reported that Sangeeta Tiwari, an analyst with a multinational in Pune, suspects that she has been deserted by her husband and in-laws because she gave birth to a girl child. She said that while her husband, Varun, was not the problem, he had a hard time convincing his family.

The in-laws, Sangeeta has claimed, has stopped speaking to her after the birth of her baby in June.

While she is in Amravati, in her maternal home, the trio have gone missing from Virar (West). She used to live in Pune with her husband who is a graphic designer.

The Times of India report says that they family is said to have gone to Nashik to perform religious rights of Satishchandra, the father-in-law, Varun, her brother-in-law Ashwini and Satishchandra's brother Surendra, his wife Malati and their 16-year-old daughter too were missing.

She that her husband's phone was unreachable, and Ashwini took the call but did not speak.

The police are still trying to figure out where the six people have gone missing.
TITLE: Woman Claims Husband, In-laws Have Abandoned Her And 'Gone Missing' After She Gave Birth To A Girl

SUMMARY:
Job search site Indeed released its list of the 10 "hottest" companies in Canada for 2017 Thursday, providing an interesting look at the the firms Canadians want to work for most.
Indeed looked at the average interest, or traffic, any given job posting garnered between April and September this year.
It then looked at how much extra interest job titles from specific companies received compared to that average.
'Outliers' in their industriesUsing this method, the firm found that job postings at Dell, for example, scored 27 per cent more traffic than the average listing.
"These companies are the outliers in their respective industries, with highly attractive job postings to a larger than expected group of hopefuls."
TEXT:
An employee walks in a hallway at Google Canada's engineering headquarters in Waterloo, Ont. on Jan. 22, 2016.

If you're wondering which companies are captivating the hearts and minds (and cover letters) of Canadian job-seekers, look no further.

Job search site Indeed released its list of the 10 "hottest" companies in Canada for 2017 Thursday, providing an interesting look at the the firms Canadians want to work for most.

Indeed looked at the average interest, or traffic, any given job posting garnered between April and September this year. It then looked at how much extra interest job titles from specific companies received compared to that average.

'Outliers' in their industries

Using this method, the firm found that job postings at Dell, for example, scored 27 per cent more traffic than the average listing.

"These 'hot' companies could be seeing above-average traffic due to a number of factors like expansion, new products or increased marketing activity," Jodi Kasten, Indeed Canada's managing director, said in a press release.

"These companies are the outliers in their respective industries, with highly attractive job postings to a larger than expected group of hopefuls."

Check out the slideshow bellow for Indeed's full list:
TITLE: Companies Canadians Want To Work For Most Include Dell And Air Canada: Indeed Survey

SUMMARY:
Per Valerio Mastandrea, che lo incarna in "The Place", "semplicemente qualcuno che non esiste: tutti i miei 'clienti' in realt√† parlano da soli".
La notiziona, molto in linea coi tempi, √® che si √® innamorato di una serie TV, come molti di noi comuni mortali.
E' la formula, eminentemente televisiva, di "In Treatment", parlo di quello perch√© la serie-culto di Genovese non l'ho vista.
Usarla per un film √® una scommessa audace, sicuramente poco ruffiana, mi aspetto un passaparola controverso e mi chiedo come funzioner√† al botteghino.
Di Valerio Mastandrea ( come Giallini e Rohrwacher in transito da "Perfetti Sconosciuti") voglio dire una cosa soltanto : √® una benedizione.
TEXT:
Per Marco Giallini "√® un mostro, il pi√π mostro di tutti". Per Rocco Papaleo "un'occasione che ti d√† la vita per riflettere, pi√π tutti gli archetipi, a partire da Faust." Per il regista Paolo Genovese "√® quel qualcosa con cui facciamo i conti quando dobbiamo prendere una decisione cruciale : per qualcuno √® Dio, per altri il Diavolo, o la propria coscienza, ognuno usa uno specchio diverso". Per Valerio Mastandrea, che lo incarna in "The Place", "semplicemente qualcuno che non esiste: tutti i miei 'clienti' in realt√† parlano da soli".

La domanda era : "Chi √® ?" Chi √® il misterioso individuo seduto a un tavolo di caff√® che a ogni visitatore propone miracoli in cambio di pessime azioni? Dopo il miracolo di "Perfetti Sconosciuti" ( 16 milioni di incasso, premi a sfare, tre remake in cantiere in Francia, Spagna e Usa ), Paolo Genovese spiazza il suo pubblico in palpitante attesa di un nuovo film strapparisate. La notiziona, molto in linea coi tempi, √® che si √® innamorato di una serie TV, come molti di noi comuni mortali. La serie √® "Booth at the end", e da questa "The Place", che sta per arrivare in sala ed √® l'opposto di una commedia scoppiettante, prende spunto.

"Perfetti Sconosciuti" era uno psicodramma comico chiuso in una stanza. "The Place" non esce mai dal bar-ristorante dove la cameriera Sabrina Ferilli di tanto in tanto rifornisce di caff√® ed esigue pietanze- rigorosamente vegetali- l'occupante fisso del tavolo d'angolo. Dove si alterna, a colloquio, un fiume di personaggi animati da un sogno impossibile.

Marco Giallini √® un poliziotto che vuole ritrovare suo figlio, Alba Rohrwacher una suora che vuole ritrovare Dio, per Rocco Papaleo il sogno √® una notte di sesso con una pin up, per il cieco Alessandro Borghi ritrovare la vista, per l'anziana Giulia Lazzarini far guarire dall'Alzheimer il vecchio marito. Ma tra i questuanti ci sono anche Vinicio Marchioni, Vittoria Puccini, Silvio Muccino e Silvia D'Amico. "Si pu√≤ fare", ripete a ciascuno l'impassibile Mastandrea. Ma il prezzo da pagare √® tremendo. C'√® chi dovr√† mettere una bomba, chi uccidere una bambina a caso, chi picchiare a morte uno sconosciuto o violentare una donna, la suora deve restare incinta. E le strade di questi 'perfetti sconosciuti' fatalmente si intrecceranno.

Dopo un quarto d'ora ti rendi conto che la cinepresa rester√† inchiodata a quel tavolo per tutto il film. Le azioni verranno solo raccontate dagli interessati. La tensione si costruisce sui volti. E' la formula, eminentemente televisiva, di "In Treatment", parlo di quello perch√© la serie-culto di Genovese non l'ho vista. Usarla per un film √® una scommessa audace, sicuramente poco ruffiana, mi aspetto un passaparola controverso e mi chiedo come funzioner√† al botteghino.

La metafisica √® dietro l'angolo. "Perch√© mi chiedi cose cos√¨ tremende?", chiede un 'cliente' a Mastandrea. "Perch√© qualcuno √® disposto a farle". E ancora :"Lei crede in Dio ?" "Io credo nei dettagli". "Sei un mostro". "Diciamo che do da mangiare ai mostri". Qualche volta le 'commissioni' fanno accadere miracoli, qualche volta innescano tragedie, i pi√π sani rinunciano. Se non l'avesse gi√† usato Robert Bresson esattamente quarant'anni fa, il titolo giusto sarebbe "Il Diavolo, probabilmente". O anche no, visto che l'ultimo, provvidenziale "si pu√≤ fare" lo porge al deus ex machina la solitaria cameriera Ferilli.

Di Valerio Mastandrea ( come Giallini e Rohrwacher in transito da "Perfetti Sconosciuti") voglio dire una cosa soltanto : √® una benedizione. Potrebbe fare a meno delle battute, il copione √® superfluo, sulla sua faccia passa tutto. Per "The Place" come sempre. Giallini e Papaleo al solito sono perfetti, ma senza di lui non c'√® il film. Quando un attore 'tira', in Italia, c'√® il vizio di proclamarlo "il nuovo Mastroianni". Mastandrea non assomiglia a nessuno. E' qualcosa di nuovo : se stesso. Basta e avanza.
TITLE: Avete amato "Perfetti sconosciuti"? Scordatevelo. Con "The Place" Genovese vi spiazzer√†

SUMMARY:
Kevin Spacey has reportedly been dropped by both his publicist and talent agency, after multiple came forward to accuse him of varying levels of sexual harassment.
Accusations against Spacey were made public earlier this week, when actor Anthony Rapp described an alleged incident which transpired between the two of them when he was just 14 years old.
Since then, several more people have shared their own experiences of Spacey, including several crew members who worked with him on the hit Netflix series ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô.
One production assistant described working on the show as a ‚Äútoxic environment‚Äù, alleging that he was once fondled by Spacey in a car without his consent, and later cornered in his trailer.
After the allegations came to light, it was confirmed that production on the upcoming sixth and final series of ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô - in which Spacey stars as corrupt politician Frank Underwood - had been suspended indefinitely.
TEXT:
The Oscar-winning actor‚Äôs publicist Staci Wolfe has confirmed to Vulture that she will no longer be representing Stacey, following the allegations, while ‚Äúa source close‚Äù to the ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô star told them that talent agency CAA has also chosen to part ways with him .

Kevin Spacey has reportedly been dropped by both his publicist and talent agency, after multiple came forward to accuse him of varying levels of sexual harassment.

Accusations against Spacey were made public earlier this week, when actor Anthony Rapp described an alleged incident which transpired between the two of them when he was just 14 years old.

Spacey responded to the allegations in a statement on his Twitter page, in which he admitted he didn‚Äôt recall the events described, but offered his ‚Äúsincerest apologies‚Äù for ‚Äúwhat would have been deeply inappropriate drunken behaviour‚Äù.

He also came under fire for taking this moment to publicly acknowledge that he was ‚Äúchoosing to live his life as a gay man‚Äù, which was perceived by some prominent figures in the LGBT+ community as a way of ‚Äúdeflecting‚Äù from the accusations.

Since then, several more people have shared their own experiences of Spacey, including several crew members who worked with him on the hit Netflix series ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô.

One production assistant described working on the show as a ‚Äútoxic environment‚Äù, alleging that he was once fondled by Spacey in a car without his consent, and later cornered in his trailer.

After the allegations came to light, it was confirmed that production on the upcoming sixth and final series of ‚ÄòHouse Of Cards‚Äô - in which Spacey stars as corrupt politician Frank Underwood - had been suspended indefinitely.
TITLE: Kevin Spacey Dropped By Publicist Following Sexual Harassment Allegations

TEXT:
POLEMIQUE - Plut√¥t discr√®te apr√®s une s√©rie de controverses qui ont √©corn√© son image, l'avocate et chroniqueuse Raquel Garrido a vivement d√©menti sur Twitter des propos rapport√©s par la presse selon lesquels Jean-Luc M√©lenchon "n'en peut plus" des pol√©miques impliquant l'oratrice de la France insoumise.

"J'en connais plus d'un qui 'n'en peut plus' des journalistes menteurs. Quant √† moi, vous me fa√Ætes rire. Vous √™tes de belles putes √† clic", a-t-elle r√©agi sur le r√©seau social. Dans un second tweet (qu'elle n'a pas effac√©, contrairement √† ce que nous avions √©crit dans un premier temps), l'avocate a accus√© les m√©dias BFMTV, RTL et Valeurs Actuelles de "cyber-harc√®lement" √† son √©gard.

J'en connais plus d'un qui "n'en peut plus" des journalistes menteurs. Quant √† moi, vous me faites rire. Vous √™tes de belles putes √† clic. ‚Äî Raquel Garrido (@RaquelGarridoFI) 3 novembre 2017

Ds la foul√©e du juste combat men√© contre le cyber-harc√®lement, je propose #balancetoncyberharceleur. Je nomine @BFMTV @RTLFrance @Valeurs. ‚Äî Raquel Garrido (@RaquelGarridoFI) 3 novembre 2017

"Fa√Ætes la recension des putes √† clic qui √©crivent le m√™me article avec 'n'en peut plus' (avec des guillemets en plus!)", a-t-elle pr√©cis√© en conspuant "ces m√©dias officiels qui pensent encore que ce qu'ils font s'appelle journalisme."

Les trois m√©dias incrimin√©s ont pour point commun d'avoir repris une citation parue dans Paris Match attribu√©e √† un membre de l'entourage de Jean-Luc M√©lenchon. "Il n'en peut plus de devoir passer derri√®re" les incendies provoqu√©es par la chroniqueuse de Thierry Ardisson, aurait confi√© ce fid√®le du chef de file de la France insoumise. Citation tronqu√©e et devenue dans certains titres de presse "Jean-Luc M√©lenchon 'n'en peut plus' de Raquel Garrido".

Si le cas de Raquel Garrido interroge certains militants de la France insoumise, l'avocate a jusqu'ici toujours √©t√© soutenue par les cadres de son mouvement politique. A commencer par Jean-Luc M√©lenchon. "Raquel Garrido n'est coupable de rien. C'est une cabale mont√©e, organis√©e et qui r√©pand des calomnies", a d√©nonc√© encore r√©cemment le d√©put√© des Bouches-du-Rh√¥ne.

SUMMARY:
Kaum jemand im deutschsprachigen Raum hat sich mit dem Thema Kindererziehung wohl so lange und lebensnah besch√§ftigt wie der Schweizer Kinderarzt Remo Largo.
‚ÄúDas ist aber nicht m√∂glich.‚ÄùDie Folge: ‚ÄúSie √ºberfordern das Kind und verunsichern es.‚ÄùEltern m√ºssen die Grenzen ihrer Kinder akzeptierenLargo zieht einen simplen Vergleich: ‚ÄúJedes Kind ist verschieden gro√ü.
Wenn ein Kind zu wenig Nahrung bekommt, wird es kleiner.
‚ÄúDer Grund ist h√§ufig die eigene existenzielle Verunsicherung der Eltern‚Äù, sagt er.
Bei einer √ºberm√§√üigen F√∂rderung kann sich au√üerdem der gew√ºnschte Effekt umkehren und das Kind stattdessen Lernschwierigkeiten entwickeln.
TEXT:
Sie wollen nicht mehr in die Schule gehen, k√∂nnen nachts nicht schlafen, f√ºhlen sich traurig und bedr√ºckt: Schon die Kleinsten in unserer Gesellschaft leiden unter psychischem Stress und hohem Erwartungsdruck, warnen Psychologen.

Erziehungsexperten versuchen Antworten darauf zu finden, warum inzwischen schon bei Grundsch√ºlern Burnout-Syndrome diagnostiziert werden und was eigentlich aus der Idee einer unbeschwerten Kindheit geworden ist.

Kaum jemand im deutschsprachigen Raum hat sich mit dem Thema Kindererziehung wohl so lange und lebensnah besch√§ftigt wie der Schweizer Kinderarzt Remo Largo.

Auch wenn sein erstes Buch ‚ÄúBabyjahre‚Äù schon fast zwei Jahrzehnte alt ist, geh√∂rt es noch immer zur Grundausstattung junger Eltern.

Viele Eltern wollen ihr Kind maximal f√∂rdern - auch √ºber sein Potenzial hinaus

Seit mehr als 30 Jahren befasst sich der ‚Äúbekannteste Kinderarzt der Schweiz‚Äù mit der kindlichen Entwicklung und dem Einfluss, den unsere Gesellschaft darauf hat.

Largo, der selbst Vater von drei T√∂chtern und auch lange schon Gro√üvater ist, beobachtet ein entscheidendes Problem in der modernen Erziehung: Er ist der Ansicht, dass viele Eltern eine falsche Vorstellung davon haben, wie ihr Kind zu einem gl√ºcklichen, erfolgreichen Menschen heranw√§chst.

‚ÄúEin Kind ist darauf ausgelegt, sein Begabungspotenzial auszusch√∂pfen‚Äù, sagte er der HuffPost. ‚ÄúDoch in unserer Gesellschaft ist das f√ºr viele unglaublich schwer geworden.‚Äù

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Ein Hirnforscher erkl√§rt, was Kinder mehr als alles andere von ihren Eltern brauchen

Schuld sei ein Irrglaube, dem viele Eltern unterliegen. ‚ÄúViele Eltern versuchen, ihr Kind √ºber sein Begabungspotenzial hinaus zu f√∂rdern‚Äù, erkl√§rt er. ‚ÄúDas ist aber nicht m√∂glich.‚Äù

Die Folge: ‚ÄúSie √ºberfordern das Kind und verunsichern es.‚Äù

Eltern m√ºssen die Grenzen ihrer Kinder akzeptieren

Largo zieht einen simplen Vergleich: ‚ÄúJedes Kind ist verschieden gro√ü. Wenn ein Kind zu wenig Nahrung bekommt, wird es kleiner. Wird es √ºberf√ºttert, wird es nicht gr√∂√üer, sondern nur dick. So ist es auch mit den geistigen F√§higkeiten.‚Äù

So wie das k√∂rperliche Wachstum eines Kindes also limitiert ist, st√∂√üt es auch bei seinen Begabungen und St√§rken an klare Grenzen.

(Das hat Largo √ºbrigens zu Kindern zu sagen, die nicht gehorchen; der Text geht nach dem Video weiter:)

Ein Kinderarzt erkl√§rt: Das ist der oft √ºbersehene Grund, warum Kinder ihren Eltern nicht gehorchen





Eltern m√ºssten erkennen und akzeptieren, dass ihr Kind in manchen Feldern besser sei als in anderen und dass es nichts bringe, die nicht so stark ausgepr√§gten F√§higkeiten ohne R√ºcksicht auf seine eigentlichen Bed√ºrfnisse verbessern zu wollen, erkl√§rt Largo.

Dass Eltern ihre Kinder √ºber ihr Potenzial hinaus versuchen zu f√∂rdern, l√§sst sich laut Largo durch den gesellschaftlichen Druck erkl√§ren.

Zu viel F√∂rderung f√ºhrt nicht zu mehr Erfolg

Andere Eltern und Erzieher in der Kita setzten Ma√üst√§be, wie weit ein Kind in einem bestimmten Alter in seiner Entwicklung sein m√ºsse. Und in der Schule gehe es weiter - mit starren Lehrpl√§nen und oft unflexiblen Lehrern.

‚ÄúWenn das eigene Kind dann beispielsweise weniger gut lesen und rechnen kann, als es nach dieser Vorstellung sollte, l√∂st das bei den meisten Eltern √Ñngste aus.‚Äù

Die Reaktion vieler Eltern: st√§rkere F√∂rderung - auch dort, wo das Potenzial des Kindes bereits voll ausgesch√∂pft ist. Damit entstehe die Gefahr der √úberlastung, warnt Largo.

‚ÄúEltern d√ºrfen ihre Kinder nicht √ºberfordern‚Äù, sagt er. ‚ÄúDie zunehmende Zahl der Burnout-F√§lle selbst bei Kindern zeigt aber, dass viele Eltern genau das tun. Die Kinder wollen dann nicht mehr lernen, k√∂nnen nicht mehr schlafen, f√ºhlen sich niedergeschlagen.‚Äù

Largos Rat: ‚ÄúBemerken Eltern, dass sie ihr Kind √ºberfordern, sollten sie sich selbst hinterfragen und sich ehrlich √ºberlegen, weshalb sie solchen Druck machen.‚Äù

Viele Eltern machen sich selbst gro√üen Druck

Die Ursache f√ºr ein solches Verhalten der Eltern, so Largos Erfahrung, sei n√§mlich in vielen F√§llen gleich.

‚ÄúDer Grund ist h√§ufig die eigene existenzielle Verunsicherung der Eltern‚Äù, sagt er.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Das passiert mit Kindern, die fr√ºh in die Kita kommen

‚ÄúSie haben Angst, dass sie ihren Lebensstandard nicht halten k√∂nnen und f√ºrchten, dass die Lebensqualit√§t f√ºr ihre Kinder nicht mehr so hoch sein k√∂nnte wie bei ihnen. Sie versuchen deshalb, die Kinder extrem zu f√∂rdern - in dem Glauben, das mache die Kinder kl√ºger und damit auch erfolgreicher. Doch das ist ein Irrglaube.‚Äù

Was sollten Eltern also anders machen? Largos Antwort darauf ist einfach.

Kinder m√ºssten nicht die ganze Zeit besch√§ftigt und gef√∂rdert werden.

Eltern sollten ihre Kinder sinnvolle Erfahrungen machen lassen

‚ÄúEltern sollten Vertrauen haben in die Kinder‚Äù, sagt er. ‚ÄúIhre Aufgabe ist nicht, die Kinder mit allen m√∂glichen Dingen zu f√∂rdern, sondern ihnen sinnvolle Erfahrungen zu erm√∂glichen, zum Beispiel mit anderen Kindern.‚Äù

Dann, so erkl√§rt er, werde das Kind auch Erfolg haben. ‚ÄúDenn es w√§hlt das aus, was es f√ºr seine Entwicklung braucht und was es kann.‚Äù

Ohne diese Erfahrungen werde ein Kind verunsichert - und das habe laut Largo wiederum negative Auswirkungen auf sein Lernverhalten. Bei einer √ºberm√§√üigen F√∂rderung kann sich au√üerdem der gew√ºnschte Effekt umkehren und das Kind stattdessen Lernschwierigkeiten entwickeln.

‚ÄúEin Neunj√§hriger ist dann beispielsweise beim Lesen auf dem Entwicklungsstand eines Siebenj√§hrigen - obwohl seine Eltern genau das Gegenteil erreichen wollten - n√§mlich, dass er besser ist als die Anderen.‚Äù

Falsche F√∂rderung f√ºhrt zu einer √úberforderung

Diese falsche F√∂rderung f√ºhre zwangsl√§ufig zu einer √úberforderung in der Schule und diese wiederum zu Misserfolgen, warnt der Mediziner.

Die Folgen seien dramatisch: ‚ÄúDas Gef√ºhl des Versagens zerst√∂rt das Selbstwertgef√ºhl immer mehr, bis wir es mit einem zutiefst verunsicherten Erwachsenen zu tun haben, der sich nichts zutraut und Probleme hat, sich in der Berufswelt zurechtzufinden.‚Äù



Und damit ist Largo bei einer Botschaft angelangt, die er seit Jahrzehnten predigt - Kinder so nehmen, wie sie sind.



‚ÄúEs ist deshalb wichtig zu akzeptieren, dass sich jedes Kind auf seine Weise und in seinem Tempo entwickeln will. Dazu geh√∂rt also anzuerkennen, dass jedes Kind anders ist.‚Äù



Eine Botschaft, die sich alle Eltern noch mehr zu Herzen nehmen sollten - auch wenn sie v√∂llig selbstverst√§ndlich klingt.



(lm)
TITLE: Kinderarzt Remo Largo erkl√§rt: Mit diesem Fehler schaden Eltern ihren Kindern

SUMMARY:
Amazon says it will open a second corporate office in Vancouver, but it isn't the highly-coveted HQ2.
VANCOUVER ‚Äî Amazon says it will open a second corporate office in Vancouver, but it's not the highly sought-after second headquarters that has commanded the attention of governments across North America.
The second office will create 1,000 jobs and the company expects to open the 150,000-square-foot (or about 14,000-square-metre) location in 2020.
"We're so excited to be here and be growing," said Jesse Dougherty, Amazon's Vancouver site lead, during a Friday morning event at the company's Vancouver office.
The Seattle-based company's first Vancouver office opened in 2015 and now employs more than 1,000 people, mostly software developers.
TEXT:
The Amazon logo outside the Amazon Go grocery store in Seattle, Wash., June 16, 2017. Amazon says it will open a second corporate office in Vancouver, but it isn't the highly-coveted HQ2.

VANCOUVER ‚Äî Amazon says it will open a second corporate office in Vancouver, but it's not the highly sought-after second headquarters that has commanded the attention of governments across North America.

The second office will create 1,000 jobs and the company expects to open the 150,000-square-foot (or about 14,000-square-metre) location in 2020.

"We're so excited to be here and be growing," said Jesse Dougherty, Amazon's Vancouver site lead, during a Friday morning event at the company's Vancouver office. "It's thrilling."

The Seattle-based company's first Vancouver office opened in 2015 and now employs more than 1,000 people, mostly software developers.

Watch: The 5 craziest bids for Amazon HQ2

The new jobs will include tech and non-tech jobs, such as software development, human resources and marketing roles.

While Dougherty expressed excitement about Amazon's quick growth in his hometown, he remained mum on the possibility the company may choose Vancouver as the site for its planned second headquarters, dubbed HQ2.

"I have no information on HQ2," he later told the media.

An Amazon spokesperson added the announcement is separate from the second headquarters plans and there's no connection between the two.

B.C. Premier called it 'great day'

Still, local leaders hailed the news as a possible leg-up for Metro Vancouver's bid.

B.C. Premier John Horgan called it "a great day" for the tech sector.

"I believe it's an opportunity for us to look forward again to other challenges and other opportunities presented by Amazon," he said at the event.

Metro Vancouver and Langford, B.C., have submitted bids for Amazon's new headquarters.

The premier touted the province's post-secondary institutions and diversity as a big draw.

We are thrilled to be an important city on Amazon's world map and even more so going forward. Mayor Gregor Robertson

Mayor Gregor Robertson also hinted at an expanding relationship with the tech firm.

"We are thrilled to be an important city on Amazon's world map and even more so going forward," he said.

Robertson later told the media every job Amazon creates in Vancouver boosts its chances of future growth and the city's strong partnership with the company is an advantage.

A collection Amazon packages on display in Hagerstown, Md., on May 5, 2017.

"Many other cities competing don't have any Amazon jobs, and we now have thousands," he said.

Robertson acknowledged absorbing the company's second headquarters _ along with up to 50,000 new, high-paying jobs it promises ‚Äî could be challenging, but noted the US$5-billion investment would come in phases spread out over several years giving the winning city time to prepare adequately.

Vancouver would have to continue to increase its housing supply, invest in its transit system and boost its education system, particularly the number of STEM graduates, he said.

Amazon said earlier this month it received 238 proposals from North American cities and regions.

In addition to the two B.C. hopefuls, Toronto, Ottawa, Halifax, Calgary and several others submitted proposals earlier this month.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Amazon Hiring 1,000 For New Vanouver Corporate Office (But It's Not HQ2)

SUMMARY:
CNN: We know that Allahu Akbar is a popular phrase among terrorists.
A Phrase With A Profound Spiritual History The phrase Allahu akbar has a long history of use within Islam.
The phrase Allahu akbar is also used by non-Muslim Arab speakers, since "Allah" is the Arabic word for God.
For the record, "Allahu Akbar" has no inherent political/violent connotation meriting instant terror diagnosis.I say it like 20 times a day.
This summer, an Italian mayor threatened that anyone who shouts Allahu akbar in a main square in Venice would be immediately shot.
TEXT:
JEWEL SAMAD via Getty Images Investigators work around the wreckage of a Home Depot pickup truck a day after it was used in a terror attack in New York on November 1, 2017.

This phrase has also reportedly been invoked during other terror attacks this year ‚Äï in Belgium, the United Kingdom, France, and Spain. As a result of the way it surfaces during these acts of violence, Allahu akbar has become something that provokes fear among those who are unfamiliar with or suspicious of Islam.

CNN: We know that Allahu Akbar is a popular phrase among terrorists.



COME ON MUSLIMS SAY THIS EVERYDAY IN PRAYER. ‚Äî Rowaida Abdelaziz (@Rowaida_Abdel) October 31, 2017

To hear a spiritual phrase that Muslims use in their everyday lives twisted in this violent way is incredibly frustrating, said Rabiah Ahmed, director of media and public affairs at the Muslim Public Affairs Council. ‚Ä≥[Allahu Akbar] has been used in traditional Muslim prayers for centuries and is used as a peaceful reminder of their religious commitment. They are also the opening words of the Adhan (Islamic call to prayer) and is also often used in approval in the same way Christians say Amen,'" Ahmed told HuffPost. "Its extremely painful and frustrating [to see it misused], and unfortunately, just another example of how our religion is co-opted by those those who act outside of it."

John Moore via Getty Images A makeshift memorial stands on a bike path in lower Manhattan on November 1, 2017 in New York City. Eight people were killed and 12 injured on October 31 when suspect 29-year-old Sayfullo Saipov intentionally drove a truck onto the path.

A Phrase With A Profound Spiritual History The phrase Allahu akbar has a long history of use within Islam. It expresses a sentiment that is at its heart a theological reflection about humanity's place in the world: That no matter what trials or victories people face, God is greater than it all. It appears a few times in the Quran, but only mid-sentence, according to Imam Omar Suleiman, president of the Yaqeen Institute for Islamic Research. The phrase is more explicit in the sunnah, a set of teachings about the way of life modeled by Islam's founder, the Prophet Muhammad. Suleiman pointed in particular to a hadith ‚Äï one of the collected reports about the prophet ‚Äï where Muhammad is recorded as saying, "Allah is Greater, Mightier than all His creation. He is Mightier than what I fear and dread." "What it suggests is that God is greater than all our concerns, God is greater than all that is ascribed to him, greater than all the disappointments we have," Suleiman said. "God is greater than our pain, God is greater than our material possessions." Allahu akbar is an affirmation of a belief in a monotheistic God, Suleiman said ‚Äï since it suggests that God has no partners. Belief in absolute monotheism is a core part of orthodox Islamic theology. The phrase Allahu akbar is also used by non-Muslim Arab speakers, since "Allah" is the Arabic word for God. Some Christians from Syria, Lebanon, and other regions in the Levant, say Allahu akbar to express surprise, excitement, puzzlement or dismay ‚Äï in the same way that English speakers may use the phrase "Oh my God." (It's not a religious pronouncement for these Christians, however, and some Arab Christians, such as Egypt's Copts, do not use it.) From a theological point of view, the idea that God is greater than human circumstances is not limited to Islam. In English, one verse of the Bible declares, "He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world." A popular Christian worship song by the band MercyMe is based on the verse. Another wildly popular Christian song, by the musician Chris Tomlin, states, "Our God is greater, our God is stronger, God you are higher than any other." Nick Jonas has a symbol representing the words "God is greater than the highs and lows" tattooed on his arm.

A post shared by Nick Jonas (@nickjonas) on Aug 8, 2013 at 5:03pm PDT

Saying Allahu Akbar In Prayer, Joy And Sadness For Muslims, the phrase Allahu akbar is built into the prayers that are one of the pillars of Islam. It begins the call to prayer, or "adhan." It's also used as a verbal transition between the different positions Muslims assume during prayer ‚Äï standing up, bowing, kneeling, prostrating on the ground. "There's something extremely powerful about saying Allahu akbar and then prostrating yourself, putting your face on the ground in supplication to our creator," Suleiman said. "In Islam, the greatest position of prayer is prostration ‚Äï the more you lower yourself to God, the higher he elevates you."

Muslim Girl via Getty Images Muslims repeat Allahu akbar as a transition between different positions used during prayer.

Outside of the context of formal prayer, Allahu akbar is also used by Muslims in moments of celebration, such as when someone passes a hard exam or is accepted into college. It is also said in times of sorrow ‚Äï such as when a dearly loved one passes away. The phrase is often the first sound Muslims whisper into a baby's ears at birth and one of the last sounds they hear during a burial, as a body is lowered into the grave. Suleiman said that often during Islamic fundraisers, every time someone raises their hand to donate the whole audience will say Allahu akbar in celebration of the act of charity. The phrase is so much a part of daily life that Qasim Rashid, a spokesperson for the Ahmadiyya Muslim community in America, estimates that he's said it more than 1.6 million times over the course of his life ‚Äï just because of the five daily prayers. "[Praying] five times a day, since I was about seven years old, it comes out to about 1.6 million times over the last 28 years or so," Rashid told HuffPost. "That doesn't include when I said Allahu akbar when my kids were born, or when I helped build a hospital, or Michael Jordan made the game winning shot in the NBA finals." "It's part of our celebratory mode, and to believe that it could mean something violent is asinine," he said.

For the record, "Allahu Akbar" has no inherent political/violent connotation meriting instant terror diagnosis.I say it like 20 times a day. ‚Äî rabia chaudry (@rabiasquared) October 31, 2017

The Consequences Of Misusing The Phrase Despite the prevalence of this religious concept, Hind Makki, an interfaith educator and activist, told HuffPost said she feels that a stigma has become attached to the phrase in American culture ‚Äï particularly when it is said in Arabic. "It's one of those Arabic phrases that people who aren't Muslim or aren't really familiar with Islam treat with dread because they connect it to a crime," she said. "It's frustrating because we have seen how many mass shootings and mass murders there have been recently and several of the suspects, I would assume have some kind of ideological bent," she said, referring in particular to the Las Vegas shooter Stephen Paddock, whose rampage in October left 58 people dead and hundreds more injured. "But because the person is not from a Muslim background, or didn't yell Allahu akbar, people are like, 'We don't know why he did it.'" Some Muslims have become wary of saying the phrase, or speaking in Arabic in general, while in public. The feeling of anxiety is felt heavily on planes, where some have reported being taken off flights for speaking in Arabic. Rashid said that as a result of how the phrase is treated in America, he tries to use it as much as possible around his children. "I don't want them to feel intimidated. I feel young Muslims feel intimidated using words like jihad, or Allahu akbar, or even saying 'assalamu alaikum' [a common greeting] in public," he said. "It's an unfortunate side effect of what's happening right now."

Burhaan Kinu via Getty Images Allahu akbar is said during prayer and also in everyday conversations -- as an expression of celebration.

Another side effect of misusing and misunderstanding Islamic phrases is that it leads to fears of a backlash against the Muslim community. Anti-Muslim hate crimes have increased dramatically since the Sept. 11, 2001 attacks. Allahu akbar has been weaponized in the past by people whose intent is to harm Muslims. In Quebec City, Canada in January, it was reportedly yelled out by a suspect with far-right, white nationalist views during a deadly attack on a mosque community. This summer, an Italian mayor threatened that anyone who shouts Allahu akbar in a main square in Venice would be immediately shot. Ahmed, of MPAC, said she believes every terrorist act done in the name of Islam not only takes away innocent lives but also threatens the security of Americans who are Muslim. "Because there is so much misinformation and misunderstanding about our faith and community, those who seek revenge for these attacks will usually direct their anger toward the first innocent Muslim they see on the streets, at school, and at public places," she told HuffPost. "Since 9/11, this has been our reality. Whenever there is any terror incident done in our name, we mourn not only as Americans, but we mourn the hijacking of our faith and brace ourselves for potential backlash." That's why Ahmed believes education about Islam is crucial. Instead of allowing the Islamic State to define what Allahu akbar means, she said it's important to seek authentic, legitimate voices and interpretations of the phrase. "When we allow [ISIS} to define Islam for the masses, we end up giving their twisted ideologies a platform and spread their hatred and fear," Ahmed said. "The media and our government leaders have a lot of power in how it covers and responds to ISIS that can be harnessed to help achieve what we all want - the complete and utter defeat of ISIS and its ideology."
TITLE: Here's What You Need To Know About The Phrase 'Allahu Akbar'

Ein schwerer Schlag f√ºr die M√§nnerwelt: Hoffnungslose Optimisten, die sich selbst noch Au√üenseiterchancen bei Supermodel Kate Upton (25, "Die Schadenfreundinnen") einger√§umt haben, werden diese Nachricht nicht gerne h√∂ren. Denn die 25-J√§hrige hat nun N√§gel mit K√∂pfen gemacht und ihren Verlobten Justin Verlander (34) in einer m√§rchenhaften Hochzeit in Italien das Ja-Wort gegeben. Bilder von Upton in einem schneewei√üen Hochzeitskleid mit langer Schleppe ver√∂ffentlichte die US-amerikanische Seite "Page Six".

Eine perfekte Woche f√ºr den US-Baseballspieler Verlander, der auf den Bildern seine sch√∂ne Braut gl√ºcklich anhimmelt. Zuerst gewinnt er mit seinem Team, den Houston Astros, die World Series. Wenige Tage sp√§ter folgte nun die Hochzeit mit seiner Traumfrau. √úberst√ºrzt, so wie manch anderes Promi-Paar, haben die beiden den Schritt vor den Traualtar aber nicht. Kennen und lieben lernten sie sich im Jahr 2014, zwei Jahre sp√§ter gab das Paar die Verlobung bekannt.

TEXT:
RTL stellt die Landwirte in der Kuppel-Sendung "Bauer sucht Frau" wie unattraktive T√∂lpel dar

Doch wir haben den Beweis gefunden, dass viele Bauern heutzutage ganz anders aussehen

Der Jungbauernkalender 2018 zeigt Jungbauern in all ihrer nat√ºrlichen Sch√∂nheit

Bauern, das wissen wir dank der RTL-Sendung "Bauer sucht Frau", sind vor allem primitiv, schmutzig und ein bisschen zur√ºckgeblieben. Zumindest gewinnt jeder diesen Eindruck, der sich die Kuppel-Sendung ansieht.

In der aktuellen Folge zeigt das RTL-Team ein verdrecktes Bauernhaus nach dem n√§chsten. Es scheint fast, als w√§re kein Bauer dazu in der Lage, eine Klob√ºrste zu verwenden, sein Geschirr abzuwaschen oder sich von alten Tannenb√§umen zu trennen.

Und gegessen wird nat√ºrlich am allerliebsten auf Strohballen - au√üer beim Fr√ºhst√ºck. Da verspeist so ein Bauer, wie RTL-Kandidat G√ºnter, schon mal jeden Morgen f√ºnf gekochte Eier - und das seit 50 Jahren. Kein Wunder also, dass die Bauern so wohlern√§hrt aussehen.

Wer dachte, Bauern seien unattraktiv, hat sich get√§uscht

Das Bild des dicken Bauern, der den ganzen Tag nur isst oder seinen Stall ausmistet und deshalb keine Frau findet, ist aber nur das, was RTL uns vermitteln will. Wir haben den Gegenbeweis gefunden: den Jungbauernkalender 2018.

Bei dem Kalender d√ºrfen nur M√§nner mitmachen, die nachweislich etwas mit der Landwirtschaft zu tun haben. Tja, wer dachte, Bauern w√§ren grunds√§tzlich unattraktiv und dick hat sich wohl get√§uscht. Die Bauern unserer heutigen Zeit sehen n√§mlich ganz anders aus.

Aber stellen wir unser Best Of der sch√∂nsten Jungbauern doch so vor, wie auch RTL sie vorstellen w√ºrde:

Der rassige Robert liebt nicht nur die sengende Sauna-Hitze, sondern auch die Land- und Forstwirtschaft seiner Eltern. Besonders begeistert sei der 23-j√§hrige Handtuchhalter "von der vielen Technik" auf dem Bauernhof, schreibt der Jungbauernkalender. In seiner Freizeit treibt der neckische Nacktfreund am liebsten Sport, spielt Schlagzeug oder modelt.

F√ºr den Kopfbedeckung-liebenden K√§rntner Josef steht die Landwirtschaft an erster Stelle. Neben seinem Studium des l√§ndlichen Liegenschaftsmanagements stellt er seinen Mutterkuhbetrieb gerade auf Bio um. Die Hobbys des drolligen 23-J√§hrigen sind wandern und fotografieren.

Der niedliche Nieder√∂sterreicher Bernhard unterst√ºtzt schon seit seiner Kindheit den elterlichen Bio-Mutterkuhbetrieb. Wenn er nicht bei der Futterernte hilft, arbeitet der fidele Fitnessfreund an seinem K√∂rper: Fu√üball, Tennis und Skifahren z√§hlen zu seinen liebsten Hobbies.

F√ºr den flei√üigen Philip steht Qualit√§t an erster Stelle. Der braungebrannte Bauer √ºbernimmt von der Aufzucht bis zur Schlachtung alles selbst im Familienbetrieb. Das weise Motto des 33-J√§hrigen: "Man erntet, was man s√§t."

Dem agilen Alexander war schon als Kind klar: Er m√∂chte Forstwirt werden. Seine Freizeit verbringt der sittsame 27-J√§hrige am liebsten mit Gitarre spielen, laufen und schwimmen.

Der durchtriebene David will sp√§ter die Landwirtschaft seines Vaters √ºbernehmen. Zu den gr√∂√üten Leidenschaften des vielf√§ltig interessierten 25-j√§hrigen Vermessungstechnikers z√§hlen die Natur, sein Motorrad, Sport und Musik.

Schon im Alter von sieben Jahren entdeckte der brave Bernhard seine Leidenschaft "f√ºr gro√üe Maschinen". "Mitanpacken" ist f√ºr den 23-J√§hrigen "Hobby und Beruf zugleich". Seine Freizeit verbringt der h√§usliche Hof√ºbernehmer am liebsten in der Natur.

Wenn ihr euch die Jungbauern jetzt am liebsten gleich √ºber eurem Bett aufh√§ngen wollt, k√∂nnt ihr euch den Jungbauernkalender 2018 bestellen.

Fotos: Julia Stix

(lk)
TITLE: RTL stellt die Landwirte bei "Bauer sucht Frau" v√∂llig falsch dar - hier ist der Beweis

TEXT:
Environment Minister Catherine McKenna answers questions after Canadian Council of Ministers of the Environment meeting in Vancouver on Friday.

VANCOUVER ‚Äî Environment Minister Catherine McKenna confronted a reporter for The Rebel on Friday, demanding he make a commitment that the far-right website stop calling her "climate Barbie."

The exchange occurred at a news conference after a meeting of provincial, territorial and federal environment ministers in Vancouver.

Rebel Media reporter Christopher Wilson got into an exchange with Environment Minister McKenna in Vancouver on Friday.

Christopher Wilson identified himself as a Rebel reporter and asked McKenna a question about the federal government's opinion on the role of hydroelectricity as a clean power source.

"So you're the Rebel Media that happens to call me 'climate Barbie.' I certainly hope that you will no longer use that hashtag," McKenna said.

Wilson replied that he personally has never called her that name.

Climate barbie is good for bureaucrats, the tax payers disadvantage. https://t.co/5QOEhg6jVN ‚Äî Christopher Wilson (@VanCity_Chris) March 11, 2017

However, the reporter has used it at least twice on Twitter and it appeared in an article published under his byline in January. He did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

McKenna pushed Wilson for a commitment that The Rebel will stop using that name in its articles and on social media.

"Me personally, yes, but I don't have editorial control of others," Wilson responded.

Wilson then accused McKenna of banning one of The Rebel's correspondents from going to an upcoming climate conference, which McKenna denied and said she wrote a letter encouraging the outlet to come so they could learn about climate change.

There are lots of girls that want to get into politics and it is completely unacceptable that you do this. Enviornment Minister Catherine McKenna

"Absolutely, and I have a legitimate question about hydroelectricity's role," Wilson said.

McKenna interjected that she was just asking for a commitment that the outlet won't call her names, talk about the colour of her hair or make fun of

"The reason I'm asking you not to do this is because I have two daughters. There are lots of girls that want to get into politics and it is completely unacceptable that you do this," she said.

Watch: Environment minister slamming sexism in politics after 'Climate Barbie' tweet

Wilson replied by saying he finds it unacceptable that McKenna "smears" people who question climate change as "deniers" with "all the connotations of the Holocaust denial."

McKenna ultimately thanked Wilson for his commitment to stop using the term and addressed his question on hydroelectricity.

The Rebel did not immediately respond to a request for comment, but on Saturday morning the outlet posted several tweets using the "#ClimateBarbie" hashtag.

4. Our Alberta bureau chief coined the phrase "Climate Barbie", a reference to McKenna's shallowness. She did not disprove that tonight. ‚Äî Christopher Wilson (@VanCity_Chris) November 4, 2017

However, after his testy exchange with the minister Wilson wrote in a Twitter post, "Our Alberta bureau chief coined the phrase 'Climate Barbie,' a reference to McKenna's shallowness. She did not disprove that tonight."

In September, Conservative MP Gerry Ritz apologized for calling McKenna "climate Barbie" on Twitter, saying the term is "not reflective of the role the minister plays."

Do you use that sexist language about your daughter, mother, sister? We need more women in politics. Your sexist comments won't stop us. https://t.co/WVMnm7EyEY ‚Äî Catherine McKenna (@cathmckenna) September 20, 2017

I apologize for the use of Barbie, it is not reflective of the role the Minister plays ‚Äî Gerry Ritz (@GerryRitzxMP) September 20, 2017

The full exchange below:
TITLE: Environment Minister Catherine McKenna Calls Out Rebel Reporter For Using 'Climate Barbie'

Une fois arriv√©s sur place, ils d√©couvrent leur m√©decin, Paul Locus, int√©gralement grim√© en Joker, comme en t√©moigne la vid√©o publi√©e par Justin Selph sur Facebook.
Au contraire, comme le pr√©cise Buzzfeed, la future maman d√©clare au m√©decin qu'elle esp√®re bien le voir revenir avec son d√©guisement.
Pour quelqu'un n√© le jour d'Halloween, on pouvait difficilement √™tre plus dans le th√®me.
√Ä voir √©galement sur Le HuffPost:
TEXT:
HALLOWEEN - Le soir d'Halloween, les choses les plus √©tranges peuvent se produire. Comme par exemple se retrouver face au Joker qui propose aimablement de vous aider √† couper le cordon ombilical de votre dernier-n√©.

Le 31 octobre, Justin et Brittany Selph se rendent dans un centre m√©dical du Tennessee pour la naissance de leur troisi√®me enfant. Une fois arriv√©s sur place, ils d√©couvrent leur m√©decin, Paul Locus, int√©gralement grim√© en Joker, comme en t√©moigne la vid√©o publi√©e par Justin Selph sur Facebook.

"Il est parti dans l'apr√®s-midi alors que ma femme √©tait encore en phase d'attente, pour rentrer chez lui et distribuer des bonbons", a expliqu√© √† BuzzFeed Justin Selph. Le m√©decin promet alors de se changer et de revenir dans une tenue plus traditionnelle. Mais le couple n'y tient pas vraiment. Au contraire, comme le pr√©cise Buzzfeed, la future maman d√©clare au m√©decin qu'elle esp√®re bien le voir revenir avec son d√©guisement.

"Apr√®s avoir vu la fa√ßon dont il √©tait habill√©, je rigolais avec ma femme en lui disant que je devrais aller lui chercher du maquillage et la transformer en Harley Quinn, la petite amie du Joker. Malheureusement, nous ne l'avons pas fait", a racont√© Justin Seplh.

Mais m√™me sans sa dulcin√©e, le Joker est revenu comme promis au moment de l'accouchement. Le 31 octobre, √† 20h20, Brittany Selph a donc donn√© naissance √† une petite fille, sous l'≈ìil attentif de l'ennemi jur√© de Batman. Pour quelqu'un n√© le jour d'Halloween, on pouvait difficilement √™tre plus dans le th√®me.

Publi√©es sur la page Facebook de la cha√Æne News Channel 5 de Nashville et sur Imgur par un proche de Brittany, la photo de cet accouchement digne d'un film a r√©colt√© plus d'un million de "j'aime" sur les r√©seaux sociaux.

SUMMARY:
Ontario has named the first 14 cities where it will set up government-run marijuana stores.
TORONTO ‚Äî Ontario has named the first 14 cities where it will set up government-run marijuana stores by July 2018.
The province plans to set up approximately 150 stand-alone cannabis stores by 2020.
Our priority is to reduce the illegal market by building on our strengths to create an efficient and secure system for people across the province.
We feel very comfortable that the regime that we will put in place will be a significant deterrent for these illegal businesses."
TEXT:
Marijuana plants flowering at Tweed's growing facility in Smiths Falls, Ont. on Jan. 21, 2016. Ontario has named the first 14 cities where it will set up government-run marijuana stores.

TORONTO ‚Äî Ontario has named the first 14 cities where it will set up government-run marijuana stores by July 2018.

The Liquor Control Board of Ontario, which will run the shops through a subsidiary, said Friday the stores will be located in Brampton, Hamilton, Kingston, Kitchener, London, Mississauga, Ottawa, Sault Ste. Marie, Sudbury, Thunder Bay, Toronto, Vaughan and Windsor.

The LCBO said its representatives, along with staff from Ontario's Ministry of Finance, will meet with the municipalities in the coming weeks to determine the exact locations.

Ontario wants 150 pot shops by 2020

The Ontario government said it will be identifying more locations for its first batch of 40 stores but notes that all consumers will be able to access cannabis through an online retail website.

The province plans to set up approximately 150 stand-alone cannabis stores by 2020.

Last week, Finance Minister Charles Sousa wrote municipal leaders and said Ontario's store rollout aims to achieve the right geographic distribution across the province and to reduce the number of illegal marijuana dispensaries that have opened since the federal government announced it will legalize marijuana next summer.

Our priority is to reduce the illegal market by building on our strengths to create an efficient and secure system for people across the province. Finance Minister Charles Sousa

"Our proposed approach is to build on the expertise and back-office capabilities of the LCBO to set up the Crown Corporation" Sousa said in the letter to municipalities. "Our priority is to reduce the illegal market by building on our strengths to create an efficient and secure system for people across the province."

The public will also be notified about the proposed store locations and will be asked to provide feedback directly to the LCBO, he said. None of the retail stores will be located near schools, Sousa said.

Watch: Cannabis activists say they still have work to do after legalization

Ontario was the first province to announce a detailed plan to sell and distribute recreational marijuana and will set the legal age to purchase it at 19.

The federal government introduced legislation in April with a goal of legalizing and regulating the use of recreational pot by July 1, 2018, but left it up to individual provinces to design their own distribution system and usage regulations.

Consumption of legal weed will not be allowed in public spaces or workplaces and should be confined to private residences, the province has said.

We feel very comfortable that the regime that we will put in place will be a significant deterrent for these illegal businesses. Attorney General Yasir Naqvi

The government introduced its marijuana legislation earlier this week, which contains new penalties for people that are convicted of illegally selling or distributing cannabis, including fines of up to $250,000 and/or jail of up to two years less a day.

For every day those people or businesses continue to sell marijuana after being convicted the first time, they will be subject to further fines of up to $100,000 and $500,000, respectively.

Attorney General Yasir Naqvi said the government will clamp down on illegal distribution channels.

"We are going to work very hard towards that," he said. "We have put very strict penalties in that regards. We feel very comfortable that the regime that we will put in place will be a significant deterrent for these illegal businesses."
TITLE: 14 Ontario Cities Will Host Province's First LCBO Pot Dispensaries

SUMMARY:
Die Jamaikaner schippern ohne Kompass auf der See, kreuzen dieses und jenes Thema, aber wissen nicht, wo sie Anker werfen wollen‚Äú, sagte Nahles der "Passauer Neuen Presse" ("PNP") vom Samstag.
Auch CDU-Chefin Angela Merkel sagte, sie glaube an ein Zustandekommen des B√ºndnisses.
Denn alles andere w√ºrde Neuwahlen bedeuten ‚Äì aus denen die SPD kaum gest√§rkt hervorgehen w√ºrde.
Parteienforscher Oskar Niedermayer sagt √ºber die SPD: "Verweigert sie sich weiterhin Gespr√§chen, h√§tte sie den Schwarzen Peter f√ºr Neuwahlen, w√ºrde sie sich doch mit der Union arrangieren, verl√∂re sie ihre Glaubw√ºrdigkeit."
"Die SPD ist keine Mehrheitsreserve im Wartestand", sagte Nahles der "PNP".
TEXT:
SPD-Fraktionschefin Nahles hat gegen die Jamaika-Verhandler gekeilt

Dabei m√ºssen die Sozialdemokraten froh sein, wenn die Koalition zustande kommt

Die SPD zerfleischt sich intern zwar selbst, gibt sich nach au√üen in ihrer Oppositionsrolle aber souver√§n: SPD-Bundestagsfraktionschefin Andrea Nahles schimpft heftig √ºber die Koalitionsverhandlungen der Jamaika-Verhandler.

"Das Ganze wirkt wie eine Kreuzfahrt ohne Ziel. Die Jamaikaner schippern ohne Kompass auf der See, kreuzen dieses und jenes Thema, aber wissen nicht, wo sie Anker werfen wollen‚Äú, sagte Nahles der "Passauer Neuen Presse" ("PNP") vom Samstag.

Auch Parteichef Martin Schulz bekr√§ftigte im Gespr√§ch mit dem Redaktionsnetzwerk Deutschland seine Kritik und warf Union, FDP und Gr√ºnen Respektlosigkeit vor den W√§hlern vor.

"Kompromiss oder die Veranstaltung ist zu Ende"

Nahles monierte, dass alle Grundsatzfragen auch sechs Wochen nach der Wahl noch nicht gekl√§rt seien.

Tats√§chlich tun sich CSU, CDU, FDP und Gr√ºne bei gro√üen Themen wie Fl√ºchtlings-, Umwelt- und Finanzpolitik schwer, einen gemeinsamen Nenner zu finden. Die Parteien hatten in Sondierungsgespr√§chen zw√∂lf Themenkomplexe grob besprochen.

√Ñu√üerungen der vergangenen Tage zeigen, wie weit die Parteien noch auseinander liegen.

Helmut Markwort, Herausgeber des Magazins "Focus", zitiert FDP-Vize Kubicki mit den Worten: "Es fehlt das Grundvertrauen." Im ZDF sagte Kubicki am Freitagabend: "Wir m√ºssen jetzt in der n√§chsten Woche Kompromisse finden, oder die Veranstaltung ist zu Ende."

FDP und Gr√ºne hatten sich am meisten gestritten.

Der bayerische Ministerpr√§sident Horst Seehofer (CSU) bezeichnete die am Freitag abgeschlossene erste Phase der Sondierungen dagegen als insgesamt in Ordnung. "Manche Zwischent√∂ne waren entbehrlich, aber das hat nichts ge√§ndert an der Tatsache, dass wir gut vorangekommen sind."

Auch CDU-Chefin Angela Merkel sagte, sie glaube an ein Zustandekommen des B√ºndnisses.

Wenn Jamaika scheitert, scheitert auch die SPD

Trotz aller Kritik geht auch die SPD-F√ºhrung von einem Jamaika-B√ºndnis aus. Sie muss sogar darauf hoffen. Denn alles andere w√ºrde Neuwahlen bedeuten ‚Äì aus denen die SPD kaum gest√§rkt hervorgehen w√ºrde.

Parteienforscher Oskar Niedermayer sagt √ºber die SPD: "Verweigert sie sich weiterhin Gespr√§chen, h√§tte sie den Schwarzen Peter f√ºr Neuwahlen, w√ºrde sie sich doch mit der Union arrangieren, verl√∂re sie ihre Glaubw√ºrdigkeit."

Mit der Union aber will die SPD-F√ºhrung keinesfalls noch einmal koalieren. "Die SPD ist keine Mehrheitsreserve im Wartestand", sagte Nahles der "PNP".

Mit Material von dpa

(lk)
TITLE: SPD-Politikerin Nahles schimpft √ºber Jamaika-Gespr√§che: "Kreuzfahrt ohne Ziel"

SUMMARY:
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi attends a function to mark the national Panchayati Raj or village civil council day, in New Delhi, India, Friday, April 24, 2015.
(AP Photo/Manish Swarup)ADVERTISEMENTInternet search giant Google apologised yesterday for any confusion or misunderstanding that arose over the listing of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs photos appearing in image search results for query on ‚ÄúTop 10 criminals in India‚Äù.
As more and more stories connect Narendra Modi to the keywords ‚Äútop 10 criminals‚Äù in news stories and on Twitter, this search result is likely to become indelible unless Google takes deliberate steps to remove Narendra Modi from the result.
This is what they did with George W. Bush, who is no longer the top search result for "miserable failure".
As long as Google remains the world's most popular search engine, SEO experts and hackers will continue their attempts to influence search results, for amusement and profit.
TEXT:
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi attends a function to mark the national Panchayati Raj or village civil council day, in New Delhi, India, Friday, April 24, 2015. Modi on Friday urged Panchayat members to work with a five-year vision with concrete development plans to bring about positive changes in their village and also emphasized on the need for education, according to local reports. (AP Photo/Manish Swarup)

ADVERTISEMENT

Internet search giant Google apologised yesterday for any confusion or misunderstanding that arose over the listing of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs photos appearing in image search results for query on ‚ÄúTop 10 criminals in India‚Äù.

But Modi is not the only misfit on that page. The search page also includes eminent public figures like Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, the founder of Art of Living, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, Lawyer and Politician Ram Jethmalani, Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates, and Bollywood actress Sonakshi Sinha.

So what exactly is going on? This isn‚Äôt the first time that Google‚Äôs algorithm has thrown up some completely whacked out results. A popular technique, known as ‚ÄòGoogle bombing‚Äô was used by pranksters and SEO experts to make George W. Bush the first result for the term ‚Äòmiserable failure‚Äô.

Nothing personal about it: Modi‚Äôs photo appears thrice in Google Image search, right next to extremists like Hafeez Saeed and Osama Bin Laden

If you take a closer look at the source for these results where Narendra Modi‚Äôs photo comes from, two of these are from Topyaps.com, which is creating a perfect viral storm with this post. Another one of these photos comes from a 2014 newswire where Modi promised that the Supreme Court will set up special courts to deal with politicians with criminal backgrounds. Scroll further down, and you now see reaction stories to this new development being indexed too.

As more and more stories connect Narendra Modi to the keywords ‚Äútop 10 criminals‚Äù in news stories and on Twitter, this search result is likely to become indelible unless Google takes deliberate steps to remove Narendra Modi from the result. This is what they did with George W. Bush, who is no longer the top search result for "miserable failure".

Just a few weeks ago, users found out that typing ‚ÄúNigga House‚Äù in Google Maps would direct the user to the White House. In that particular case, it turns out hackers had created a fictitious business which was verified by Google. The next step is to have this business reclaimed from another Google account, which then allows you to change the name and location of the business.

As long as Google remains the world's most popular search engine, SEO experts and hackers will continue their attempts to influence search results, for amusement and profit.

Like Us On Facebook |

Follow Us On Twitter |

Contact HuffPost India
TITLE: India's Top 10 Criminals: Modi Is Not The Only Misfit In The Gallery

SUMMARY:
The ferocity of the Tory reaction to Gavin Williamson‚Äôs promotion yesterday was pretty extraordinary yesterday.
Some of them say his critics are motivated by both jealousy and snobbery (Williamson is a northerner who went to state school).
It may be that Williamson overspun his own role in Fallon‚Äôs downfall on Wednesday night, itself more evidence of inexperience.
In fact, Andrea Leadsom appears to have had a much more important role in his resignation (see below) than the Chief Whip.
The new occupant of the post, Julian Smith, is well-liked but he is also seen by some as Williamson‚Äôs leadership campaign manager.
TEXT:
The ferocity of the Tory reaction to Gavin Williamson‚Äôs promotion yesterday was pretty extraordinary yesterday. Within minutes of the announcement, my phone was red hot with the fury. In person, on the phone, via text and WhatsApp, ministers and MPs didn‚Äôt hold back. Nearly all of them saw the decision to install the Chief Whip as the new Defence Secretary as further confirmation of Theresa May‚Äôs weakened authority and tactical ineptitude.

Allies of both the PM and Williamson claim the move was merely a way of getting trusted colleagues into top jobs to steady the ship as quickly as possible after Fallon‚Äôs departure. Some of them say his critics are motivated by both jealousy and snobbery (Williamson is a northerner who went to state school). And yet that doesn‚Äôt explain why such a wide variety of ministers ‚ÄìBrexiteers and Remainers, women and men, young and old ‚Äì were so angry. The complaints were threefold: May had undermined the Whips‚Äô Office when stability was most needed, rewarded a completely inexperienced crony and missed a great chance to promote women. Read my full analysis of the backlash against ‚Äòthe not-so-Amazing SpiderMan‚Äô HERE. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a self-serving c*nt,‚Äù said one MP. And that was a woman.

It may be that Williamson overspun his own role in Fallon‚Äôs downfall on Wednesday night, itself more evidence of inexperience. In fact, Andrea Leadsom appears to have had a much more important role in his resignation (see below) than the Chief Whip. No.10 insiders insist he did not advise the PM on the reshuffle, and didn‚Äôt effectively appoint himself. That‚Äôs how tangled this web is.

What mattered more was the anger with May. I haven‚Äôt experienced this level of vitriol about a Tory leader since MPs openly briefed against Iain Duncan Smith during that fateful party conference in the Winter Gardens in Blackpool in 2003. IDS was gone within months. Even the abuse David Cameron got was nothing compared to the sheer despair expressed yesterday. One telling quote came from a senior minister, who is normally loyal to the PM but now fears she lacks the leadership to steer the country through Brexit: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs real ‚Äòend of days‚Äô stuff. He‚Äôs a real slimeball, with his own leadership team already in place. I‚Äôve tried my best to serve in this Government to keep things on the road, but now I wonder why.‚Äù

The very idea that Williamson even thinks he could be the next Tory leader is greeted with incredulity and laughter among many colleagues. They say that given the party‚Äôs problems connecting with the public, the answer isn‚Äôt a grey man who lacks public speaking skills, media experience, ministerial nous or even a clear political agenda. That‚Äôs even before you take into account what is obviously a deep dislike of him among some MPs. What‚Äôs odd is that the PM wasn‚Äôt aware of the depth of that dislike, but then again it‚Äôs normally the job of the whips to provide such intelligence‚Ä¶and he and Julian Smith may not have been best placed to pass it on.

There‚Äôs a very good reason why Chief Whips are usually older MPs, with the job seen as a final role in office, not a stepping stone to further advancement: they advise PMs on promotions and have to be seen as ‚Äòout of the game‚Äô. The new occupant of the post, Julian Smith, is well-liked but he is also seen by some as Williamson‚Äôs leadership campaign manager. And for a PM already on the rack, that may be her biggest mistake of all.
TITLE: The Waugh Zone Friday November 3, 2017

TEXT:
Die Firma "Bunker Pflanzenextrakte" will die gr√∂√üte Cannabis-Farm Deutschlands er√∂ffnen

Und zwar in einem Bunker aus dem Kalten Krieg in Buxheim in Bayern

Warum genau dort und wie es im Inneren aussieht, erfahrt ihr im Video oben

Was mit Relikten aus Kriegszeiten passieren soll, ist nicht immer einfach zu entscheiden. Alte Wacht√ºrme und Milit√§rstationen finden sich √ºber ganz Deutschland verteilt. Sie stehen teilweise leer und verfallen seit Jahrzehnten.

Umso praktischer, wenn sich f√ºr die alten Geb√§ude ein sinnvoller Nutzen findet. So nun auch geschehen in Buxheim in Bayern. Ein alter Milit√§rbunker aus der Zeit des Kalten Krieges soll nun n√§mlich zu Deutschlands gr√∂√üter Cannabis-Farm umfunktioniert werden.

F√ºr Medizin und Forschung

Christoph Rossner, Manager der ‚ÄúBunker Pflanzenextrakte‚Äù, erkl√§rt, der Bunker biete gen√ºgend Schutz, Platz und Energieversorgung f√ºr das Vorhaben. Die Marihuana-Pflanzen sollen sowohl der Wissenschaft zugute kommen, als auch f√ºr medizinische Zwecke genutzt werden. Der Anbau soll ab M√§rz 2018 beginnen.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: 10 Krankheiten, bei deren Behandlung Cannabis helfen kann

Der Memmingerberg Bunker ist 15 Meter hoch, 50 Meter lang und liegt ungef√§hr 15 Kilometer vom Flughafen in Memmingen entfernt.

Im Januar wurden die deutschen Gesetze ge√§ndert

Im Januar wurden in Deutschland die Gesetze bez√ºglich medizinischem Marihuana weiter ausgedehnt und es wurde weitgehend legalisiert. √Ñrzte d√ºrfen nun Rezepte daf√ºr ausstellen, und Krankenkassen m√ºssen den Konsum in manchen F√§llen √ºbernehmen.

TITLE: In diesem Bunker soll die gr√∂√üte Cannabis-Farm Deutschlands entstehen - er steht mitten in Bayern

SUMMARY:
La premi√®re question r√©currente pos√©e sur la refonte du Parlement est la suivante: faut-il supprimer le S√©nat?
La France a besoin d'une assembl√©e repr√©sentant les territoires, en recompositions constantes depuis au moins dix ans.
Le pouvoir actuel organise une telle d√©rive technocratique, que la renforcer au Parlement confinera √† la saturation.
Cumulant d√©sormais moins les mandats, il cumule dans le meilleur des cas une exp√©rience d'expert-citoyen dans les domaines qu'il suit.
Le d√©put√© serait alors identifi√© comme √©lu privil√©gi√© pour organiser la m√©diation entre les √©lecteurs de proximit√© et la Nation.
TEXT:
R√©nover la fonction l√©gislative de notre d√©mocratie est indispensable. En effet, face au pr√©sidentialisme tout-puissant, les parlementaires doivent davantage occuper l'espace de leur pouvoir.

La premi√®re question r√©currente pos√©e sur la refonte du Parlement est la suivante: faut-il supprimer le S√©nat? R√©ponse en toutes lettres: NON. La France a besoin d'une assembl√©e repr√©sentant les territoires, en recompositions constantes depuis au moins dix ans. Le S√©nat doit continuer √† articuler l'organisation d√©centralis√©e avec l'indivisibilit√© r√©publicaine. Pour √™tre plus l√©gitimes, cent s√©nateurs au total pourraient √™tre √©lus dans les 13 r√©gions aux p√©rim√®tres r√©cemment revus. Ils proc√©deraient du suffrage universel direct, lors d'un scrutin simultan√© d'√©lections locales regroup√©es.

Une assembl√©e nationale proche des √©lecteurs

La seconde question est la suivante: faut-il moins de d√©put√©s? Le gouvernement le souhaite. Au nombre de 577, il s'agirait d'en compter 400. Or, il y en e√ªt plus de 600 lorsque la France comptait deux fois moins d'habitants... Le d√©put√© est en droit un repr√©sentant de la Nation, et en fait, un m√©diateur entre l'int√©r√™t national et ses √©lecteurs. Il doit leur rester proche. Or, il y a en moyenne un d√©put√© pour 115.000 habitants; est-ce trop? NON. D'ailleurs, les thurif√©raires de l'efficacit√© tous azimuts veulent aussi, paradoxe, augmenter le recrutement des collaborateurs... Moins d'√©lus pour plus d'agents: la logique est-elle d√©mocratique? Le pouvoir actuel organise une telle d√©rive technocratique, que la renforcer au Parlement confinera √† la saturation.

R√©nover la fabrique de la loi

Un d√©put√© ou un s√©nateur qui retrouve le sens de la fabrique de la loi se consacre √† sa t√¢che d√©lib√©rative et au contr√¥le de l'administration. Cumulant d√©sormais moins les mandats, il cumule dans le meilleur des cas une exp√©rience d'expert-citoyen dans les domaines qu'il suit. √Ä cet √©gard, il est urgent de former autrement que par s√©minaires one shot les √©lus de la Nation. Ensuite, comment am√©liorer le travail parlementaire? Nombre de propositions sont faites au sujet du fonctionnement interne.

Insistons surtout sur l'inclusion continue des citoyens √† la fabrique l√©gislative. L'organisation r√©guli√®re de r√©unions, afin de tester et/ou de penser des amendements ou des dispositions l√©gislatives, devrait devenir la norme dans chaque circonscription ‚Äìd'o√π l'int√©r√™t de leur garder une taille raisonnable. Tout parlementaire durant son mandat organiserait obligatoirement au moins deux concertations publiques sur des textes dans lesquels il s'investit. Le r√®glement des assembl√©es proposerait aussi des outils num√©riques pour stimuler cette participation citoyenne. TEXT:
Contestants in the Miss Per√∫ 2018 beauty pageant made a powerful statement about violence against women on Sunday night.

Usually, contestants introduce themselves one by one stating their names and their body measurements including bust, waist and hip measurements. This year, instead of giving their measurements, the contestants decided to highlight much more important numbers: each woman listed a fact about violence against women in Per√∫.

Each of the contestants highlighted different subjects including femicide (or killing of women because they‚Äôre female) street harassment, and sexual abuse.

Scroll below to see some of the first few statements from pageant contestants.

1. ‚ÄúMy name is Camila Canicoba and I represent the department of Lima. My measurements are: 2,202 cases of femicides reported in the last nine years in my country.‚Äù

2. ‚ÄúMy name is Karen Cueto, and I represent Lima. And my measurements are: 82 femicides and 156 attempts so far this year.‚Äù

3. ‚ÄúMy name is Juana Acevedo and my measurements are: More than 70 percent of women in our country are victims of street harassment.‚Äù

4. ‚ÄúMy name is Melody Calder√≥n, and I represent La Libertad. My measurements are: 81 percent of aggressors of girls younger than 5 are close to the family.‚Äù

5. ‚ÄúAlmendra Marroquin greets you, representative of Ca√±ete. And my measurements are: More than 25 percent of girls and teens are abused in their schools.‚Äù

6. ‚ÄúMy name is B√©lgica Guerra. I represent Chincha. And my measurements are: 65 percent of women who attend university are assaulted by their partners.‚Äù

As BuzzFeed pointed out, the women were not alone in their protest. During the swimsuit portion of the competition, the pageant organizers displayed different media headlines of stories about the murder and assault of women in Per√∫.

‚ÄúEveryone who does not denounce and everyone who does not do something to stop this is an accomplice,‚Äù pageant organizer Jessica Newton told BuzzFeed.

Skip to 3:45 to watch the full moment.
TITLE: Pageant Contestants Highlight Violence Against Women Instead Of Their Measurements

DONALD TRUMP - Il y a pr√®s d'un an, le 8 novembre 2016, Donald Trump √©tait √©lu √† la t√™te des Etats-Unis.
