We already know Mindy Kaling is pregnant with her first child, but the news hasn't felt real until now.
In the pic, Kaling's baby bump is front and centre as she delivers the line, "Exsqueeze me, sir?!?!"
Just check out these tweets:I am living for @mindykaling's baby bump ‚Äî Jess (@rekaBacisseJ) November 3, 2017@mindykaling posted a photo of her beautiful baby bump today and I feel like a very proud parent.
November 3, 2017@mindykaling just posted her baby bump and I'm so happy!
I was anticipating this day more than @Beyonces baby bump.
TEXT:
We already know Mindy Kaling is pregnant with her first child, but the news hasn't felt real until now.

On Thursday, the 38-year-old actress shared a bittersweet image of herself recording the final voiceovers for the sixth and final season of her show "The Mindy Project." In the pic, Kaling's baby bump is front and centre as she delivers the line, "Exsqueeze me, sir?!?!"

how I look recording Mindy Lahiri's lines. "Exsqueeze me, sir?!?!" #themindyproject #laterbaby A post shared by Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) on Nov 2, 2017 at 2:48pm PDT

Although this isn't the first time we've seen Kaling's growing bump, it is the first time her pregnancy curves have really shown, and her fans are here for it.

Just check out these tweets:

I am living for @mindykaling's baby bump ‚Äî Jess (@rekaBacisseJ) November 3, 2017

@mindykaling posted a photo of her beautiful baby bump today and I feel like a very proud parent. November 3, 2017

@mindykaling just posted her baby bump and I'm so happy! I was anticipating this day more than @Beyonces baby bump. ‚ù§Ô∏èüíôüë∂üèæ pic.twitter.com/J7eTu9ddat ‚Äî isnana mani wi (@rika_james) November 3, 2017

Kaling confirmed last month that she's having a baby girl. During an appearance on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show," the mom-to-be admitted she wanted to know the gender of her child "way early."

However, the father of her child is still unknown. When the actress' pregnancy news broke in July, a source revealed to People magazine, "She's not telling anyone ‚Äî not even close friends ‚Äî who the father is."

Despite this (and her nerves), the actress is excited to become a mom.

In a previous interview with "The Today Show," Kaling revealed what kind of mom she hopes to be. "Right now, I just feel so anxious," she said. "But I'd like to be the fun mom. I know I'm gonna be the dorky mom, so it could be kind of fun, too. I think that would be nice."

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Mindy Kaling Finally Gives Us A Glimpse Of Her Adorable Baby Bump

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTThe Morning Wrap is HuffPost India's selection of interesting news and opinion from the day's newspapers.
The forced displacement of ethnic Rohingya people from the Rakhine state of Myanmar has resulted in a massive refugee crisis in South Asia and left India with a missed opportunity to prove its neighbourly worth.
When Osama bin Laden wasn't planning terrorist attacks, such as 9/11, he was apparently watching YouTube videos like "Charlie Bit My Finger", among other pop cultural things, such as Tom & Jerry cartoons.
OpinionEver since Hardik Patel came in contact with the Congress, he has been vacillating from one extreme to another.
The 19th Party Congress has re-identified the 'principal contradiction' facing society.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

The Morning Wrap is HuffPost India's selection of interesting news and opinion from the day's newspapers. Subscribe here to receive it in your inbox each weekday morning.

Essential HuffPost

The National Human Rights Commission has issued a notice to the Uttar Pradesh government over the death of 26 people in a blast at an NTPC plant in Rae Bareli.

The forced displacement of ethnic Rohingya people from the Rakhine state of Myanmar has resulted in a massive refugee crisis in South Asia and left India with a missed opportunity to prove its neighbourly worth.

When Osama bin Laden wasn't planning terrorist attacks, such as 9/11, he was apparently watching YouTube videos like "Charlie Bit My Finger", among other pop cultural things, such as Tom & Jerry cartoons.

Main News

The CIA has released over 470,000 files from the raid carried out on the late Osama bin Laden's hideout, excluding classified information sensitive to national security, as also a cache of pornography, pop songs and malware.

All unwelcome physical contact cannot be called sexual harassment unless it is in the nature of a sexually oriented behaviour, the Delhi High Court has said.

Scientists have found a previously undiscovered hidden chamber in Egypt's Great Pyramid of Giza, the first such discovery in the structure since the 19th century.

Off The Front Page

An increase in sales volumes of consumer packaged goods companies has boosted hopes of a recovery in consumption demand, indicating the possible end of the lingering effects of last year's demonetisation and the Goods and Services Tax regime in July.

Hitting out at Rahul Gandhi for meeting the Chinese Ambassador during the recent border standoff at Doklam, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said it was a matter of "great sadness" that the Congress Vice-President did not "trust the country or its government" during that period.

The United States Senate on Thursday unanimously confirmed Kenneth Ian Juster as the next ambassador to India, filling a position that has been vacant for months after Richard Verma, an Obama appointee, left in the traditional churn accompanying the administration change.

Opinion

Ever since Hardik Patel came in contact with the Congress, he has been vacillating from one extreme to another. The party has also been trying a balancing act between the Patidars, Dalits and other backward classes. Will this turn of events prove to be the Congress' pain or gain? asks Aurangzeb Nashqbandi in the Hindustan Times.

The Hindu asks three leading experts whether sexual harassers should be named and shamed in public. The answers, unsurprisingly, range from 'Yes', 'No' and 'It's complicated'.

The 19th Party Congress has re-identified the 'principal contradiction' facing society. There will be consequences, warns Jahangir Aziz in The Indian Express.

Also on HuffPost
TITLE: The Morning Wrap: India's Missed Opportunity; Osama Bin Laden's Favourite Things

SUMMARY:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Competition laws will allow Amazon to undercut local businesses with loss-making prices when it opens for business in Australia, expected to be later in November, the Australian competition regulator said on Saturday.
Australian Competition and Consumer Commission Chairman Rod Sims told Fairfax Media that Amazon.com.Inc was able under law to set prices low enough to win business without breaching competition laws.
Australian Small Business Minister Michael McCormack has said he will watch Amazon closely to ensure it pays its fair share of tax.
"Amazon pays all the taxes we are required to pay in every country where we operate," an Amazon spokeswoman told Fairfax.
Australian Small Business and Family Enterprise Ombudsman Kate Carnell said her organization has not seen a copy of the contract under which Amazon will allow small businesses to operate in its marketplace.
TEXT:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Competition laws will allow Amazon to undercut local businesses with loss-making prices when it opens for business in Australia, expected to be later in November, the Australian competition regulator said on Saturday.

Australian Competition and Consumer Commission Chairman Rod Sims told Fairfax Media that Amazon.com.Inc was able under law to set prices low enough to win business without breaching competition laws.

"In terms of misuse of market power, if you open a store in a new town and you set a common price point, you are going to lose money initially if you don't have scale," he said.

"Eventually, if you get your business plan right, you will make that price point, that is in no way illegal."

Amazon has declined to comment on when its Australian operations will begin. It has been building a distribution warehouse in the southern city of Melbourne.

Amazon country manager Rocco Braeuniger is due to hold a meeting in Sydney where he is expected to address more than 500 local suppliers.

Australian Small Business Minister Michael McCormack has said he will watch Amazon closely to ensure it pays its fair share of tax.

"Amazon pays all the taxes we are required to pay in every country where we operate," an Amazon spokeswoman told Fairfax.

Perceived tax avoidance by large foreign companies is a big issue in Australia, and the government is now enforcing new measures known as the "Earned here, Taxed here" corporate tax laws.

Australian Small Business and Family Enterprise Ombudsman Kate Carnell said her organization has not seen a copy of the contract under which Amazon will allow small businesses to operate in its marketplace.
TITLE: Amazon Will Be Able To Legally Set Super-Low Prices And Undercut Local Aussie Competition

‚ÄúThis is getting a bit old with Jeff Sessions,‚Äù Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) told Fox News‚Äô Chris Wallace on Sunday.
‚ÄúHe probably should come back and answer the question, yet again, ‚ÄòDid you know anything about an effort by the Trump campaign to meet with Russia?‚Äô‚Äù
TEXT:
WASHINGTON ‚Äï The top Democrat on the Senate Judiciary Committee said on Sunday she wants Attorney General Jeff Sessions to testify again before the panel to clarify past claims that he was unaware of any communication between members of Donald Trump‚Äôs presidential campaign and Russian officials.

Sessions has already testified before the committee twice under oath ‚Äï during his confirmation hearing in January and during a routine oversight hearing last month ‚Äï that he was unaware of communications between the Trump team and Russia. But according to recently unsealed court documents, former Trump campaign foreign policy adviser George Papadopoulos spoke multiple times with Russians about setting up a meeting between then-presidential candidate Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin. And Papadopoulos, according to the documents. described his efforts during a meeting on March 31, 2016, that included Trump and Sessions.

Sen. Dianne Feinstein (D-Calif.) said on CNN she plans to discuss summoning Sessions back before the Judiciary Committee with the panel‚Äôs chairman, Sen. Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa). She declined to say whether she believed Sessions intentionally misled the committee in the past ‚Äï but said the attorney general should focus on getting his facts straight.

‚ÄúMaybe he has a faulty memory. So, there are a lot of excuses one can make.‚Äù Feinstein said. ‚ÄúBut at this stage, he‚Äôs got to narrow his recollections. When he comes before the committee again, he has to be precise, and it has to be accurate,‚Äù she said.

Feinstein on Sessions: "When he comes before the committee again, he has to be precise and it has to be accurate" https://t.co/RdXYj0e9qC ‚Äî CNN Politics (@CNNPolitics) November 5, 2017

Since the unsealing on Monday of the court documents concerning Papadopoulos ‚Äï who has pleaded guilty to lying to the FBI about his contacts with Russian officials during the campaign ‚Äï Democrats on the Judiciary Committee have been pushing for Sessions to explain the discrepancy between the information in them and his testimony.

The attorney general has been given the chance to clarify past testimony, ‚Äúyet he only continued to mislead,‚Äù Sen. Patrick Leahy (D-Vt.) said in a statement. ‚ÄúHe now needs to come back before the committee, in person, under oath, to explain why he cannot seem to provide truthful, complete answers to these important and relevant questions.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think he told me the truth,‚Äù Sen. Al Franken (D-Minn.) told ABC late last week. ‚ÄúI think that on different occasions he either has a terrible memory or he is deliberately not telling me the truth.‚Äù

Lawmakers‚Äô frustration with Sessions may be gaining bipartisan traction.

‚ÄúThis is getting a bit old with Jeff Sessions,‚Äù Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) told Fox News‚Äô Chris Wallace on Sunday. ‚ÄúHe probably should come back and answer the question, yet again, ‚ÄòDid you know anything about an effort by the Trump campaign to meet with Russia?‚Äô‚Äù
TITLE: Jeff Sessions Needs To Give 'Precise' Testimony About Trump's Campaign And Russia: Feinstein

SUMMARY:
But there is a puzzle in here: Typically, when the job situation improves, the length of time it takes to find work gets shorter.
It takes out-of-work Canadians nearly as long today to find a job as it did at the height of the Great Recession.
For years prior to the last recession, the length of time it took to find a job in Canada averaged around 15 weeks.
But according to a new analysis from Desjardins, that number is around 20 weeks today.
"People are more optimistic, they are less in a rush to find something," she told HuffPost Canada in an interview.
TEXT:
Canada's job market is on fire these days, with the unemployment rate near decade lows and a massive 397,000 full-time jobs created over the past year.

But there is a puzzle in here: Typically, when the job situation improves, the length of time it takes to find work gets shorter.

This time around, though, that hasn't happened. It takes out-of-work Canadians nearly as long today to find a job as it did at the height of the Great Recession.

For years prior to the last recession, the length of time it took to find a job in Canada averaged around 15 weeks. But according to a new analysis from Desjardins, that number is around 20 weeks today.

"The number of weeks spent unemployed, i.e. looking for a job, speaks to many people's reality," Desjardins senior economist H√©l√®ne B√©gin wrote.

B√©gin does have a theory about this, and if she's right, it may not be all bad news: It may be that good economic times are making Canadians more picky about the work they choose.

"People are more optimistic, they are less in a rush to find something," she told HuffPost Canada in an interview.

The job situation prior to the last recession wasn't as good as it is today, so Canadians may have been more willing to take what they could get at that time, she suggested.

"But now most people are aware that companies are looking for workers."

On the other hand, it may just be that it's getting harder to find a high-quality job.

Either way, B√©gin notes that five months is a long time to be out of work.

"This is why it is important to have some savings to fall back on in the event of a job loss," she wrote.

Also on HuffPost:
TITLE: Length Of Time It Takes To Find Work In Canada Is Still At Recession Highs

SUMMARY:
Russell Crowe has voiced frustrations on Sunday over criticism he has received for his offer to take and find work for six men held by Australia on Manus Island, after labelling the escalating crisis as "a nation's shame".
It's fucking disgraceful ‚Äî Russell Crowe (@russellcrowe) November 1, 2017I've thought about this .
In multiple separate posts to Facebook, Crowe's critiques questioned everything from his place in discussing politics to his ability to house just six of the asylum seekers despite being a Hollywood actor.
"Russell Crowe is another joke.
Doesn't change that what Australia has done to these men on Manus is appalling ‚Äî Russell Crowe (@russellcrowe) November 5, 2017If one of the men on Manus was your brother, your Uncle, your Father...your son...
TEXT:
"The world is watching Australia [and] we look like assholes."

Russell Crowe has voiced frustrations on Sunday over criticism he has received for his offer to take and find work for six men held by Australia on Manus Island, after labelling the escalating crisis as "a nation's shame".

On Thursday, Crowe tweeted his belief that he could accommodate some of the 600 asylum seekers who are currently stranded on Papua New Guinea's Manus Island, abandoned by the Australian government, fearful local residents could attack them if they leave the soon-to-close detention centre and worried local authorities will attack them if they stay.

Manus. A Nations shame. Lives held in limbo . Lives lived in fear & despair . It's fucking disgraceful ‚Äî Russell Crowe (@russellcrowe) November 1, 2017

I've thought about this . I believe I could house and find jobs for 6. I'm sure there'd be other Australians who would do the same November 1, 2017

Since then, the 'Gladiator' star has faced a barrage of criticism from people angered by his focus on foreign asylum seekers over struggling Australians.

In multiple separate posts to Facebook, Crowe's critiques questioned everything from his place in discussing politics to his ability to house just six of the asylum seekers despite being a Hollywood actor.

"Russell Crowe is another joke. He has no business interfering with the government process. His ill informed opinion is just regurgetated [sic] fodder from those with a political agenda," one post said.

On Sunday Crowe hit back in another series of tweets, saying the negative feedback "doesn't change that what Australia has done to these men on Manus is appalling".

Go ahead write stupid articles, send me abuse, call me naive. Doesn't change that what Australia has done to these men on Manus is appalling ‚Äî Russell Crowe (@russellcrowe) November 5, 2017

If one of the men on Manus was your brother, your Uncle, your Father...your son... The world is watching Australia & we look like assholes ‚Äî Russell Crowe (@russellcrowe) November 5, 2017

Crowe's offer came as New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Arden said she would raise the issue with Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull, following the closure of the Manus Island detention centre, in their first meeting since she secured her country's leadership.

And while, during that meeting, Ardern offered on Sunday to take 150 asylum seekers currently in PNG and Nauru and accommodate them in New Zealand, Turnbull declined the offer -- instead prioritising Australia's existing refugee deal with the United States. Under that agreement, 1,250 refugees from the two Pacific nations will be resettled in the US.

The world is watching Australia & we look like a--holes. Russell Crowe

Meanwhile, the 600 asylum seekers still on Manus Island continue to face horrific conditions, faced by threats of violence, dehydration, starvation, no medicine, disease and heat -- a situation for which he UN High Commissioner on Human Rights has condemned the Australian government.
TITLE: Russell Crowe Hits Back At Criticism Over His Housing Offer To Manus Asylum Seekers

Mandy Horvath joined the dating website two months ago after hopelessly searching for her perfect match.
The 24-year-old, who lost both her legs three years ago after being involved in a train accident, decided to showcase her dark sense of humour.
CatersSince her accident she has been determined not let her disability take over her life and enjoys reading the hilarious jokes her Tinder matches send.
‚ÄúMy sense of humour in my Tinder bio is so funny, the jokes people send back have me in fits of laughter.
TEXT:
A double amputee has been inundated with suitors on Tinder after posting a witty bio mocking her own disability. Mandy Horvath joined the dating website two months ago after hopelessly searching for her perfect match. The 24-year-old, who lost both her legs three years ago after being involved in a train accident, decided to showcase her dark sense of humour. Referring to herself as a ‚Äòstand-up comedian,‚Äô and stating that she‚Äôll ‚Äònever run away‚Äô when things get tough, Mandy has bagged herself dozens of dates.

Caters

Since her accident she has been determined not let her disability take over her life and enjoys reading the hilarious jokes her Tinder matches send. Despite not yet meeting the man of her dreams, Mandy feels she‚Äôs one step closer thanks to the dating phone app. Mandy, who lives in Colorado, United States, said: ‚ÄúSince my accident happened, humour has been the driving force and it has made my recovery a lot easier. ‚ÄúMy sense of humour in my Tinder bio is so funny, the jokes people send back have me in fits of laughter. ‚ÄúPeople tend to love how open I am and it‚Äôs definitely helped secure a few dates. ‚ÄúI was hit by an passing train in 2014 after a night out with friends and lost both my legs above the knee. ‚ÄúIt was so traumatic losing my legs but I‚Äôve coped by joking about being legless every day, so it was only right to do so on my dating profile to connect with people in my own way.‚Äù

Caters

After watching an inspirational YouTube video about dating as a disabled woman, Mandy decided to set up a profile on popular dating app, Tinder. Despite spending years after her accident avoiding dating, due to being too nervous and self-conscious, Mandy‚Äôs confidence has grown since setting up her profile. Mandy added: ‚ÄúWhen I tried to date after I lost my legs I would always get guys asking me ‚Äòhow does sex work for you‚Äô, and it completely put me off dating. ‚ÄúI was completely alienated from any sort of romantic opportunity due to my own lack of insight. ‚ÄúBut now that I‚Äôve broken the ice and sexualised my disability with my humour, I am acknowledged as an individual rather than someone bound to a wheelchair. ‚ÄúThe reactions I get to my profile are hilarious, supportive and kind. ‚ÄúGenerally people respond in shock and awe, as well as humour and interest in how I was hit by a train. ‚ÄúMy favourite part of my profile is my title of ‚Äòstand up comedian‚Äô ‚Äì even though most people genuinely ask me where they can come and see me perform and don‚Äôt realise it‚Äôs a joke.‚Äù

Caters
TITLE: Double Amputee's Hilarious Tinder Bio Is Pure Genius

Bei der LACMA Art and Film Gala gestern Abend in Los Angeles gaben sich die Stars die Klinke in die Hand: Neben Hollywood-Diva Jane Fonda (79), Dakota Johnson (28) und Kim Kardashian (37) war auch "Victoria's Secret"-Model Behati Prinsloo (28) anwesend, die auf dem Red Carpet das sch√∂nste Accessoire des Abends pr√§sentierte: ihren kugelrunden Babybauch.

Prinsloo stellte ihn in einem eleganten, gr√ºnen Minidress von Gucci zur Schau. Das gemusterte Seidenkleid im Kimono-Stil war mit Perlenverzierungen an den √Ñrmeln versehen und r√ºckte neben dem Babybauch auch die schlanken Modelbeine der 28-J√§hrigen in den Fokus. Dazu kombinierte sie eine Box-Clutch und schwarze Sandalen.

Diese Box-Clutch veredelt jedes Abendoutfit

SUMMARY:

TEXT:
Father of Nirbhaya consoles her mother as she broke down during protest against the release of juvenile convict of the 16 December Gang-rape, along with student activists at Jantar Mantar on December 20, 2015 in New Delhi.

ADVERTISEMENT

Nirbhaya's younger brother is flying high, literally. He has joined a private airline after completing his commercial pilot training and his parents cannot stop thanking Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi for making it possible.

Badrinath Singh told IANS that the Congress leader helped the grief-stricken family in "every way possible he could" after his 23-year-old daughter was brutally gang raped on December 16, 2012 that led to her death 13 days later.

The father of Indian gangrape victim 'Nirbhaya' addresses media representatives as he leaves The Supreme Court in New Delhi on May 5, 2017.

"My son (he refused to name him) is now a pilot. He completed his training recently. He has joined IndiGo Airlines and is already flying planes. And it is true it was possible because of Rahul Gandhi," said Singh, who works at the Indira Gandhi International Airport here.

He said his son after completing his Class 12 got admitted to the Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Uran Akademi, a government-founded autonomous institute in Rae Bareli ‚Äì the Lok Sabha constituency of Rahul Gandhi's mother and Congress President Sonia Gandhi.

"Rahul Gandhi made it possible. He looked after us after the incident," the father said, referring to the December 16 night when his daughter was brutally gang-raped.

"He (Gandhi) helped us emotionally. He helped us in many ways. He helped us monetarily. Otherwise, you can understand how was it possible for us to make our son a pilot."

"He used to tell us he was not doing it for his politics. It was purely on humanitarian basis. He used to tell us not to speak to the media."

Singh said many came to help the family initially, but "it was Gandhi who stood by us always and had strictly told us to keep it a secret".

"He used to tell us he was not doing it for his politics. It was purely on humanitarian basis. He used to tell us not to speak to the media," Singh said, adding that he too has nothing to do with Gandhi's politics, "but the truth remains the truth, and we cannot thank him enough".

He said the Congress leader used to counsel his son regularly and motivated him to do something good in his life and support the family.

"He suggested to him to pursue a pilots training course and got him admitted to the Uran Akademi in Rae Bareli... The incident left a permanent scar but Gandhi came like an angel. Whatever the politics, but he has been an angel to us."

"He suggested to him to pursue a pilots training course and got him admitted to the Uran Akademi in Rae Bareli," Singh said.

Mother and father of Nirbhaya, the victim of a fatal gang-rape in a moving bus on December 16, 2012.

Singh's another son is studying engineering in Pune.

On December 16, 2012, as Nirbhaya and her male friend waited at a bus stop in Munirka, after watching a late night show of "Life of Pi" at a theatre there, a chartered bus stopped by. The two were unsuspecting of the bestial motives of the six males, including a minor, on board who offered to drop them to their destination.

The young woman's friend was knocked down with an iron rod while Nirbhaya was raped by the five men and the teenaged youth on the moving bus. The two were flung, bleeding by a roadside. The brutality of the rape and the woman's death in a Singapore hospital on December 29 sparked off nationwide protests.

"The incident left a permanent scar but Gandhi came like an angel. Whatever the politics, but he has been an angel to us," said the father.

Asked if he had flown with his son, Singh said: "Not as of now. But maybe I will fly in the plane he pilots soon."
TITLE: Rahul Gandhi Helped Us Emotionally And Monetarily But Strictly Told Us To Keep It A Secret, Says Nirbhaya's Father

TEXT:
Die Europapokal-Teilnehmer 1. FC K√∂ln und 1899 Hoffenheim treffen aufeinander - auch im Live-Stream

Am Ende des Tages spielen VfL Wolfsburg und Hertha BSC

Das Video oben zeigt, wie ihr die Bundesliga im Internet sehen k√∂nnt

1. FC K√∂ln - 1899 Hoffenheim im Live-Stream: Beide Teams waren am Donnerstag in der Europa League aktiv: K√∂ln ben√∂tigt nach dem ersten Sieg auf internationalem Parkett auch in der Bundesliga dringend ein Erfolgserlebnis.

Hoffenheim will den Anschluss zu den vorderen Tabellenr√§ngen halten. Aber: Auftritte gegen Bundesliga-Letzte lagen den Hoffenheimern in der Vergangenheit nicht.

Und: Abwehrchef Vogt verletzte sich in der Europa League gegen die T√ºrken von Basaksehir Istanbul und wird nicht gegen den FC auflaufen. K√∂ln muss die Langzeitverletzten Hector, Cordoba und Pizarro ersetzen. Der Einsatz von Angreifer Guirassy entscheidet sich wegen einer Oberschenkel-Blessur kurzfristig.

Um 18 Uhr empf√§ngt der VfL Wolfsburg Hertha BSC. Der Gastgeber spielte unter Trainer Schmidt sechsmal in Serie Unentschieden.

Und es riecht wieder nach Remis: Wolfsburg konnte in dieser Saison noch kein Heimspiel gewinnen, Hertha blieb in fremden Stadien bislang ohne Dreier. Hertha siegte zuletzt in der Liga gegen den HSV (2:1) und in der Europa League gegen Luhansk (2:0).

Wie ihr die Erste Bundesliga am Sonntag im Live-Stream sehen k√∂nnt

Die Bundesliga-Spiele am Sonntag gibt es f√ºr Daheimgebliebene im Pay-TV zu sehen. Auf Sky Sport 1 trifft 1. FC K√∂ln - 1899 Hoffenheim. Ab 17.30 Uhr √ºbertr√§gt der Sender das Match zwischen VfL und Hertha.

Auch Internetnutzer k√∂nnen die Spiele sehen - sie ben√∂tigen jedoch auch jeweils ein Abo des Anbieters:

‚ñ∫ Bundesliga auf Sky Go im Internet sehen (Abo)

Anzeige DAZN bietet seinen Abonnenten die Highlights der 1. Bundesliga in der Zusammenfassung an. ‚û® Hier k√∂nnt ihr euren Gratismonat starten Danach beginnt ein kostenpflichtiges Abonnement.

Das Bundesliga-Spiel k√∂nnt ihr auch live anh√∂ren

Amazon Music √ºbertr√§gt f√ºr Amazon-Prime-Abonnenten alle Bundesliga-Spiele einzeln und in der Konferenz.

Die Regionalsender der ARD schalten immer wieder zu den Sonntagsspielen. So k√∂nnen Fans die Spiele zwar nicht komplett im Radio verfolgen, jedoch verpasst ihr in der Regel dort kein Highlight.

‚ñ∫ Hier k√∂nnt ihr die Bundesliga-√úbertragungen der "Sportschau" im Radio anh√∂ren

‚ñ∫ Bundesliga im Audiostream von Amazon h√∂ren - hier geht's lang (Abo)

Das k√∂nnte euch auch interessieren:

‚û® 2. Bundesliga im Live-Stream: Wie ihr die Fu√üball-Spiele 2017/18 online sehen k√∂nnt

SUMMARY:
When you factor in the inevitable family drama and deluge of details, the emotional costs alone can be incalculable.
Enter the microwedding: An intimate (read: tiny) affair that‚Äôs friendlier than an elopement and roughly a billion times less stressful than planning a black tie destination extravaganza for 250 souls.
When the guest list is cut by 90 percent, most people understand if they didn‚Äôt make the cut.

TEXT:
The average American couple spends over $30,000 on their wedding. When you factor in the inevitable family drama and deluge of details, the emotional costs alone can be incalculable. Enter the microwedding: An intimate (read: tiny) affair that‚Äôs friendlier than an elopement and roughly a billion times less stressful than planning a black tie destination extravaganza for 250 souls. Here‚Äôs why having one could be a boon to your mental health ‚Äî not to mention your marriage.

SWEET ICE CREAM PHOTOGRAPHY/UNSPLASH

THE EDITED GUEST LIST

No more agonizing or arguing over whether to invite every single cousin or the fallback of implementing a no-kids policy. Simply invite your parents (or not!) and besties, and be done with it. When the guest list is cut by 90 percent, most people understand if they didn‚Äôt make the cut. Will Great Aunt Gloria lose it over being left out? Weigh that against being able to recognize ‚Äî and be truly happy to see ‚Äî every face in your crowd.

TWENTY20

THE DOABLE DECOR

Lusting after that limited edition French china on Etsy? Go ahead. Buy a set or three. Dreaming of that florist you found on Instagram to make a table arrangement? Go ahead. DM her. When you‚Äôre just decorating one table (think: a super-chic dinner party) or one small room (hey, dancing is mandatory for you), the pressure‚Äôs off ‚Äî especially when it comes to your wallet.

TWENTY20

THE ANYTHING-GOES ATTIRE

Walking down the ‚Äúaisle‚Äù of a courthouse, a garden, a restaurant or your own backyard doesn‚Äôt call for a 25-foot couture train ‚Äî or the months of fittings that go with it. Want to wear a badass jumpsuit √† la Solange? Do your thing. And if you do want the big gown, that‚Äôs your decision to make as well. The point is, you‚Äôre controlling things, not the dress code or other people‚Äôs expectations. (P.S. That also means no need to force your BFFS into matching bridesmaids dresses either. Just sayin‚Äô.)

RAWPIXEL/GETTY IMAGES

YOU STILL GET TO HAVE YOUR DREAM WEDDING

An incredible cake, dreamy flowers, a photo booth, the playlist you‚Äôve been curating since you were nine? None of these things need to be nixed just because you‚Äôre celebrating on a smaller scale. In fact, because there are fewer guests, you can splurge on the things you care about without going bankrupt, whether that‚Äôs a chef-made meal or your flower crown. Space is limited, but when it comes to your wedding fantasies, the sky‚Äôs still the limit.
TITLE: What Is A Microwedding And Is It The Best Idea Ever?

TEXT:
If you‚Äôre an introvert, you likely value your alone time. You think before you speak. You‚Äôd much rather socialize one-on-one than in a group. A phone call is probably your worst nightmare. But most of all, you are silently strong.

It can be tough to prefer to be alone in a world that values boldness and extroversion. But take heart, quiet types: Twitter has your back. Each month, we round up spot-on tweets that capture what it‚Äôs like to be an introvert. Scroll down for our latest batch.

Eric Dupond-Moretti : "J'ai revu le proc√®s de Nuremberg, et je trouve qu'il a √©t√© d'une certaine fa√ßon plus digne" #le79Inter pic.twitter.com/Tg9Rzl6noG ‚Äî France Inter (@franceinter) November 3, 2017"J'ai revu le proc√®s de Nuremberg, et je trouve qu'il a √©t√© d'une certaine fa√ßon plus digne.
"Au fond, Abdelkader Merah, qui peut cracher sur les r√®gles de notre pays, en b√©n√©ficie.
TEXT:
JUSTICE - "Moi, je n'ai pas dit √† mes confr√®res de la partie civile qu'ils √©taient indignes d'√™tre avocat, qu'ils √©taient le d√©shonneur du barreau, qu'ils √©taient la honte de la profession." Depuis le d√©but du proc√®s d'Abdelkader Merah, √âric Dupond-Moretti, son m√©diatique avocat, est le point de focale de toutes les critiques.

Du c√¥t√© des familles, comme de ses confr√®res et adversaires lors du proc√®s, il a plusieurs fois √©t√© r√©p√©t√© qu'il √©tait "indigne" dans son choix de d√©fendre le fr√®re d'un terroriste qui avait assassin√© six personnes en 2012. "Je me suis retrouv√© seul contre tous, dans un contexte d√©l√©t√®re... Et si vous me permettez l'expression, j'en ai pris plein la gueule." Les enfants de l'avocat ont m√™me √©t√© menac√©s de mort, au cours de ce qu'il a d√©crit comme "le proc√®s le plus dur de sa carri√®re", ce vendredi 3 novembre sur France Inter.

Au cours d'un long entretien, √âric Dupond-Moretti est donc revenu en d√©tail sur les motivations qui l'ont conduit √† d√©fendre Abdelkader Merah, mais aussi sur les circonstances dans lesquelles s'est d√©roul√© le proc√®s. "Mon but n'√©tait pas de le faire aimer, c'√©tait qu'il soit jug√© selon nos r√®gles", a-t-il expliqu√© d'embl√©e.

Eric Dupond-Moretti : "J'ai revu le proc√®s de Nuremberg, et je trouve qu'il a √©t√© d'une certaine fa√ßon plus digne" #le79Inter pic.twitter.com/Tg9Rzl6noG ‚Äî France Inter (@franceinter) November 3, 2017

"J'ai revu le proc√®s de Nuremberg, et je trouve qu'il a √©t√© d'une certaine fa√ßon plus digne. D'abord parce qu'on n'a pas discut√© la pr√©sence d'un avocat aux c√¥t√©s des accus√©s." Un parall√®le avec le proc√®s des dirigeants nazis du Troisi√®me Reich qui n'a pas manqu√© de faire r√©agir, mais qu'a r√©utilis√© "EDM" un peu plus tard dans l'interview.

"Au fond, Abdelkader Merah, qui peut cracher sur les r√®gles de notre pays, en b√©n√©ficie. Comme les trois acquitt√©s de Nuremberg ont b√©n√©fici√© de la r√®gle du doute, alors que ce n'√©taient pas de grands d√©mocrates." Avant de justifier une fois de plus sa d√©cision de d√©fendre son client: "Je pense que notre √©poque est √† la d√©rive et que le terrorisme nous autorise tous les populismes, et c'est pour √ßa que j'ai absolument tenu √† d√©fendre Abdelkader Merah."

"Il y a des causes ind√©fendables. L'islamisme radical, c'est une cause ind√©fendable. Le nazisme c'est ind√©fendable. Moi je ne d√©fends pas une cause, je d√©fends un homme et c'est singuli√®rement diff√©rent", a ajout√© celui qui a tenu √† √™tre transparent sur sa r√©mun√©ration pour le proc√®s. "J'ai touch√© pour l'instruction 12.000 euros, pay√©s par la famille. Et ensuite pour l'audience, il n'y avait plus un rond."

Eric Dupond-Moretti : "Il y a des causes ind√©fendables. Moi, je ne d√©fend pas une cause, mais un homme" #le79Inter pic.twitter.com/BEduYn3Yme ‚Äî France Inter (@franceinter) November 3, 2017

"On a pu lire que j'√©tais pay√© par Daech ou Al-Qaeda ou je ne sais pas quoi... Je n'ai pas demand√© le b√©n√©fice de la commission d'office parce que je ne voulais pas que l'on puisse dire que je prenais l'argent du contribuable pour d√©fendre cette ordure d'Abdelkader Merah."

De la m√™me mani√®re, √âric Dupond-Moretti a tenu √† se f√©liciter d'avoir pu repr√©senter son client. "L'homme que j'ai eu l'honneur de d√©fendre incarne le Mal absolu." Et de conclure: "J'esp√®re qu'Abdelkader Merah se rend compte des bienfaits de notre d√©mocratie. Mais je ne suis pas son directeur de conscience, j'ai √©t√© son avocat."

Qualcosa non torna nelle due audizioni sulle banche venete di Consob e Bankitalia.
Altri membri della Commissione per√≤ non sono ancora soddisfatti e hanno chiesto che l'audizione del 9 novembre sia testimoniale.
Tradotto: obbligo di dire la verit√† altrimenti si incappa nel reato di falsa testimonianza.
Anche la leader di Fratelli d'Italia Giorgia Meloni ha chiesto la "convocazione congiunta di Barbagallo e Apponi in forma di testimonianza al fine di verificare le affermazioni rese.
La seduta si ritiene anche necessaria al fine di verificare il rispetto da parte di Consob e di Banca d'Italia dell'art 7 del TUB, il quale prevede che la Banca d'Italia e la Consob collaborino tra loro 'anche mediante scambio di informazioni, al fine di agevolare le rispettive funzioni.
TEXT:
Qualcosa non torna nelle due audizioni sulle banche venete di Consob e Bankitalia. Sul pressing di gran parte delle forze politiche della Commissione d'inchiesta, il presidente Casini ha quindi detto s√¨ a un confronto "all'americana": il presidente della Commissione bicamerale ha convocato in audizione congiunta, gioved√¨ 9, il capo del dipartimento Vigilanza bancaria e finanziaria di Banca d'Italia, Carmelo Barbagallo, e il direttore generale della Consob, Angelo Apponi, "per approfondire i rapporti tra le due istituzioni in riferimento alle banche venete". "La convocazione, fissata alle 10.30, √® stata richiesta - sottolinea una nota - da diversi gruppi politici".

Questo perch√©, secondo quanto emerso dalle audizioni (separate) di Barbagallo e Apponi, qualcosa non torna tre le due versioni sul comportamento dei due istituti sulle banche venete. Lo sintetizza bene Renato Brunetta, vicepresidente della Commissione d'inchiesta: "Visto che le descrizioni fatte ieri da Barbagallo e Apponi non sono state sempre concordanti, valuteremo con il presidente Casini se sia il caso di risentire entrambi, proprio per verificare le incongruenze delle due relazioni", aveva detto in mattinata. Altri membri della Commissione per√≤ non sono ancora soddisfatti e hanno chiesto che l'audizione del 9 novembre sia testimoniale. Tradotto: obbligo di dire la verit√† altrimenti si incappa nel reato di falsa testimonianza. La richiesta verr√† certamente avanzata da Andrea Augello, di Idea: "Gioved√¨ chiederemo che sia trasformata su base testimoniale".

Anche la leader di Fratelli d'Italia Giorgia Meloni ha chiesto la "convocazione congiunta di Barbagallo e Apponi in forma di testimonianza al fine di verificare le affermazioni rese. La seduta si ritiene anche necessaria al fine di verificare il rispetto da parte di Consob e di Banca d'Italia dell'art 7 del TUB, il quale prevede che la Banca d'Italia e la Consob collaborino tra loro 'anche mediante scambio di informazioni, al fine di agevolare le rispettive funzioni. Detti organismi non possono reciprocamente opporsi il segreto d'ufficio".
TITLE: Qualcosa non torna sulle Venete: la Commissione d'inchiesta (ri)convoca in audizione congiunta la Vigilanza di Bankitalia e Consob

SUMMARY:
Jeremy Corbyn has hit out at the ‚Äúwarped and degrading‚Äù culture of sexual harassment in Westminster.
The Labour leader told his party‚Äôs North West conference in Blackpool on Sunday that abuse was ‚Äúhiding in plain sight‚Äù.
Parliament has been rocked by allegations of sexual harassment by MPs and ministers.
Damian Green, the de facto deputy prime minister, is facing calls to step aside from his job while an investigation into his conduct is carried out.
The first secretary of state strongly denies the allegations made against him.
TEXT:
Jeremy Corbyn has hit out at the ‚Äúwarped and degrading‚Äù culture of sexual harassment in Westminster.

The Labour leader told his party‚Äôs North West conference in Blackpool on Sunday that abuse was ‚Äúhiding in plain sight‚Äù.

It came as he faced questions over why Labour MP Kelvin Hopkins was appointed to his shadow cabinet despite allegations having been made about him behaving inappropriately towards a young female party activist.

Parliament has been rocked by allegations of sexual harassment by MPs and ministers.

Damian Green, the de facto deputy prime minister, is facing calls to step aside from his job while an investigation into his conduct is carried out.

The first secretary of state strongly denies the allegations made against him.
TITLE: Jeremy Corbyn Warns Of 'Warped And Degrading' Westminster Culture Of Sexual Harassment

SUMMARY:
Americans spend one third of their lives in bed, but as a nation, we still aren‚Äôt getting enough sleep.
As a result of chronic under-rest, our wellbeing is eroding.
To bring awareness -- and solutions -- to this public health issue, The Huffington Post has partnered with Sleep Number¬Æ to present Sleep + Wellness, an editorial section dedicated to empowering readers to live their best, healthiest lives by gaining a better understanding of sleep as a crucial pillar of our well-being.
By taking an all-encompassing, personalized approach to wellness, and educating readers on how sleep connects to fitness, work-life balance, and more, Sleep + Wellness aims to take the stress out of sleep, for good.
To contribute, please email sleeppluswellness@huffingtonpost.com.
TEXT: Americans spend one third of their lives in bed, but as a nation, we still aren‚Äôt getting enough sleep. As a result of chronic under-rest, our wellbeing is eroding. To bring awareness -- and solutions -- to this public health issue, The Huffington Post has partnered with Sleep Number¬Æ to present Sleep + Wellness, an editorial section dedicated to empowering readers to live their best, healthiest lives by gaining a better understanding of sleep as a crucial pillar of our well-being. By taking an all-encompassing, personalized approach to wellness, and educating readers on how sleep connects to fitness, work-life balance, and more, Sleep + Wellness aims to take the stress out of sleep, for good. To contribute, please email sleeppluswellness@huffingtonpost.com.
TITLE: Sleep + Wellness

SUMMARY:
The chairman of Sainsbury‚Äôs, David Taylor, the British Retail Consortium and former Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg have warned Brexit without an EU trade deal will drive up food prices.
Clegg said leaving the EU without a deal would mean a 22% tariff on food from the EU.
It said in July that Brexit‚Äôs impact on food prices was ‚Äúhighly uncertain‚Äù.
Sampson said: ‚ÄúAre food prices lower following Brexit than if we hadn‚Äôt voted to leave the EU?
That‚Äôs where the claim has less to back it up.‚ÄùJD Wetherspoon 'Parliament can and should lower food prices and save huge sums' - the slogan on one of the beer mats.
TEXT:
‚ÄúI‚Äôm 100% sure what I‚Äôm saying is true,‚Äù Tim Martin tells HuffPost UK, after printing half a million beermats that tell Wetherspoon‚Äôs customers Brexit can make their food and drink cheaper, despite repeated warnings that leaving the EU will do the opposite. ‚ÄúIf by any chance I‚Äôve got it wrong, I‚Äôve not made myself look too clever.‚Äù Lots of people would say the chairman of Wetherspoon‚Äôs, Britain‚Äôs biggest pub chain, has not made himself look too clever.

PA Archive/PA Images Tim Martin is '100% sure' he's right on Brexit. Just don't ask him for a refund if he's wrong.

The chairman of Sainsbury‚Äôs, David Taylor, the British Retail Consortium and former Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg have warned Brexit without an EU trade deal will drive up food prices. Clegg said leaving the EU without a deal would mean a 22% tariff on food from the EU. Undeterred, Martin has printed his beermats for people to read as they down cheap pints at 895 Wetherspoon‚Äôs pubs across the country. The mats say prices will fall - if only politicians had the sense to ‚Äústop messing about‚Äù and follow The Wetherspoon‚Äôs Manifesto: Quit the EU without a transitional deal and use the freedom of World Trade Organisation rules to abolish tariffs our EU membership obliges us to charge on food imports from outside the bloc. The rules let you do this, he says, so long as you don‚Äôt discriminate, so his vision would mean the abolition of food tariffs from in and outside the EU.

JD Wetherspoon The Wetherspoon Manifesto

The Wetherspoon‚Äôs boss thinks axing the tariffs would take 3.5p off each meal served in the chain and 0.5p off each drink. The avuncular, staunch Brexiteer, who grew his empire from a single pub in 1979 to the huge chain it is now, has been a colourful voice in favour of Brexit. His chain is such a national institution that a scathing Sunday Times review of one of its newest pubs last weekend caused an uproar and discussion about the role cheap pubs plays in a time of poverty. The review called Martin ‚Äúa multimillionaire Leave donor who‚Äôs now complaining he can‚Äôt get the staff‚Äù. This is the second time Martin has pulled the beermat stunt. Before the referendum, he put out ones posing a series of questions doubting the future of the Euro, and urging people to vote Leave. Announcing the latest beermats in a press release, he said people like Clegg and Taylor were part of ‚Äúa coordinated campaign to dupe the public‚Äù. One reason he is so confident is his claim that he has not been contradicted, despite being challenged by Andrew Neil on BBC One‚Äôs This Week in September. He also set out his views in an article last month headlined: ‚ÄúProject Fear has morphed into Project Stupid.‚Äù

Speaking to HuffPost by phone, Martin says his claims have already circulated widely within his trade, who are ‚Äúmostly Remainers‚Äù and he has had not had any reproach, ‚Äúnor will I‚Äù. ‚ÄúWhat I‚Äôve said, I‚Äôm certain it‚Äôs true... I said it on television... I contradicted Andrew Neil and not one person has come back and said ‚Äòno, no, you‚Äôve got that wrong Tim‚Äô.‚Äù Conventional wisdom about Brexit‚Äôs impact on food prices seems to trouble Martin. He insists there would be no need for extra custom checks, which would make food more expensive. The fall in the pound‚Äôs value, which has already fuelled inflation since the vote, also doesn‚Äôt faze him and he says its affect on food is ‚Äúalmost negligible‚Äù. He is more certain than anyone else in the debate, it seems. Revered think tank the Institute of Fiscal Studies (IFS) does not share his confidence. It said in July that Brexit‚Äôs impact on food prices was ‚Äúhighly uncertain‚Äù. A study by the National Institute Economic Review, published in the Guardian today, also claimed that a ‚Äòno-deal‚Äô Brexit could see British households‚Äô annual shopping bills increase by up to ¬£930 a year. LSE economist Thomas Sampson viewed Martin‚Äôs press release and told HuffPost it had a ‚Äúpartial truth‚Äù, as axing the tariffs would make food cheaper but only cheaper than if Britain left the EU and kept them. Sampson said: ‚ÄúAre food prices lower following Brexit than if we hadn‚Äôt voted to leave the EU? That‚Äôs where the claim has less to back it up.‚Äù

JD Wetherspoon 'Parliament can and should lower food prices and save huge sums' - the slogan on one of the beer mats.
TITLE: Wetherspoon‚Äôs Boss ‚Äò100% Certain‚Äô Brexit Can Mean Cheaper Food - But Can‚Äôt Say If His Prices Will Drop

SUMMARY:
Das Augenmerk liegt eher auf den Zeitabst√§nden zwischen den Mahlzeiten und weniger auf der Mahlzeitenh√§ufigkeit.
Bekannt ist, dass die Insulinwirkung √ºber verschiedene Signalkaskaden vermittelt wird, die die Lebenserwartung verk√ºrzen k√∂nnen.
Wichtig ist, sich f√ºr die passende Methode zu entscheiden, denn diese sollte im Alltag auch umsetzbar sein.
Auch bei der Einnahme von Medikamenten ist die Packungseinlage zu beachten und das Vorhaben mit dem Arzt zu besprechen.
Wer die 24 Stunden-Methode bevorzugt, sollte die Fastentage auf die trainingsfreien Tage legen.
TEXT:
peredniankina via Getty Images

Intermittierendes Fasten hei√üt "Unterbrechen" der Nahrungsfreien Zeit

Das Wort "intermittierend" leitet sich aus dem Lateinischen ab und bedeutet "unterbrechen" oder "aussetzen". Auch das englische Wort f√ºr Fr√ºhst√ºck "breakfast" hei√üt √ºbersetzt "Fastenbrechen". In Zeiten der Nahrungsknappheit begleitete es die Menschen eher unfreiwillig. Das notgedrungene Fasten verschwand mit zunehmendem Nahrungsangebot, bis wir es schlie√ülich verlernten.

Das Intermittierende Fasten (IF) bezieht sich normalerweise auf einen maximal 24 Stunden andauernden Nahrungsverzicht und variiert mit Tagen des "normalen" Essens. Das Augenmerk liegt eher auf den Zeitabst√§nden zwischen den Mahlzeiten und weniger auf der Mahlzeitenh√§ufigkeit. Damit ist das Dogma der festgelegten Mahlzeiten wie Fr√ºhst√ºck, Mittag und Abendessen Geschichte.

Personalisierbares Fasten: verschiedene Varianten

Bei der 16/8-Methode wird 16 Stunden am Tag gefastet, innerhalb von 8 Stunden gegessen. Diese Form des "lean gain" wird meist an 3 bis 6 Tagen die Wochen praktiziert. Es eignet sich besonders f√ºr Anf√§nger, da weniger Willenskraft ben√∂tigt wird. Eine Umstellung erfolgt meist ohne gr√∂√üere Nebenwirkungen. Die Muskulatur wird in aller Regel nicht angegriffen. Auch werden verh√§ltnism√§√üig wenig Stresshormone ausgesch√ºttet. Aber: die Effekte auf den Stoffwechsel sind nicht besonders stark ausgepr√§gt.

Die 24 Stunden-Methode hingegen bezieht sich auf ganze Fastentage - f√ºr 1 bis 2 Tage die Woche. Die Wirkungen auf den Stoffwechsel sind deutlich st√§rker ausgepr√§gt. Daf√ºr treten verst√§rkt Begleiterscheinungen wie Kopfschmerzen, innere Unruhe oder Hei√ühunger auf. Die Stresshormone steigen messbar an. Viele berichten von einer gr√∂√üeren Anforderung an die eigene Willenskraft. Sinnvoll ist eine Fastenzeit von Abendessen zu Abendessen, um die Schlafqualit√§t nicht zu beeintr√§chtigen.

Daneben existiert noch die "5 zu 2"-Methode, bei der an 2 Tagen die Woche gefastet wird oder alternativ 500-600 kcal aufgenommen werden. An 5 Tagen wird hingegen regul√§r gegessen. Bei der "eat-stop-eat"-Methode findet ein tageweiser Wechsel zwischen Fasten und Nicht-Fasten statt. Hierbei handelt es sich um die intensivste Form: Es besteht das Risiko f√ºr den Verlust an Muskelmasse und einer verringerten N√§hrstoffversorgung.

Optimal ist ein Fastenfenster zwischen 16 und 18 Stunden, dass an 2 bis 4 Tagen die Woche eingehalten wird.

Effekte: Selbstreinigung der Zellen bis Nervenschutz

Jede Nahrungsaufnahme bedeutet Stress f√ºr den K√∂rper. Bestandteile der Nahrung m√ºssen extrahiert, aufgeschlossen und aufbereitet; Zellen und Gewebe aufgebaut werden. Der K√∂rper befindet sich in der sogenannten "anabolen", also der aufbauenden, Phase.

Das Gegenteil der anabolen Phase ist die "katabole" Phase. Ist unsere Nahrung aufgeschlossen und dem Blutkreislauf zugef√ºhrt, startet - einfach formuliert - ein Reinigungs- und Regenerationsprogramm des K√∂rpers. Alte und kaputte Zellbestandteile werden abgebaut und recycelt. Dieser Prozess wird Autophagie genannt. Es beschreibt eine Art Zustand st√§ndiger Wartung, um die Zellfunktion aufrecht zu halten. Die katabole Phase erreicht ihren H√∂hepunkt w√§hrend der Nahrungsfreien Zeit. St√§ndiges Futtern und Zwischendurchessen aber verhindern die f√ºr den K√∂rper wichtigen Reinigungsprozesse.

Zudem beeinflusst das zeitliche Fasten verschiedene Stoffwechselprozesse. Es steigen sowohl die Insulin- als auch die Leptinempfindlichkeit, der Blutzuckerspiegel wird gleichm√§√üiger reguliert. Ein gest√∂rter Cholesterinstoffwechsel kann sich durch den Anstieg des "guten" HDL-Cholesterins und dem Absinken des "b√∂sen" LDL-Cholesterins wieder den Normalwerten angleichen. Insgesamt √§hneln die Effekte denen unter Kalorienrestriktion. Der Vorteil hier und auch gegen√ºber des Heilfastens ist die Schonung der Skelettmuskulatur. Unter dem Intermittierenden Fasten wird deutlich weniger Muskelmasse abgebaut. Dies ist auch damit zu begr√ºnden, dass die Ketolysef√§higkeit des K√∂rpers gef√∂rdert wird. Das hei√üt nichts anderes, als dass der K√∂rper in der Lage ist, unter Nahrungskarenz schnell auf Fettabbau umzusatteln. Die Fetts√§uren werden in Ketonk√∂rper umgewandelt, die wiederum als effiziente Energiequelle, vor allem f√ºr das Gehirn, dienen. Dadurch steigt letztendlich auch die Widerstandskraft des K√∂rpers und der Stresspegel sinkt. Ein erh√∂hter Blutdruck kann sich unter diesen Umst√§nden ebenso normalisieren. Schlussendlich k√∂nnen sich in dieser Zeit die Verdauungsorgane wie Magen, Darm, Bauchspeicheldr√ºse und Leber ausreichend regenerieren.

Alle genannten Effekte k√∂nnten die Therapie verschiedener Erkrankungen unterst√ºtzen. Hierzu z√§hlen in erster Linie Diabetes mellitus, √úbergewicht, Fettsstoffwechselst√∂rungen, Hypertonie, Arthrose, Asthma, Krebserkrankungen und degenerative Erkrankungen wie Morbus Alzheimer oder Multiple Sklerose.

Die meisten Beobachtungen stammen (noch) aus Tierstudien

Mit der wissenschaftlichen Nachweisbarkeit ist das so eine Sache. Erste Effekte bei Tieren wurden bereits in den 80er Jahren beschrieben. Versuche an Tiermodellen zeigten vor allem eine h√∂here Lebenserwartung und ein geringeres Risiko f√ºr altersabh√§ngige Erkrankungen. Die Effekte sind dabei umso st√§rker, je fr√ºher mit dem intermittierenden Fasten begonnen wurde. Es zeigten sich unter anderem Vorteile im Gewichtsmanagement, sch√ºtzende Effekte auf Nervenzellen, Herz und Blutdruck. Effekte auf Sp√§tkomplikationen und den Verlauf von Erkrankungen reihen sich ein. Aber reicht das als Argument aus?

Inwiefern das Intermittierende Fasten beim Menschen √§hnliche Wirkungen erzielen kann, steht wissenschaftlich noch aus. Bekannt ist, dass die Insulinwirkung √ºber verschiedene Signalkaskaden vermittelt wird, die die Lebenserwartung verk√ºrzen k√∂nnen. Die geringere Insulinaussch√ºttung beim IF wirkt diesen Prozessen entgegen. Zudem werden mehr Stoffe freigesetzt, wodurch die Zellen langsamer altern und sp√§ter absterben. Neuere Untersuchungen am Menschen best√§tigen unter anderem die Effekte auf Blutfette, K√∂rpergewicht und K√∂rperfett sowie Insulin- und Entz√ºndungsparameter zumindest kurzfristig.

Einfach ausprobieren und reflektieren

Wie so oft entscheidet nicht allein die Wissenschaft dar√ºber, ob das Intermittierende Fasten in bestimmten Situationen oder f√ºr bestimmte Menschen geeignet ist. Erst praktische Erfahrungen geben Aufschluss √ºber die Wirksamkeit am Einzelnen. Es gibt gute Gr√ºnde, an dieser Stellschraube einmal zu drehen. Die Effekte auf unseren Stoffwechsel k√∂nnten bei vielen Symptom- und Erkrankungsbildern zu Verbesserungen f√ºhren. Wichtig ist, sich f√ºr die passende Methode zu entscheiden, denn diese sollte im Alltag auch umsetzbar sein.

In aller Regel eignet sich die 16/8-Methode f√ºr den Anfang. Trinken Sie w√§hrend der Nahrungsfreien Zeit viel Wasser sowie unges√º√üten Tee und Kaffee. F√ºr die Zeitspanne der Nahrungszufuhr ist eine ad√§quate Versorgung mit Energie und N√§hrstoffen wichtig. Fast Food und Convinience Food eignen sich NICHT als Hauptnahrungsquelle. W√§hlen Sie nat√ºrliche Lebensmittel mit einer hohen N√§hrstoffdichte.

Bei Frauen treten h√§ufiger M√ºdigkeit, Nervosit√§t und nachlassende Konzentrationsf√§higkeit auf. In der Regel gibt sich das innerhalb der ersten Tage. In Schwangerschaft und Stillzeit ist die Methode nicht uneingeschr√§nkt zu empfehlen. Auch bei der Einnahme von Medikamenten ist die Packungseinlage zu beachten und das Vorhaben mit dem Arzt zu besprechen.

Auch f√ºr Sportler eignet sich die 16/8-Methode eher als das tageweise Fasten, um die Muskulatur nicht anzugreifen. Wer die 24 Stunden-Methode bevorzugt, sollte die Fastentage auf die trainingsfreien Tage legen. Auch ist das Fastenfenster f√ºr den Trainingserfolg mit entscheidend: wer Muskulatur aufbauen m√∂chte, sollte nicht gerade in der Karenzphase sporteln. Und wer abnehmen m√∂chte, sollte zumindest die Eiwei√üzufuhr anpassen.

SUMMARY:
El mundo de entretenimiento y el de la pol√≠tica est√°n en el ojo del hurac√°n por acusaciones de acoso sexual.
Uno de los hallazgos del reporte es que "los perpetradores de acoso sexual son a menudo terceras partes.

TEXT:
El mundo de entretenimiento y el de la pol√≠tica est√°n en el ojo del hurac√°n por acusaciones de acoso sexual. Sin embargo, los empleados de menor jerarqu√≠a y aquellos que tienen "contratos" laborales precarios en otros sectores son menos propensos a se√±alar los abusos debido al temor de perder sus trabajos, dicen expertos.

La din√°mica del poder en los ataques sexuales y el patr√≥n para los depredadores para escoger a sus v√≠ctimas, quienes no siempre conocen sus derechos, derivan en que trabajadores del sector hospitalario y el turismo, as√≠ como a trabajadores con contratos temporales, enfrenten retos adicionales cuando se trata del acoso sexual.

"Uno no siempre conoce a un empleado de limpieza, o que a√∫n no est√° en la "n√≥mina", que piense: 'J√≥danse todos, al fin que no necesito este trabajo'. De hecho, viven escenarios completamente opuestos, en los que m√°s bien suelen pensar: 'Har√© lo que sea por este trabajo, por favor d√©jeme quedarme'", dijo a HuffPost UK, Michael Newman, especialista de leyes de discriminaci√≥n y empleo de la firma legal Leigh Day.

De acuerdo con un reporte del Trade Union Congress (TUC) del a√±o pasado sobre el acoso sexual, 67% de las mujeres en la industria de la hospitalidad y el entretenimiento informaron ser v√≠ctimas de acoso sexual, contra un promedio general de 52%.

Uno de los hallazgos del reporte es que "los perpetradores de acoso sexual son a menudo terceras partes. Las mujeres que trabajan en industrias como la de ventas minoristas, hospitalidad, cuidados de la salud, hospitales, transportes y muchas otras m√°s; as√≠ que lidian con clientes, pacientes y consumidores cotidianamente y tienen poca protecci√≥n por parte de sus patrones cuando experimentan acoso. Implementar medidas para que los jefes tomen acciones cuando un empleado haya sido v√≠ctima de acoso por una tercera persona podr√≠a ser un paso importante para atacar este delito en los centros de trabajo".

Ya sea al rodar pel√≠culas o atender un bar, los hombres poderosos ven a las mujeres, y en algunos casos a hombres, como un objetivo que muy probablemente no har√° nada al respecto si ellos deciden traspasarse de alguna forma.

Los expertos sugieren que es m√°s frecuente observar una cultura del silencio en aquellos que son vulnerables financieramente, o que corren m√°s en riesgo de perder sus empleos, generalmente sienten que no pueden reportar que han sido v√≠ctimas de acoso sexual.

El acoso sexual est√° muy relacionado con la din√°mica del poder.

Scarlet Harris, directora de estrategias y desarrollo del TUC; dijo al HuffPost UK que "Es un hecho que las mujeres m√°s j√≥venes est√°n m√°s expuestas al acoso sexual y creo que es justo decir que mientras m√°s inferior sea tu puesto en una organizaci√≥n, m√°s expuesta est√°s a experimentar acoso sexual debido a esa din√°mica del poder".

Desde octubre, hemos visto una avalancha de acusaciones de acoso sexual que se han hecho en contra del productor cinematogr√°fico, Harvey Weinstein, a las vertidas la semana pasada en Westminster en torno a que miembros del Parlamento han sido involucrados en reclamos de acoso sexual.

Danielle Parsons, una abogada laboral en la firma Slater & Gordon, dice que, a pesar de que no hay una industria inmune al acoso sexual, los miembros m√°s j√≥venes y en puestos m√°s bajos de un equipo est√°n m√°s expuestos a dicho acoso debido a la din√°mica del poder.

¬øEn d√≥nde ocurre el acoso laboral?

De acuerdo con Parsons, √©ste puede puede ocurrir en diversas industrias, pero generalmente sucede m√°s donde existe la din√°mica de tener a alguien en una posici√≥n de poder y a otra de menor rango report√°ndole.

Harris a√±adi√≥ que, a pesar de que el acoso sexual se ve "absolutamente en todos lados", aquellas personas con empleos temporales y los que tienen contratos por proyecto enfrentan m√°s dificultades al reportar casos de acoso.

Esto se debe a que, por la naturaleza de los empleos temporales, los trabajadores se mueven en muchas organizaciones, por lo que a menudo se encuentran en lugares de trabajo en donde no conocen a nadie, no conocen las reglas corporativas y no saben a qui√©n reportar los casos de acoso.

"Los perpetradores de acoso sexual suelen ser muy buenos en enfocarse en la persona que aparentemente sea menos capaz de lidiar con ellos; son expertos en detectar a alguien muy vulnerable y los cazar√°n debido porque los consideran un blanco f√°cil", dijo Harris.

Adem√°s, los empleados en la industria de la hospitalidad est√°n m√°s expuestos al riesgo del acoso por terceras personas.

Los puestos en este rubro pueden incluir a empleados de restaurantes y bares, as√≠ como recepcionistas. Tambi√©n es frecuente en empleos en que los trabajadores tratan con clientes que podr√≠an estar bajo los efectos del alcohol, pues a menudo los clientes se sienten con derecho de abordarlos.

El acoso sexual tambi√©n puede ser un factor de "humillaci√≥n para las v√≠ctimas", dice Parsons, y se puede manifestar de diversas formas, como el bullying, la intimidaci√≥n o el comportamiento ofensivo.

A Parsons no s√≥lo lo buscan mujeres para ayuda en acoso sexual. La abogada dice que en una ocasi√≥n un asistente masculino la busc√≥ debido a los "comentarios molestos e invasivos" que su jefe profiri√≥ en torno a su sexualidad.

Newman asegur√≥ que, aunque ha visto un incremento en la cifra de clientes que han decidido denunciar en p√∫blico, el problema "no parece mejorar".

"No he visto una baja en el problema. Es tristemente continuo, lo cual, creo, es un problema", dijo a HuffPost Uk. "Es un flujo continuo y lo seguimos viendo. Cada vez que llega una nueva queja decimos: 'Ah, ahora es un caso en una industria en la que no se hab√≠a visto... pero, ¬øpor qu√© me sorprende?'"

Concuerda con Parsons y Harris en el sentido de que mientras m√°s joven o inexperto sea alguien, estar√° m√°s expuesta al acoso sexual. "En esos casos, las oportunidades para la explotaci√≥n son mayores".

Sin embargo, el acoso sexual tambi√©n puede darse "de abajo hacia arriba".

Newman admite que quienes buscan su ayuda a menudo tuvieron que llegar al punto en los que contaban con los recursos para quejarse, una opci√≥n que quiz√° no sea v√°lida para quienes est√°n en posiciones m√°s vulnerables, financiera y profesionalmente.

"Por lo general, cuando te acosan, si quieres permanecer en tu trabajo, lo m√°s probable es que no te quejes", dice Newman. "As√≠ que nunca me llegan esos casos. No es el tipo de gente que me busca".

Asegura que la gente a quien no le preocupan los riesgos a sus empleos o su carrera probablemente se sienten as√≠ porque ya tienen planeado salirse de ese rubro de trabajo, o es gente que ya lleg√≥ a cierto nivel de seguridad en el que tiene m√°s recursos para denunciar.

Los ejemplos de acoso sexual que ha recibido var√≠an, pero incluyen comentarios soeces, insinuaciones, contacto f√≠sico y otro tipo de avances, incluyendo conductas sexuales sin consenso.

L'arr√™t que la cour d'assises a √©dict√© apr√®s 7 heures de d√©lib√©r√© ne pouvait que m√©contenter les parties civiles et ne satisfaire qu'√† moiti√© la d√©fense de Merah. Celle-ci, pourtant, par l'entremise de Me Eric Dupond Moretti (EDM), notamment sur France Inter, a √©videmment v√©cu comme une victoire l'acquittement de ce dernier pour l'accusation principale et, en regrettant sa condamnation √† 20 ans de r√©clusion pour le reste, n'a cependant pas hurl√© √† l'injustice. La d√©cision, dans ces conditions, ne saurait √™tre appr√©ci√©e au regard des appr√©ciations des protagonistes du proc√®s. Aucune objectivit√© n'√©tait √† attendre d'eux et de fait ils n'ont jamais pu l'atteindre. Ni cherch√© √† en faire preuve. Je voudrais distinguer le niveau proprement judiciaire de ce que je nommerais, sans offense, la "cuisine" en amont.

EDM a insist√© sur le fait que la pr√©sence de Mohamed Merah dans le box n'aurait probablement pas conduit l'accusation √† poursuivre son fr√®re. Ce n'est pas impossible et cet argument n'a peut-√™tre pas √©t√© sans incidence sur la conviction des juges. De m√™me peut-√™tre que ce second tendant √† d√©montrer qu'au cours de l'instruction, la complicit√© d'assassinats paraissant fragilis√©e, on s'est rabattu par suppl√©tif sur l'association de malfaiteurs qui en g√©n√©ral constitue plut√¥t une qualification de secours et de subsidiarit√©. Ce qui compte toutefois, une fois cette discussion close, est la mani√®re dont des conclusions ont √©t√© tir√©es par les magistrats √† la suite de ces journ√©es nombreuses, contrast√©es, riches, poignantes et √©quivoques.

√Ä lire les motivations ayant fond√© l'arr√™t, je consid√®re que ce dernier est limpide, coh√©rent, structur√© et subtil. Les juges ont r√©sist√© √† la tentation facile du Tout ou du Rien. L'entra√Ænement intellectuel, la pression m√©diatique, l'opinion commune, le retentissement de ces crimes odieux auraient pu les conduire √† ne pas s'attacher avec rigueur aux r√®gles et aux principes de l'√©tat de droit et √† privil√©gier une extr√©mit√© qui peu ou prou aurait √©t√© accept√©e parce que plus "normale". Abdelkader Merah a √©t√© d√©clar√© coupable d'association de malfaiteurs, et condamn√© de ce chef √† la sanction maximale, "parce qu'il s'inscrivait dans la logique d'un groupe ou d'une entente de personnes... favorables au djihad arm√©. Et √† cause "de son adh√©sion manifeste √† une id√©ologie islamiste radicale", prouv√©e par des propos, de la documentation, des fichiers et des contacts entre les fr√®res. En revanche son acquittement pour la complicit√© d'assassinats r√©sulte principalement de la constatation que pour tous les actes criminels commis par Mohamed Merah, celui-ci a √©t√© seul et que n'a pas √©t√© relev√©e √† la charge de son fr√®re la moindre aide ou assistance √† ces massacres. La moindre pr√©sence concr√®tement attest√©e d'Abdelkader aux c√¥t√©s de son fr√®re au cours du processus criminel tragiquement √©labor√© et ex√©cut√©.

Je voudrais insister sur un √©l√©ment qui est symptomatique de la mani√®re subtile, presque raffin√©e dont la cour d'assises a examin√© un fait sur lequel d√©fense et accusation s'opposaient vigoureusement pour en tirer √©videmment des conclusions radicalement antagonistes. Le vol du scooter, impliquant les deux fr√®res, est √† charge pour l'association de malfaiteurs puisque Abdelkader Merah n'ignorait pas que son fr√®re envisageait de l'utiliser pour des braquages destin√©s √† enrichir le terrorisme mais en revanche ne pouvait √™tre retenu √† son encontre pour la complicit√© puisqu'il ne savait pas que cet engin allait √™tre utilis√© par Mohamed pour commettre les crimes qui pr√©cis√©ment allaient tuer durant trois jours et endeuiller la France au travers des familles touch√©es en plein coeur. Il serait ridicule de se gausser d'une telle approche. Au contraire, plus une affaire est massivement tragique et criminelle, plus il est urgent de l'appr√©hender non pas en gros mais au d√©tail. La cour d'assises l'a fait et si je peux comprendre la d√©ception, l'√©moi, comme une douleur renouvel√©e du c√¥t√© des parties civiles, j'esp√®re cependant, avec la modestie du t√©moin ext√©rieur, qu'on ne continuera pas √† ressasser qu'elle n'a pas √©t√© √† la hauteur de la probl√©matique infiniment grave qui, par l'entremise des crimes √† juger, lui avait √©t√© confi√©e. Ce serait faux et offensant.

Le Parquet g√©n√©ral a interjet√© appel de cet arr√™t. Les r√©quisitions brillantes de l'avocate g√©n√©rale, tr√®s partiellement suivies, justifient cette d√©marche. Il y aura donc un second proc√®s mais celui-ci ne pourra pas tenir pour rien, intellectuellement et judiciairement, l'arr√™t rendu le 2 novembre.

Dallas Morning News editor Dom DiFurio posted an image of the bathroom doors at Dodie‚Äôs Place Cajun Bar & Grill.
The doors were decorated with photos of transgender celebrity Caitlyn Jenner, pre- and post-transition, to indicate the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs rooms, respectively.
The women‚Äôs room featured a Vanity Fair cover of Jenner and the men‚Äôs room had an image of Jenner when she won the Olympic gold in the decathlon at the 1976 Montreal Games.

TEXT:
An editor in Dallas shared a disturbing photo Monday of the transphobic bathroom signs currently in use at a local restaurant.

Dallas Morning News editor Dom DiFurio posted an image of the bathroom doors at Dodie‚Äôs Place Cajun Bar & Grill. The doors were decorated with photos of transgender celebrity Caitlyn Jenner, pre- and post-transition, to indicate the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs rooms, respectively.

The women‚Äôs room featured a Vanity Fair cover of Jenner and the men‚Äôs room had an image of Jenner when she won the Olympic gold in the decathlon at the 1976 Montreal Games.

According to the restaurant‚Äôs Facebook account, the photos of Jenner have been in use since at least August:

DiFurio told the Daily Dot that the restaurant isn‚Äôt ‚Äúseated in a progressive area‚Äù and that he ‚Äúwouldn‚Äôt consider it a particularly great place to be LGBTQ.‚Äù

Using Jenner‚Äôs photographs in this way trivializes the internal struggle and gender dysphoria many transgender individuals face. Being transgender does not mean that someone was simply once one gender and is now another. Their emotional, psychological and physical experiences are far more complex than these bathroom doors could ever reflect.

What‚Äôs more, hate against the transgender community remains deep and widespread ‚Äï so much so that one study found that transgender adults were ‚Äú14 times more likely to think about suicide and 22 times more likely to attempt suicide than the general public,‚Äù according to United Press International.
TITLE: Restaurant Uses Pre- And Post-Transition Caitlyn Jenner Photos As Bathroom Signs

Hamburg hat sich in den vergangenen Jahren als eines der beliebtesten St√§dtereiseziele in Europa etabliert. Laut dem Statistikamt konnte die Stadt im Jahr 2016 ca. 13,3 Mio. √úbernachtungen in den mehr als 300 Beherbergungsbetrieben verzeichnen, 692.000 mehr als im Vorjahr.

SUMMARY:
The results suggest that getting good REM sleep can help protect a person from ‚Äúenhanced fear,‚Äù the study authors wrote.
This means better REM sleep may make people less prone to trauma or fear-related health issues, like post-traumatic stress disorder.
They also believe REM sleep can reset the build up of norepinephrine to normal levels.
Previous studies have found that the REM stage of sleep produces cognitive benefits needed to function when you‚Äôre awake.

TEXT:
This gives a whole new meaning to the term ‚Äúsweet dreams.‚Äù

A new study shows that rapid eye movement, the stage of sleep where dreaming occurs, may help the brain better respond to stressful situations.

Research published in the Journal of Neuroscience found that people who spent more time in REM sleep during the night showed lower fear-related brain activity when exposed to mild electric shocks the following day. The results suggest that getting good REM sleep can help protect a person from ‚Äúenhanced fear,‚Äù the study authors wrote. This means better REM sleep may make people less prone to trauma or fear-related health issues, like post-traumatic stress disorder.

Researchers aren‚Äôt quite sure why this effect occurs, but they theorize it could have something to do with the production of norepinephrine (a hormone associated with stress), Time reports. The hormone can affect the amygdala, which is the fear center of the brain, making you more sensitive to stimuli that cause fear.

The study authors told the publication that the area of the brain that releases norepinephrine takes a break during REM. They also believe REM sleep can reset the build up of norepinephrine to normal levels.

The study is far from the first to reveal the benefits of a good night‚Äôs rest, particularly the importance of REM. Previous studies have found that the REM stage of sleep produces cognitive benefits needed to function when you‚Äôre awake.

‚ÄúThe pattern of brain activity [during REM] is remarkably similar to the wake stage. It‚Äôs quite active,‚Äù Rebecca Robbins, a sleep and behavioral change researcher at NYU‚Äôs School of Medicine (who was not affiliated with the study), told HuffPost. ‚ÄúThe brain waves look similar to when you‚Äôre sitting in a class and learning new material.‚Äù

Of course, all of this information is well and good but it means nothing if you can‚Äôt get a good night‚Äôs sleep. We culled research and Robbins‚Äô advice on the best ways to optimize your sleep (including that REM stage). Here are some tips:

Do something boring before bed.
TITLE: The Sleep Phase Where You Dream May Make You Less Prone To Fear

SUMMARY:
Und die Zeit f√ºr die Unterh√§ndler wird immer knapper.
Keine Einigung dar√ºber, wor√ºber man sich nicht einig istBesonders skeptisch geben sich auch die Gr√ºnen.
Die Kanzlerin meldet sich zu WortBisher hatte Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel (CDU) zu den Fortschritten der Jamaika-Koalition geschwiegen.
