TEXT:
‚ÄúHouse of Cards‚Äù creator Beau Willimon is responding to sexual harassment allegations made against the Netflix show‚Äôs star, Kevin Spacey.

In an interview with BuzzFeed News published Sunday, ‚ÄúStar Trek: Discovery‚Äù actor Anthony Rapp accused Spacey of sexually harassing him at a party in 1986, when Rapp was just 14 years old.

Willimon, who served as the ‚ÄúHouse of Cards‚Äù showrunner for its first four seasons, called the allegations against Spacey ‚Äúdeeply troubling.‚Äù Willimon said that he hadn‚Äôt witnessed inappropriate behavior from Spacey during his years working on the show, and said he supported Rapp.

My statement regarding Anthony Rapp and Kevin Spacey: pic.twitter.com/8z6zotHWE5 ‚Äî Beau Willimon (@BeauWillimon) October 30, 2017

On Monday, Netflix announced ‚ÄúHouse of Cards‚Äù Season 6 will be the show‚Äôs final season. The company also released a joint statement with producer Media Rights Capital.

‚ÄúMedia Rights Capital and Netflix are deeply troubled by last night‚Äôs news concerning Kevin Spacey,‚Äù the said, per Variety. ‚ÄúIn response to last night‚Äôs revelations, executives from both of our companies arrived in Baltimore this afternoon to meet with our cast and crew to ensure that they continue to feel safe and supported. As previously scheduled, Kevin Spacey is not working on set at this time.‚Äù

Rapp met Spacey while he was a child star in Broadway‚Äôs ‚ÄúPrecious Sons,‚Äù and was invited to a party at Spacey‚Äôs Manhattan apartment. It was there where Spacey, who was 26 at the time, allegedly ‚Äúpicked Rapp up, placed him on his bed and climbed on top of him, making a sexual advance,‚Äù according to BuzzFeed.

‚ÄúMy head was spinning,‚Äù Rapp said. ‚ÄúI have a memory of turning around and [thinking], What was that? What am I supposed to do with it? What does it mean? The older I get, and the more I know, I feel very fortunate that something worse didn‚Äôt happen.‚Äù

Early Monday, the actor responded, saying he didn‚Äôt recall the incident and suggesting his alleged actions were ‚Äúinappropriate drunken behavior.‚Äù He also used the moment to come out publicly about his sexuality.

Many on Twitter criticized Spacey‚Äôs response, accusing him of using a ‚ÄúPR smokescreen‚Äù to detract from Rapp‚Äôs accusation.

The Kevin Spacey statement is disturbing on so many levels. None more than the fact that he doesn‚Äôt deny trying to seduce A 14-YEAR-OLD BOY! ‚Äî andy lassner (@andylassner) October 30, 2017

The classiest way to come out of the closet is as a PR smokescreen to distract people from the fact that you tried to molest a child. ‚Äî Guy Branum (@guybranum) October 30, 2017

I've been very very gay and very very drunk many many many times but never hit on a child so Kevin Spacey needs a better apology. ‚Äî Wraith Choyce (@faithchoyce) October 30, 2017

Anthony Rapp: "Kevin Spacey tried to rape me."



Media: "Kevin how do you respond?"



Spacey: "uuh...uuhh... Hey everyone I'm gay!" pic.twitter.com/6LAEfsyRtF ‚Äî Travon Free (@Travon) October 30, 2017
TITLE: 'House Of Cards' Creator Responds To Kevin Spacey Sexual Harassment Allegations

TEXT:
Bayerns Finanzminister S√∂der hat bei einer Rede in Erlangen erkl√§rt, wie er sich die Zukunft der CSU vorstellt

Die Rede glich einer Kampfansage an Parteichef Horst Seehofer

Es m√ºssen gute Tage f√ºr Bayerns Finanzminister Markus S√∂der sein. Seit Jahren wird er als Nachfolger des CSU-Vorsitzenden Horst Seehofer gehandelt.

Derzeit arbeitet sich der Chef in Berlin an den Gr√ºnen ab, zuhause begehrt die Jugend auf - und S√∂der sieht t√§glich seine Chancen wachsen, Seehofer zu beerben.

Eilig hat es S√∂der nicht. Das wurde auf der JU-Landesversammlung in Erlangen am Sonntag deutlich. "Mein Wunsch und meine Hoffnung ist, dass wir gemeinsam eine L√∂sung finden, dass wir es zusammen tun", sagte er √ºber die k√ºnftige personelle Aufstellung der Partei. Wie Seehofer will er erst die Jamaika-Verhandlungen abwarten.

Eilig muss es S√∂der aber auch nicht haben. Denn die Personaldebatte in der CSU wird kommen - und mit seiner Rede brachte sich S√∂der gegen Seehofer in Stellung.

Klare Kampfansage

S√∂der mahnte, die Herausforderung m√ºsse "mit Anstand" bew√§ltigt werden - aber auch "mit Ergebnissen". Ein "Weiter so" d√ºrfe es nicht geben - eine klare Kampfansage gegen Seehofer, kommentierte auch die "Bild"-Zeitung diesen Satz.

S√∂der machte in seiner Rede deutlich, wie sehr sich die CSU nun √§ndern m√ºsse. "Es muss uns gelingen, unsere Basis zu motivieren und die W√§hler ein St√ºck weit wieder zu inspirieren", betonte er und forderte: "Es muss am Ende ein Ruck durch die CSU und durch ganz Bayern gehen."

"S√∂der - unsere Nummer 1"

Seehofer steht massiv unter Druck. Am Samstag forderte die bayerische Junge Union (JU) offen seinen R√ºcktritt.

In einer neuen Umfrage verliert die CSU weiter an Zuspruch: In einer Erhebung des Instituts Insa im Auftrag der "Bild"-Zeitung vom Montag kommt die CSU nur noch auf 37 Prozent, bei der Bundestagswahl waren es noch etwas mehr als 38 Prozent.

S√∂der hatte den Mut der bayerischen JU mit ihrer R√ºcktrittsforderung gelobt. Er setzt zwar auf eine gemeinsame L√∂sung - die Sympathien der JU geh√∂rten ihm an diesem Tag in Erlangen allerdings schon, wie Fotos zeigten. "S√∂der - unsere neue Nummer 1" stand auf Plakaten.

Mitglieder der Jungen Union Bayern neben dem bayerischen Finanzminister Markus S√∂der

Bis Dezember muss S√∂der sich noch gedulden. Dann k√∂nnte es tats√§chlich soweit sein.

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: CSU-Nachwuchs fordert R√ºcktritt von Seehofer - und k√∂nnte damit einen schweren Fehler gemacht haben

Mit Material der dpa.



(jg)
TITLE: S√∂der wetzt das Messer: Bei einer Rede macht der CSU-Politiker deutlich, wie er Seehofers Zukunft sieht

The council has been meeting every month since the Goods and Services Tax (GST) regime, which amalgamated over a dozen central and state taxes, was introduced on July 1.

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

NEW DELHI -- The all-powerful GST Council may consider lowering tax rates on a host of goods such as handmade furniture, plastic products and daily use items like shampoo, and simplify return filing rules in its meeting this week.

The council, headed by Finance Minister Arun Jaitley, is scheduled to meet on November 10 to consider lowering of the 28% GST rate on certain common use items, government officials said.

In further relief to small and medium enterprises, the panel is likely to rationalise tax rate in sectors where the total incidence of taxation has gone up because the goods were earlier either exempt from excise or was attracted lower VAT rates in the previous indirect tax regime.

The council has been meeting every month since the Goods and Services Tax (GST) regime, which amalgamated over a dozen central and state taxes, was introduced on July 1.

The meetings have resulted in an array of changes to ease compliance burden on businesses as well as provided relief to consumers.

"A rationalisation of items in the 28% tax bracket is expected. Most of the daily use items could be lowered to 18%. Also tax rate on items like furniture, electric switches, plastic pipes could be relooked," an official said.

All types of furniture attract a 28% tax under GST. Wooden furniture is handmade by unorganised sector artisans and is mostly used by middle class families and there have been demands for lowering tax incidence on them.

Also, some items of plastic attract 18% GST but goods like shower baths, sinks, wash basins, bidets, lavatory pans, seats and covers, flushing cisterns and similar sanitary ware of plastics attract 28% levy.

There is a need for rationalisation of tax rates on these items, officials said. The plastic manufacturers in their representation to the revenue department had said that 80% of the industry is in MSME category.

Besides, the GST rate on weighing machines, compressors may also be rationalised to 18% from 28%.

Officials said 90% of the manufacturers are from small and medium industries who in the pre-GST era were exempt from excise duty on manufactured value of less than Rs 1.5 crore.

Hence, such machines only attracted VAT of 14.5%. With regard to compressors, the total pre-GST incidence was 17.5% (12.5% excise duty and 5% VAT), they said stressing on need to rationalise the tax incidence.

The GST Council, which comprises of representatives of all states, have already rationalised tax rates for over 100 items. The Council has last month approved an Approach Paper to be followed by the fitment committee while deciding on future rate revisions.

Under GST various goods and services have been bracketed in 5, 12, 18 and 28%. GST has subsumed over a dozen taxes, including excise, service tax and VAT, and transformed India into a single market.
TITLE: GST Council May Consider Lowering Tax Rates On Common Goods Like Plastic Products And Shampoo

"Ich habe ihm erkl√§rt, dass wir gerade ein Kind reanimieren und den Rettungswagen jetzt nicht wegfahren k√∂nnen", zitiert die "Bild" einen der Sanit√§ter.
"Doch der hat sich drohend vor mir aufgebaut, als ob er gleich zuschlagen will."
Laut der "Berliner Zeitung" wurde der Mann zudem handgreiflich und trat den Seitenspiegel des Rettungswagens ab.
Erst als die Polizisten den Mann in Schach hielten, konnten die Sanit√§ter demnach ihre Arbeit fortsetzen und das Kind reanimieren.
Der Einj√§hrige wurde auf die Kinderintensivstation gebracht, gegen den Mann hat die Feuerwehr Anzeige erstattet.
TEXT:
Ein Autofahrer hat in Berlin Rettungskr√§fte w√§hrend eines Einsatzes attackiert. (Symbolbild) | iStock

Ein 23-J√§hriger hat einen Rettungseinsatz in Berlin behindert

Er regte sich dar√ºber auf, dass sein Auto eingeparkt war

Bei dem Einsatz ging es um ein einj√§hriges Kind, das wiederbelebt werden musste

Es ist eine dieser Meldungen, die f√ºr emp√∂rtes Kopfsch√ºtteln sorgen.

Am Freitag hat sich ein 23-J√§hriger in Berlin mit Polizei und Rettungskr√§ften angelegt, weil sie sein Auto zugeparkt hatten. Die Sanit√§ter waren gerade dabei, einen einj√§hrigen Jungen zu reanimieren, der in seiner Kita im Stadtteil Moabit beim Spielen pl√∂tzlich ohnm√§chtig geworden war.

Laut einem Bericht der "Bild"-Zeitung stellte der Notarzt bei dem Kleinen Kammerflimmern fest und musste ihn an Ort und Stelle wiederbeleben.

"Mir doch egal, wer hier gerade reanimiert wird"

Dass es hier um das Leben eines Kleinkindes ging, scheint dem 23-j√§hrigen R√ºpel allerdings herzlich wenig interessiert zu haben. "Mir doch egal, wer hier gerade reanimiert wird", soll er laut "Bild" zu den Polizeibeamten gesagt haben, die ebenfalls anger√ºckt waren.

Und das, obwohl die Lage v√∂llig offensichtlich gewesen zu sein scheint. "Ich habe ihm erkl√§rt, dass wir gerade ein Kind reanimieren und den Rettungswagen jetzt nicht wegfahren k√∂nnen", zitiert die "Bild" einen der Sanit√§ter. "Doch der hat sich drohend vor mir aufgebaut, als ob er gleich zuschlagen will."

Feuerwehr erstattet Anzeige gegen den Mann

Au√üerdem soll der Mann gebr√ºllt haben: "Verpisst euch, ich muss zur Arbeit." Laut der "Berliner Zeitung" wurde der Mann zudem handgreiflich und trat den Seitenspiegel des Rettungswagens ab.

Erst als die Polizisten den Mann in Schach hielten, konnten die Sanit√§ter demnach ihre Arbeit fortsetzen und das Kind reanimieren. Der Einj√§hrige wurde auf die Kinderintensivstation gebracht, gegen den Mann hat die Feuerwehr Anzeige erstattet.



(sk)
TITLE: Berliner Autofahrer attackiert Sanit√§ter - w√§hrend sie ein einj√§hriges Baby wiederbeleben

SUMMARY:
Then Alanis, Celine, Sarah and Shania took over the world in the '90s and Tragically Hip, Blue Rodeo and Sloan became homeland heroes.
This is more true today than ever before with Canadian artists like Drake, Arcade Fire, Feist, Michael Buble, Deadmau5 and, yes, Bieber and Nickelback at or near the top of nearly every genre.
Still, we thought it would be easier to come up with a best Canadian songs.
We had planned on 50, then expanded to 75 and finally called it at 100 and restricted ourselves to one song per act and from the 1950s onward.
Best Canadian Songs Ever Best Canadian Songs Ever1 of 99 Share this slide:
TEXT:
Canadian artists have long hit above their weight class in the global music business, from Paul Anka becoming a teen idol in the '50s to Leonard Cohen, Neil Young, Joni Mitchell and The Guess Who emerging as icons of the '60s and '70s while Bryan Adams and Corey Hart ruled the '80s. Then Alanis, Celine, Sarah and Shania took over the world in the '90s and Tragically Hip, Blue Rodeo and Sloan became homeland heroes.

This is more true today than ever before with Canadian artists like Drake, Arcade Fire, Feist, Michael Buble, Deadmau5 and, yes, Bieber and Nickelback at or near the top of nearly every genre.

Still, we thought it would be easier to come up with a best Canadian songs. We had planned on 50, then expanded to 75 and finally called it at 100 and restricted ourselves to one song per act and from the 1950s onward. Really, we could have done a list ten times this size and still had to cut.

While you may or may not agree with all the songs or their placements, we're pretty sure everyone can agree that the diversity and quality of music coming from Canada is something worth celebrating.

So please add more songs in the comments if we didn't include your favourites -- and be proud to live in a country that has such an incredible musical history.

Best Canadian Songs Ever Best Canadian Songs Ever

TITLE: 100 Best Canadian Songs Ever

Actress Julianna Margulies has added her own frightening experiences with Harvey Weinstein and Steven Seagal to the cascade of allegations of sexual harassment and assault in the entertainment world.

TEXT:
Actress Julianna Margulies has added her own frightening experiences with Harvey Weinstein and Steven Seagal to the cascade of allegations of sexual harassment and assault in the entertainment world.

In a Friday interview on SiriusXM‚Äôs ‚ÄúJust Jenny,‚Äù the ‚ÄúGood Wife‚Äù star talked about two troubling encounters with Seagal and Weinstein earlier in her career.

When she was 23, Margulies said, a female casting director sent her to Seagal‚Äôs apartment at 10 p.m. to read a scene. The casting director pushed past the actress‚Äôs objections by offering to reimburse the cab fare and promising that she would be present as well. But when Margulies arrived later that night, she said she found herself alone with the action movie star.

‚ÄúShe set me up,‚Äù Margulies said of the woman who arranged the audition.

The encounter with Seagal quickly turned threatening, the actress recalled. ‚ÄúHe made sure that I saw his gun, which I‚Äôd never seen a gun in real life,‚Äù Margulies said. ‚ÄúI got out of there unscathed. ... I don‚Äôt know how I got out of that hotel room. ... I sort of squirmed my way out.‚Äù

She said Seagal tried to turn the supposed audition into a sexual encounter with a tactic also allegedly practiced by Weinstein. ‚ÄúIt always starts with ‚ÄòI‚Äôm a healer, I wanna massage you,‚Äô‚Äù she said.

Several years later, in 1996, Margulies said she was invited to meet with Weinstein. She said another woman brought her to the hotel, promising that if she met with the film producer she‚Äôd be given a screen test for a possibly award-winning role in a major movie. After her disturbing encounter with Seagal, however, Margulies was wary.

‚ÄúI said, ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not going up there alone‚Äô ‚Äï because of the Seagal experience and because I had a career,‚Äù said Margulies, who was on the hit show ‚ÄúER‚Äù at the time.

After the actress insisted she would go home if the other woman didn‚Äôt join her, the two of them went to Weinstein‚Äôs hotel room together.

‚ÄúHe opened the door in a bathrobe,‚Äù Margulies recalled. ‚ÄúI could see that there were candles lit in the room, and there was a dinner for two. And I saw him stare at her, daggers.‚Äù She turned to the other woman and ‚Äúcaught her in a shrug, like, ‚ÄòWhat could I do?‚Äô‚Äù

Weinstein looked ‚Äúfurious,‚Äù Margulies said. He told her, ‚ÄúJust wanted to say, ‚ÄòGood audition,‚Äô‚Äù and then slammed the door, she said. She did not get the part.

Margulies joins a list of more than 50 women who have stepped forward to accuse Weinstein of sexual misconduct, with allegations ranging from attempted harassment to rape. Following two explosive expos√©s in The New York Times and The New Yorker, and numerous additional women then stepping forward to share similar experiences, Weinstein was fired from the Weinstein Company, which he co-founded with his brother, and expelled from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Police departments in Los Angeles and London are reportedly investigating rape allegations made against him. The New York Police Department confirmed on Friday that it has been gathering evidence for a ‚Äúcredible rape allegation,‚Äù which could lead to his arrest.

Seagal has previously been accused of inappropriate conduct as well. In 1998, actress Jenny McCarthy discussed leaving an audition distraught after Seagal repeatedly insisted that she undress. In 2010, he was sued for sexual harassment by a former assistant who claimed in the lawsuit that he had used her as a ‚Äúsex toy.‚Äù The lawsuit was later dropped. In October of this year, ‚ÄúInside Edition‚Äù correspondent and actress Lisa Guerrero said she was repeatedly pressured to audition alone with Seagal at his home for a role in the 1997 movie ‚ÄúFire Down Below.‚Äù

During Friday‚Äôs interview, Margulies said the recent wave of public allegations led her to realize that she‚Äôd ‚Äúswept everything under the rug. You shrug it off as that‚Äôs just Hollywood.‚Äù

She also pointed to the role of some women in enabling predatory male behavior, noting that she was introduced to both situations by other women in the business.
TITLE: Julianna Margulies Says Steven Seagal And Harvey Weinstein Tried To Sexually Harass Her

TEXT:
Con la Conferenza programmatica di Napoli il Partito Democratico ha iniziato il suo percorso per la costruzione del programma da presentare agli italiani alle prossime elezioni. Unire crescita e uguaglianza a partire dal lavoro rimane la stella polare del nostro impegno, tanto pi√π dopo gli anni durissimi che il Paese ha affrontato con la crisi.

Quanto abbiamo fatto in questi anni ha segnato un cambio di passo fondamentale per l'Italia, ma ora questo sforzo va consolidato e rafforzato sui fronti fondamentali dello sviluppo economico e della coesione sociale. Continuare l'impegno di riduzione della pressione fiscale per chi crea lavoro, per le famiglie e per chi √® pi√π debole, rafforzare gli strumenti di lotta alle diseguaglianza e alla povert√†, rilanciare gli investimenti pubblici e privati, affrontare il cambio di paradigma che la rivoluzione tecnologica e digitale sta determinando nel mondo del lavoro investendo radicalmente sulla conoscenza lungo tutto l'arco della vita, ridisegnare i percorsi di protezione sociale a partire da bambini e anziani, proseguire la svolta ecologica dello sviluppo e la stagione di nuovi diritti di cittadinanza: sono alcuni dei grandi temi che abbiamo affrontato a che meritano uno sforzo di elaborazione nuova da parte nostra (su www.partitodemocratico.it tutti i materiali utili).

Rivendichiamo con orgoglio il nostro impegno di governo di questi anni, sbaglia chi non riconosce i tanti avanzamenti prodotti in un contesto assai difficile, ma siamo anche consapevoli che i risultati conseguiti fino a qui non rappresentano la nostra meta perch√© molto rimane da fare. A cominciare dal rilancio del progetto europeo a cui il destino del nostro Paese √® legato in modo indissolubile e che noi dobbiamo contribuire a realizzare per superare le grandi difficolt√† vissute in questi anni.

A Napoli abbiamo anche tracciato il percorso che vogliamo fare nelle prossime settimane. Vorrei che tutto il Pd seguisse con coerenza e passione lo sforzo che abbiamo proposto con il segretario, lasciando da parte polemiche inutili e dannose ed evitando di ricominciare tutto da capo. La nuova legge elettorale riporta alla costruzione di coalizioni. Le prossime elezioni regionali in Lombardia e Lazio anche. Il Partito Democratico deve essere il perno centrale di una nuovo progetto di centrosinistra ampio e plurale in grado di unire le forze per battere i candidati di Salvini, Berlusconi e Grillo. Se guardiamo con preoccupazione all'avanzata della destra in tutta Europa, dobbiamo essere conseguenti anche a casa nostra e costruire un cambio di passo nella nostra iniziativa. Vale per il Pd come per tutte le forze del centrosinistra che non vogliano fare solo testimonianza. Serve un nuovo inizio. Noi siamo pronti a confrontarci senza veti con tutte le forze progressiste, europeiste, moderate, interessate a costruire unit√† e non divisione.

Sappiamo che il Pd √® essenziale per dare credibilit√† e forza all'alternativa a destra e cinque stelle e riconosciamo che accanto a noi serve il protagonismo positivo di altre forze e di altre energie. Proponiamo un lavoro comune sul progetto per l'Italia del futuro che non si fermi al dibattito spesso sterile sulle leadership perch√© - come ha detto bene Renzi proprio a Napoli - il punto "non √® chi di noi governer√† ma se toccher√† al centrosinistra o all'estremismo della destra dei Salvini o all'inaffidabilit√† dei Cinque Stelle di Di Maio". Ciascuno metta in campo le sue personalit√† migliori, nell'idea condivisa di una squadra forte, affidabile e plurale per l'Italia. Ciascuno avanzi idee utili per il Paese, guardando avanti con spirito costruttivo. Il Pd c'√®. Sente su di se questa responsabilit√† e avanza per questo una proposta aperta al contributo di quanti vorranno dare una mano. Tocca a tutti noi alzare lo sguardo, uscire dalla strettoia di troppe polemiche quotidiane per riguadagnare il senso della prospettiva. Sono convinto che tanti elettori del centrosinistra siano proprio in attesa di questo segnale.
TITLE: Al centrosinistra serve un nuovo inizio, il Pd c'√®

TEXT:
CULTURE

iPhone X √® davvero "il pi√π resistente di sempre"? Non provate a rifare questi test di caduta

Apple ha definito i nuovi iPhone 8 e iPhone X "gli smartphone con il vetro pi√π resistente di sempre". La spesa pu√≤ arrivare fino a 1359 euro e naturalmente ci si augura in effetti che il Gorilla Glass 5 che li avvolge non vada in frantumi dopo una caduta accidentale. Per questo i cosiddetti "drop test" vanno alla grande sul web: gli YouTuber pi√π coraggiosi, e con grande seguito, sacrificano uno dei nuovi esemplari riprendendo la sua caduta da almeno due altezze: 1 metro, corrispondente pi√π o meno a una fuoriuscita dalla tasca dei pantaloni, e 1,5 metri, l'altezza a cui si tiene normalmente il dispositivo quando si usa per telefonare. Quello che state vedendo √® uno dei test pi√π cliccati su YouTube dalla data di uscita dell'iPhone X, lo scorso 3 novembre. L'autore del video mette a confronto la caduta dell'iPhone pi√π costoso sul mercato con quella dell'iPhone 8. I risultati ottenuti in questo test, ovviamente, non sanciscono ufficialmente n√© definitivamente la resistenza del nuovo smartphone. Altre prove, sul web, hanno registrato esiti diversi
TITLE: iPhone X √® davvero "il pi√π resistente di sempre"? Non provate a rifare questi test di caduta

ADVERTISEMENTNEW DELHI -- India may announce measures next week to help traders and small businesses who say a new nationwide goods and services tax (GST) has increased their tax and administrative burden.
A panel of ministers last month recommended reducing tax rates for small businesses and traders and raising the minimum revenue threshold for companies that need to pay tax, local media reported.
Modi said he expected India's ranking to improve next year when the GST and other reforms were considered.
He added that there were other reforms on which India and the World Bank would need to find common ground.

TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

NEW DELHI -- India may announce measures next week to help traders and small businesses who say a new nationwide goods and services tax (GST) has increased their tax and administrative burden.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi said if there is consensus at the next GST council meeting due over November 9 to November 10, the government would take the necessary steps to help traders and strengthen the country's economy.

A panel of ministers last month recommended reducing tax rates for small businesses and traders and raising the minimum revenue threshold for companies that need to pay tax, local media reported.

The launch in July of the long-awaited GST, which transformed India's 29 states into a single customs union, has left thousands of small and medium-sized firms at the bottom of the supply chain short of working capital.

Modi is facing criticism for the disruption to the economy caused by the roll-out of GST and the shock removal of higher-value bills from circulation last year. As a result of these issues India's economy is expected to grow at its slowest pace in four years this fiscal year, a Reuters poll found.

Modi's comments came days after India jumped about 30 places to 100th on the World Bank's "Ease of Doing Business" rankings, reflecting reforms in accessing credit, power supply and the protection of minority investors.

Modi said he expected India's ranking to improve next year when the GST and other reforms were considered.

"There are many other reforms that have already happened but need gestation and stabilization time before they are taken into account by the World Bank," Modi said.

He added that there were other reforms on which India and the World Bank would need to find common ground.

Modi said along with manufacturing, India was also pushing for faster progress in developing infrastructure and was working to improve the investment climate.
TITLE: Centre May Announce Tax Relief For Traders Affected By GST

TEXT:
‚ÄúChances are, he‚Äôs not truly interested in you or interested in getting to know you on a real level,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs not a mutual conversation, you‚Äôll probably end up being his mirror and supporting him.‚Äù

You shouldn‚Äôt know everything about the guy after one date: If he monopolized the conversation with talk of his stock options and rudely interrupted when you finally got a word in, you probably don‚Äôt need to see him again, said Kristin Zeising , a psychologist in San Diego, California.

1. He talks about himself ‚Äï and only himself.

Below, marriage therapists and other relationship experts share those and other glaring red flags that the new guy you‚Äôre seeing is categorically not The One .

It‚Äôs important to give people a chance while dating , but there are some red flags you just can‚Äôt overlook: Does he spend the whole evening interrupting you to talk about himself? Don‚Äôt date him. Is he still weirdly obsessed with an ex from years ago? Tell him ‚Äúthanks, but no, thanks.‚Äù

Nervousness and awkward pauses are totally normal on first dates. But eventually, the conversation should flow easily between you and your man, said Marie Land, a psychologist in Washington, D.C.

‚ÄúConversations should be like a tennis match where the ball is hit into one court by the person and hit back by the other person,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIf he doesn‚Äôt ask questions or have a general curiosity about your experience, it‚Äôs a red flag.‚Äù

3. He has nothing good to say about previous relationships.

Don‚Äôt turn your cheek when he trash talks his ex: Stick around long enough and he‚Äôll likely be saying the same things about you to future dates, said Diane Spear, a therapist in New York City.

‚ÄúPeople are not all-good or all-bad, so if he can‚Äôt find anything good to say about past partners, it indicates that he may tend to idealize partners then denigrate them when the newness wears off,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúYou won‚Äôt be immune to this treatment.‚Äù
TITLE: 10 Signs He‚Äôs Bound To Be Your Future Ex-Boyfriend

SUMMARY:
The SABC's head of Legal Services, Sizwe Vilakazi, has been shot and killed, the organisation said on Sunday.
"It is with great sadness to announce the passing of Mr Sizwe Vilakazi, the SABC's head of Legal Services.
Mr Vilakazi was shot dead last night [Saturday]," said SABC spokesperson Kaizer Kganyago in a statement.
"He was dedicated to his work and entrusted with a huge responsibility of heading the SABC's legal division."
On September 1, 2016, he was appointed as head of Legal Services.
TEXT:
An SABC Satellite truck beaming back Television signals from the Moses Mabhida Stadium in Durban, South Africa, one of the host stadiums for the 2010 FIFA World Cup.

The SABC's head of Legal Services, Sizwe Vilakazi, has been shot and killed, the organisation said on Sunday.

"It is with great sadness to announce the passing of Mr Sizwe Vilakazi, the SABC's head of Legal Services. Mr Vilakazi was shot dead last night [Saturday]," said SABC spokesperson Kaizer Kganyago in a statement.

"The SABC Board, management and staff of the SABC would like to send heartfelt condolences to the Vilakazi family and friends."

Vilikazi had made an "immense contribution" to the broadcaster said Kganyago.

"He was dedicated to his work and entrusted with a huge responsibility of heading the SABC's legal division."

He was appointed as a senior legal advisor on December 1, 2008.

On September 1, 2016, he was appointed as head of Legal Services.

Police were not immediately available to provide further details.

Memorial and funeral arrangements would be announced in due course.
TITLE: SABC Head Of Legal Services, Sizwe Vilakazi Has Been Shot Dead

Doch ein Symptom von Depressionen, von dem ihr wahrscheinlich noch nicht geh√∂rt habt und gleichzeitig eines, das mit am schwersten zu ertragen ist: Einsamkeit.
Ich w√ºnsche mir so sehr, dass jemand bei mir ist, dass es weh tutDoch das bedeutet nicht, dass ich keine Gesellschaft m√∂chte.
Ich f√ºhle mich schuldig, dass ich diese Gesellschaft m√∂chte, dass ich jemanden in meiner N√§he brauche.
Wenn ich mich sehr schlimm niedergeschlagen f√ºhle, sehne ich mich nach jemanden, mit dem ich sprechen kann und der mich versteht, ohne mich zu verurteilen.
Wegen des Stigmas, das der Krankheit anhaftet, oder weil sie nicht verstehen oder Angst haben oder nicht wissen, wie sie helfen sollen.
TEXT:
Dieser Text erschien zuerst bei The Mighty.

Von Jenna B.

Ihr wisst sicher einiges √ºber Depressionen.

Ihr wisst, dass Menschen mit Depressionen sich oft traurig und leer f√ºhlen, keinen Appetit haben oder schlecht schlafen k√∂nnen. Dass sie m√ºde sind und dass ihnen Dinge keine Freude mehr bereiten, die sie normalerweise lieben w√ºrden. Und dass sie vielleicht sogar an den Tod und ans Sterben denken.

Doch ein Symptom von Depressionen, von dem ihr wahrscheinlich noch nicht geh√∂rt habt und gleichzeitig eines, das mit am schwersten zu ertragen ist: Einsamkeit.

Wir Menschen sehnen uns nach N√§he. Sogar die meisten Introvertierten wollen mit kleinen Gruppen oder einzelnen Personen in Interaktion treten.

Doch wenn ich mich depressiv f√ºhle, kann ich mich selbst nicht dazu bringen, Verabredungen auszumachen oder einzuhalten. Manchmal kann ich nicht mal duschen und mich anziehen, geschweige denn das Haus verlassen.

Ich w√ºnsche mir so sehr, dass jemand bei mir ist, dass es weh tut

Doch das bedeutet nicht, dass ich keine Gesellschaft m√∂chte. Im Gegenteil: Ich w√ºnsche mir so sehr, dass jemand bei mir ist, dass es weh tut. Doch ich habe Angst, jemanden zu fragen.

Ich wei√ü, dass ich andere damit belaste. Und ich wei√ü auch, dass es keinen Spa√ü macht, mit mir Zeit zu verbringen, weil ich immer traurig bin und es mir schwer f√§llt, die Dinge zu genie√üen, die ich fr√ºher gerne mochte.

Ich f√ºhle mich schuldig, dass ich diese Gesellschaft m√∂chte, dass ich jemanden in meiner N√§he brauche.

Wenn ich mich sehr schlimm niedergeschlagen f√ºhle, sehne ich mich nach jemanden, mit dem ich sprechen kann und der mich versteht, ohne mich zu verurteilen. Doch ich bekomme meinen Mund nicht auf, um nach der Hilfe zu fragen, die ich brauche.

Je st√§rker meine Depression wird, desto isolierter f√ºhle ich mich von der Au√üenwelt

Ich bin gefangen in meinem eigenen Kopf und ich kann mich innerlich schreien h√∂ren. Doch leider kann niemand meine Gedanken lesen.

Je st√§rker meine Depression wird, desto isolierter f√ºhle ich mich von der Au√üenwelt und desto weniger Kraft habe ich, mit anderen Menschen in Kontakt zu treten. Doch das ist genau der Zeitpunkt, an dem ich am meisten auf jemanden angewiesen bin, der sieht, was mit mir los ist.

Es ist traurig, dass die Symptome von Depressionen daf√ºr sorgen, dass du so viele Freunde verlierst. Wegen des Stigmas, das der Krankheit anhaftet, oder weil sie nicht verstehen oder Angst haben oder nicht wissen, wie sie helfen sollen. Oder weil sie besch√§ftigt sind und nicht gest√∂rt werden wollen.

Denn manchmal ist der beste Weg, einem Freund oder geliebten Person mit Depressionen zu begegnen, einfach Zeit mit ihm zu verbringen und zu tun, wonach ihm ist.

Es ist so wichtig, mit ihm oder ihr Zeit zu verbringen

Auch wenn das nur ein Netflix-Abend auf der Couch ist oder ein gemeinsamer Kaffee oder ein Abendessen. Allein dadurch, dass du dich um deinen Freund oder deine Freundin k√ºmmerst, hilft ihm oder ihr, sich besser zu f√ºhlen.

Sogar wenn der Andere deine Worte der Beschwichtigung und des Trostes nicht zu h√∂ren scheint, kann deine Anwesenheit sehr wertvoll f√ºr ihn sein. Es tut immer gut zu wissen, dass jemand sich um dich sorgt und aufrichtige, liebevolle Worte zu h√∂ren.

Mir hilft das immer sehr, wenn ich depressiv bin. Es erinnert mich daran, dass ich diese Liebe verdient habe und hilft mir, an meiner Selbstliebe zu arbeiten, die mich aus der Depression herausziehen kann.

Wenn ihr also einen Freund oder Liebsten habt, der unter Depressionen leidet, erinnert euch bitte immer daran: Es ist so wichtig, mit ihm oder ihr Zeit zu verbringen. Depressionen sind eine Krankheit, die sehr einsam macht. Und N√§he zu anderen Menschen ist extrem wichtig bei der Genesung.

Dieser Text erschien urspr√ºnglich in der HuffPost USA und wurde von Lea Kosch aus dem Englischen √ºbersetzt.

____

Ihr habt auch ein spannendes Thema?

Die HuffPost ist eine Debattenplattform f√ºr alle Perspektiven. Wenn ihr die Diskussion zu politischen oder gesellschaftlichen Themen vorantreiben wollt, schickt eure Idee an unser Blog-Team unter blog@huffingtonpost.de.

(jg)
TITLE: Das Symptom von Depressionen, √ºber das niemand spricht

SUMMARY:
From 2003 onwards, a number of Australian same-sex couples married overseas in countries such as Canada.
As more and more Australians showed their support for marriage equality, the Australian Parliament continually failed to reflect it.
There have been moments of hope though, as we have seen wonderful scenes of some politicians standing up for Australian same-sex couples.
Politicians such as Sarah Hanson-Young from the Greens and Penny Wong from Labor, along with many others, have also delivered moving speeches in support of marriage equality.
There were more than 79,000 submissions, with a majority of 46,400 in favour of marriage equality.
TEXT:
"Australians have long engaged with this issue -- it‚Äôs time for that engagement to lead to some weddings!"

Australians have been on a marathon journey throughout this postal survey process, but they have been talking about, and supporting, marriage equality for even longer.

Since 2001, when the first same-sex marriages took place in the Netherlands, until now as we approach the survey's end, there have been many twists and turns on our journey to a fairer and more equal Australia.

From 2003 onwards, a number of Australian same-sex couples married overseas in countries such as Canada. In 2004, the Howard Government responded to this by amending the 'Marriage Act of 1961' to not only prevent same-sex couples from marrying in Australia but to ensure that overseas marriages between same-sex couples would not be recognised here.

Since 2004, there have been 22 different Bills introduced into Parliament in attempts to legislate for same-sex marriage. As more and more Australians showed their support for marriage equality, the Australian Parliament continually failed to reflect it.

There have been moments of hope though, as we have seen wonderful scenes of some politicians standing up for Australian same-sex couples. Liberal Senator Sue Boyce crossed the floor in Federal Parliament over this issue back in 2013. Politicians such as Sarah Hanson-Young from the Greens and Penny Wong from Labor, along with many others, have also delivered moving speeches in support of marriage equality.

"This ain't a respectful debate already." Here is the key part of @SenatorWong's remarkable speech against the #ssm plebiscite. #auspolpic.twitter.com/xFgvTPzl1H ‚Äî Luke Henriques-Gomes (@lukehgomes) August 9, 2017

In 2007, Fairfax published the first poll which showed that a majority of Australians supported marriage equality. This support has been reflected in every subsequent poll conducted on the issue. That is an outstanding 10 years of continuous support. Australians have shown that they care deeply about the happiness and inclusion of their LGBTQ family and friends and that they have long been ready for marriage equality.

In 2012, there was a Senate Inquiry into same-sex marriage. By the time it ended, it had set a historic record for the amount of submissions received from the public. There were more than 79,000 submissions, with a majority of 46,400 in favour of marriage equality. This is an overwhelming number that shows Australians have been contemplating what marriage equality would mean for quite some time and they have embraced it.

Since 2001, so many Australians have watched on with a sense of envy as countries such as New Zealand, the UK and the U.S. have introduced marriage equality. Few would not have been moved in 2013 when MPs in New Zealand Parliament broke into spontaneous song, singing Maori love songs after marriage equality was passed in that country.

Many Australians remember the touching scenes shown on Australian televisions in 2015 after the successful referendum in Ireland. Faces full of joy were shown celebrating in Dublin. Others will recall the White House lighting up with rainbow colours when the U.S. Supreme Court announced that marriage equality was now legal across the entire country.

White House lit up with rainbow colors tonight to mark SCOTUS ruling on same-sex marriage pic.twitter.com/hx2SWu9Oja ‚Äî Jamie Dupree (@jamiedupree) June 27, 2015

Marriage equality has been an issue that has been driven in this country by everyday people who just want equality under the law. They have been supported by their friends and families from one side of the country to the other. We have seen this through the amazing efforts people have put into campaigning for a 'yes' vote in the postal survey.

More than 1 billion people now live in countries with marriage equality. We hope that by the end of this year, Australia will join them. The Australian people have done everything possible to see marriage equality become a reality in this country. More than 12 million people have now posted their survey back. That is about 77 percent of the population, an extraordinary turnout.

After November 15, when the results of the postal survey are announced, the attention of this entire country will turn to Parliament. Having put their hearts and souls into this cause, Australians will not tolerate any more attempts to delay a positive reform that will bring our country together.

Just as loving same-sex couples want to honour their commitment to each other, the Australian government must honour its commitment to act on the results of this survey by Christmas.

Australians have long engaged with this issue -- it's time for that engagement to lead to some weddings!
TITLE: I Do Hope Australia's Long March Down The Aisle To Marriage Equality Is Almost Over

SUMMARY:
Week six of our Listen To America road trip closed out in Tucson, Arizona.
The people of Tucson, which is sometimes referred to as ‚ÄúThe Old Pueblo,‚Äù welcomed us to their bustling city in Arizona‚Äôs Sonoran Desert and let us spend some time on the University of Arizona campus.
The university helps give the city its electricity, but it‚Äôs merely a small part of Tucson‚Äôs mass appeal.
It‚Äôs known for its Sonoran-style Mexican food, and UNESCO even designated Tucson a ‚Äúworld city of gastronomy‚Äù in 2015 (curious and hungry visitors must try a Sonoran hot dog).
Here‚Äôs what our time in Tucson looked like:
TEXT:
Week six of our Listen To America road trip closed out in Tucson, Arizona.

The people of Tucson, which is sometimes referred to as ‚ÄúThe Old Pueblo,‚Äù welcomed us to their bustling city in Arizona‚Äôs Sonoran Desert and let us spend some time on the University of Arizona campus.

The university helps give the city its electricity, but it‚Äôs merely a small part of Tucson‚Äôs mass appeal. For one, the city is something of a hub for writers. David Foster Wallace, Barbara Kingsolver and Erskine Caldwell all called the city home.

Tucson is also a gastronomical haven. It‚Äôs known for its Sonoran-style Mexican food, and UNESCO even designated Tucson a ‚Äúworld city of gastronomy‚Äù in 2015 (curious and hungry visitors must try a Sonoran hot dog).

We‚Äôd advise that you come for the food and stay for the views of the Santa Catalinas mountains and the gorgeous adobe row houses of Barrio Historico. Here‚Äôs what our time in Tucson looked like:
TITLE: All Right, Arizona! HuffPost‚Äôs 'Listen To America' Tour Stops In Tucson

SUMMARY:
Play FacebookTwitterEmbed EXCLUSIVE: Mueller Has Enough Evidence to Bring Charges in Flynn Investigation 0:57 autoplay autoplay Copy this code to your website or blogMueller is applying renewed pressure on Flynn following his indictment of Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort, three sources familiar with the investigation told NBC News.
The pressure on Flynn is the latest signal that Mueller is moving at a rapid, and steady, pace in his investigation.
If the senior Flynn is charged, he would be the first current or former Trump administration official formally accused of criminal wrongdoing by the Mueller team.
It is unclear whether the request to investigate Gulen came from Flynn or through the typical diplomatic channels at the State Department.
Any quid-pro-quo deal such as the alleged agreement between Flynn and Turkey would be illegal, officials said.
TEXT:
WASHINGTON ‚Äî Federal investigators have gathered enough evidence to bring charges in their investigation of President Donald Trump's former national security adviser and his son as part of the probe into Russia's intervention in the 2016 election, according to multiple sources familiar with the investigation.

Michael T. Flynn, who was fired after just 24 days on the job, was one of the first Trump associates to come under scrutiny in the federal probe now led by Special Counsel Robert Mueller into possible collusion between Moscow and the Trump campaign.

Play Facebook

Twitter

Embed EXCLUSIVE: Mueller Has Enough Evidence to Bring Charges in Flynn Investigation 0:57 autoplay autoplay Copy this code to your website or blog

Mueller is applying renewed pressure on Flynn following his indictment of Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort, three sources familiar with the investigation told NBC News.

The investigators are speaking to multiple witnesses in coming days to gain more information surrounding Flynn's lobbying work, including whether he laundered money or lied to federal agents about his overseas contacts, according to three sources familiar with the investigation.

From left, retired Lt. Gen. Michael T. Flynn, his son Michael G. Flynn, and Boris Epshteyn, a spokesman for President-elect Donald Trump, board an elevator at Trump Tower in New York on Nov. 17, 2016. Carolyn Kaster / AP file

Mueller's team is also examining whether Flynn attempted to orchestrate the removal of a chief rival of Turkish President Recep Erdogan from the U.S. to Turkey in exchange for millions of dollars, two officials said.

A spokesperson for the special counsel had no comment.

Related: Mike Flynn's Son Is Subject of Federal Russia Investigation

Flynn's son, Michael G. Flynn, who worked closely with his father, accompanied him during the campaign and briefly worked on the presidential transition, could be indicted separately or at the same time as his father, according to three sources familiar with the investigation.

If the elder Flynn is willing to cooperate with investigators in order to help his son, two of the sources said, it could also change his own fate, potentially limiting any legal consequences.

The pressure on Flynn is the latest signal that Mueller is moving at a rapid, and steady, pace in his investigation. Last week, investigators unsealed indictments of Manafort and Manafort's business partner Rick Gates. They pleaded not guilty.

Michael G. Flynn at an RT event with his father Ret. Lt. Gen. Mike Flynn in Moscow in 2015. RT

Investigators also revealed Monday that former Trump campaign adviser George Papadopoulos had pleaded guilty to lying to federal officials and had been cooperating with Mueller's investigation.

If the senior Flynn is charged, he would be the first current or former Trump administration official formally accused of criminal wrongdoing by the Mueller team.

So far, the probe has only ensnared campaign officials, and the White House has argued that the connection to the president is minimal. An indictment of the president's former national security adviser and his son would scramble that dynamic.

Related: Flynn, Manafort Are Key Figures in Mueller's Russia Probe

A former senior law enforcement official said that in the weeks after Trump's inauguration the FBI was asked to conduct a new review of Turkey's 2016 request to extradite Fethullah Gulen, an elderly Muslim cleric living in the U.S. whom President Erdogan blames for orchestrating a coup to overthrow him.

The FBI pushed back on the request because Turkey had supplied no additional information that could incriminate Gulen since a review of the case during the Obama administration, the official said. It is unclear whether the request to investigate Gulen came from Flynn or through the typical diplomatic channels at the State Department.

U.S.-based cleric Fethullah Gulen, whose followers Turkey blames for a failed coup, speaks to journalists at his home in Saylorsburg, Pennsylvania, on July 16, 2016. Greg Savoy / REUTERS TV / Reuters, file

The FBI is also investigating former CIA Director Jim Woolsey's account to the Wall Street Journal ‚Äî which he confirmed to MSNBC ‚Äî that Flynn and Turkish officials discussed a potential plan to forcibly remove Gulen from the country in September 2016, according to sources close to Woolsey, who say the former director has spoken to FBI agents working for Mueller about the matter.

Flynn was fired in February following public revelations that he had lied to Vice President Pence about his dealings with the Russian ambassador to the U.S., Sergey Kislyak.

Flynn's lawyer, Robert Kelner, declined to comment.

The younger Flynn's lawyer, Barry Coburn, declined to comment.

Father and Son

Both Flynns have for months been subjects of the Mueller investigation.

The elder Flynn, an Army lieutenant general, was pushed out as head of the Defense Intelligence Agency in 2014 and retired from the military. He then founded a lobbying firm, Flynn Intel Group, where his son worked closely with him. The younger Flynn was involved in the daily operations of his father's firm and functioned as his chief of staff. He often attended meetings with his father and would communicate with prospective clients.

The elder Flynn was paid $530,000 last year for work the Justice Department says benefited the government of Turkey. The elder Flynn did not register as a foreign lobbyist at the time, but did so retroactively this year. The issue has been part of Mueller's probe.

FBI Director Robert Mueller testifies before a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing ion oversight of the FBI on June 19, 2013 in Washington. Tom Williams / CQ-Roll Call file

His lawyer later said Flynn didn't need to register because his client was a Turkish businessman and not a government official, but had opted to do so retroactively.

According to Flynn's Justice Department filing, the Flynn Intel Group was hired to gather information about Gulen, and to produce a short film about its findings.

During the contract, which ended the day after Trump won the election, Flynn had at least one meeting, in September 2016, with Turkish officials, according to officials. Woolsey says that it included a discussion about kidnapping Gulen and flying him to Turkey.

Flynn also was paid some $35,000 in 2015 by Russian state television for a speech in Moscow at a gala where he sat next to Russian President Vladimir Putin. The younger Flynn accompanied him on that trip. The trip raised concerns among federal officials.

NBC News has reported that others under scrutiny by Mueller include Carter Page, a Trump campaign ally; Jared Kushner, the president's son-in-law and senior White House adviser; and the president's son, Donald Trump Jr. They have denied any collusion with Russia.

Play Facebook

Twitter

Embed Exclusive: Michael Flynn's Son is A Subject of Russia Investigation 1:49 autoplay autoplay Copy this code to your website or blog

President Trump has denied any collusion with Russia during the campaign and has called the investigation a politically motivated witch hunt.

Kelner has declined to comment when asked if Flynn denies colluding with the Russian election interference effort.

Turkey has long demanded the U.S. extradite Gulen, saying he is considered a terrorist. Erdogan forcefully renewed that request after the attempted coup against him in July 2016. U.S. officials have said the Justice Department has not found sufficient evidence linking Gulen to the coup attempt despite the boxes of documents Turkey has submitted to the U.S. that Ankara says back up its claim.

Extradition requests are processed through the U.S. justice system and are not determined by the White House or other agencies.

Any quid-pro-quo deal such as the alleged agreement between Flynn and Turkey would be illegal, officials said.
TITLE: Mueller Has Enough Evidence to Bring Charges in Flynn Investigation

Maisie Williams can‚Äôt wait to get out of Westeros.
‚ÄúGame of Thrones‚Äù fans may shed a tear when HBO‚Äôs fantasy epic draws to a close following its eighth and final season, but the British actress says she‚Äôs eager for the show to end so that she can pursue other projects.

TEXT:
Maisie Williams can‚Äôt wait to get out of Westeros.

‚ÄúGame of Thrones‚Äù fans may shed a tear when HBO‚Äôs fantasy epic draws to a close following its eighth and final season, but the British actress says she‚Äôs eager for the show to end so that she can pursue other projects.

It‚Äôs ‚Äúincredibly exciting‚Äù and ‚Äúwill be nice to pick roles that I want to do,‚Äù the 20-year-old told BBC Newsbeat in a piece published online Thursday.

‚ÄúI can show the world what sort of actress I want to be and shape my career a little bit,‚Äù she added.

Williams has appeared as the sword-wielding, list-keeping Arya Stark since she was just 14. The actress acknowledged that the prospect of not having the show as a safety net was ‚Äúnerve wracking.‚Äù

But ‚Äúon the other hand,‚Äù Williams said she‚Äôll be ‚Äúfree‚Äù and able to develop independent movies via her newly-launched production company.

The final season of ‚ÄúGame of Thrones‚Äù is expected to air in 2019.
TITLE: Here's Why Maisie Williams Is Eager For ‚ÄòGame Of Thrones‚Äô To End

SUMMARY:
Many supporters of Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) interpreted the news as confirmation that the party had treated him unfairly.
‚ÄúI am more committed than ever before to restoring voters‚Äô faith in our democratic process because even the perception of impartiality or an unfair advantage undermines our ability to win,‚Äù Perez said.
‚ÄúWe will work with the Unity Reform Commission to implement their collective recommendations for meaningful change in our party,‚Äù Perez said.
George Frey/Getty Images DNC Chairman Tom Perez has had to address a lingering divide in the Democratic Party between skeptical progressives and more establishment-minded party figures.
The commission is due to recommend reforms to the nominating process by January 2018.
TEXT:
In a Saturday blogpost, Democratic National Committee chairman Tom Perez vowed to enact reforms to the party‚Äôs presidential nominating process aimed at ensuring that ‚Äúthe new DNC will work to rebuild trust with the people we represent.‚Äù

Perez‚Äôs column on Medium, entitled ‚ÄúMaking 2020 Transparent,‚Äù was a response to revelations by former interim DNC chairwoman Donna Brazile last week that in a signed agreement the committee had effectively surrendered its independence to Hillary Clinton‚Äôs campaign in August 2015 ‚Äï months before 2016 presidential primary voters went to the polls. Many supporters of Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) interpreted the news as confirmation that the party had treated him unfairly.

‚ÄúI am more committed than ever before to restoring voters‚Äô faith in our democratic process because even the perception of impartiality or an unfair advantage undermines our ability to win,‚Äù Perez said. ‚ÄúThat is unacceptable.‚Äù

‚ÄúAfter listening to Democrats from every wing of our party, I‚Äôve developed a series of concrete reforms to put our principles into action and guarantee that under my watch, the new DNC will work to rebuild trust with the people we represent,‚Äù he said.

The ‚Äúprinciples‚Äù Perez plans to employ include deciding the presidential primary debate schedule well before voting in the contests begins and making transparent to the public any joint fundraising agreements the DNC makes.

He also promised to support the work of the Unity Reform Commission, a panel formed in July 2016 as a compromise with delegates who backed Sanders at the Democratic National Convention.

‚ÄúWe will work with the Unity Reform Commission to implement their collective recommendations for meaningful change in our party,‚Äù Perez said.

George Frey/Getty Images DNC Chairman Tom Perez has had to address a lingering divide in the Democratic Party between skeptical progressives and more establishment-minded party figures.

The commission is due to recommend reforms to the nominating process by January 2018. The 21-member panel is discussing plans to make the party‚Äôs budget more transparent, diminish the role of so-called superdelegates in the nominating process, and make it easier for independents and new voters to participate in Democratic primaries and caucuses.

Nomiki Konst, one of eight Sanders appointees on the commission, expressed disappointment that Perez did not explicitly address DNC budget transparency and prohibiting the committee‚Äôs voting members from having business with the organization or other conflicts of interest that could jade their ability to act impartially.
TITLE: DNC Chairman Promises To Reform Party's Presidential Nominating Process

SUMMARY:
Police are investigating after fire ripped through an inner Sydney factory overnight.
Police and emergency services were called to the premises on Victoria Road at Marrickville after reports of a fire about 9pm Friday.
An investigation is underway after a huge blaze ripped through a #Marrickville factory last night.
Traffic diversions are in place due to a factory fire in Marrickville.
#9News pic.twitter.com/ucryztNTt6 November 3, 2017A number of traffic diversions were put in place due to the incident, with Victoria Road closed between Sydenham Road and Enmore.
TEXT:
Police are investigating after fire ripped through an inner Sydney factory overnight.

Police and emergency services were called to the premises on Victoria Road at Marrickville after reports of a fire about 9pm Friday.

An investigation is underway after a huge blaze ripped through a #Marrickville factory last night. @7NewsSydney pic.twitter.com/Q8AYKJEw6N ‚Äî Natasha Squarey (@NatashaSquarey) November 3, 2017

Fire fighters rushed to the scene and extinguished the blaze, with no evacuations needed.

Twenty-five firefighters and three trucks battled the fire from three sides of the building. Authorities couldn't get inside the factory because the fire was too fierce.

Traffic diversions are in place due to a factory fire in Marrickville. #9News pic.twitter.com/ucryztNTt6 November 3, 2017

A number of traffic diversions were put in place due to the incident, with Victoria Road closed between Sydenham Road and Enmore.

Police are urging anyone with information in relation to the blaze to call Crime Stoppers.
TITLE: Police Ask For Public's Help After Fire Rips Through Sydney Factory

TEXT:
Les √©lecteurs de 858 municipalit√©s au Qu√©bec seront appel√©s √† choisir entre le changement ou la continuit√© pour les √©lections municipales qui se d√©rouleront dimanche soir.

Au terme de cette campagne de deux mois, le portrait de plusieurs villes du Qu√©bec pourrait √™tre modifi√© quant aux conseils municipaux de celles-ci ou aux maires qui les dirigeront au cours des quatre prochaines ann√©es.

Selon la sp√©cialiste en gestion municipale Danielle Pilette, l'issue des √©lections est tr√®s difficile √† pr√©dire, notamment parce que la personnalit√© des candidats prend plus de place que les enjeux, et ce, m√™me dans les grandes villes.

¬´Le probl√®me au municipal, c'est que les v√©ritables partis municipaux sont rares, donc il y a tr√®s peu d'enjeux qui ressortent. Il n'y a pas vraiment de programmes de partis, il y a des programmes de personnes¬ª, a-t-elle expliqu√© en entrevue t√©l√©phonique.

Voici un aper√ßu des luttes √† surveiller pendant la soir√©e:

Longue soir√©e √† Montr√©al

La course entre le maire sortant, Denis Coderre, et sa principale adversaire, Val√©rie Plante, √©tait d√©j√† serr√©e lorsque le promoteur de la Formule E a d√©voil√© quelques jours avant le scrutin qu'environ la moiti√© des billets de l'√©v√©nement avaient √©t√© donn√©s. M. Coderre, qui a reconnu son erreur de ne pas avoir r√©v√©l√© ces chiffres plus t√¥t, sera-t-il affect√© par cette nouvelle de derni√®re minute? Difficile √† dire, selon la sp√©cialiste en gestion municipale Danielle Pilette. ¬´Il est possible qu'il y ait un genre de vague qui fasse en sorte que Mme Plante cristallise certaines oppositions de M. Coderre. Il y a comme une accentuation depuis quelques jours des d√©fections contre M. Coderre. Mais c'est tr√®s, tr√®s serr√©¬ª, a-t-elle analys√©

Il faudra ensuite savoir si le parti du maire ou de la mairesse aura la majorit√© au conseil municipal. Plus d'un million de Montr√©alais sont convi√©s aux urnes pour combler 103 postes ‚Äî en plus du poste de maire de Montr√©al, 18 maires d'arrondissement, 46 conseillers de la ville et 38 conseillers d'arrondissement doivent √™tre √©lus.

Un quatri√®me mandat pour Labeaume?

Pour cette campagne, le maire sortant R√©gis Labeaume faisait face √† deux principaux candidats, dont le nouveau venu Jean-Fran√ßois Gosselin, qui se bat bec et ongles pour b√¢tir un troisi√®me lien entre la Rive-Sud et la Rive-Nord √† Qu√©bec. M. Labeaume se montre plut√¥t r√©fractaire √† cette id√©e et esp√®re mettre en place un grand projet de transport en commun, tout comme son autre rivale, Anne Gu√©rette. Selon les sondages, R√©gis Labeaume voguerait vers une victoire assez confortable: un sondage L√©ger men√© pour le compte du ¬´Journal de Qu√©bec¬ª a r√©v√©l√© que le maire sortant obtiendrait 51 pour cent des intentions de vote, contre 22 pour cent pour M. Gosselin et 14 pour cent pour Mme Gu√©rette.

¬´Malgr√© une certaine popularit√© de M. Gosselin, je ne crois pas que les effets soient √©normes, a soutenu Mme Pilette. Le maire Labeaume est quand m√™me un maire qui a un bon bilan, malgr√© tout.¬ª

Trois femmes en lice √† Longueuil

Dans cette ville au sud de Montr√©al, trois femmes briguent le poste de mairesse pour succ√©der √† Caroline St-Hilaire, qui a d√©cid√© de c√©der sa place apr√®s deux mandats malgr√© sa grande popularit√© √† Longueuil. Difficile de pr√©dire le r√©sultat, puisque l'ancien parti de la mairesse s'est divis√© en deux. La dauphine de Mme St-Hilaire est officiellement Sylvie Parent, mais son √©lection serr√©e √† la t√™te d'Action Longueuil a provoqu√© une scission au sein du parti. L'ex-conseill√®re Jos√©e Latendresse, qui s'√©tait pr√©sent√©e contre Mme Parent dans la course √† la direction, a fond√© son propre parti avec plusieurs anciens conseillers d'Action Longueuil et se pr√©sente elle-m√™me comme mairesse. La troisi√®me candidate est Sadia Groguh√©, une ancienne d√©put√©e du Nouveau Parti d√©mocratique (NPD) qui dirige Option Longueuil, un parti autrefois repr√©sent√© par le conseiller Robert Myles, un d√©fenseur des droits des anglophones √† Longueuil.

Paul Leduc brigue un sixi√®me mandat dans la controverse

Celui qui a √©t√© maire pendant 19 ans en tout et partout tente, √† l'√¢ge de 80 ans, de se faire r√©√©lire √† Brossard, une autre banlieue au sud de Montr√©al. Il fait face toutefois √† un barrage de critiques sur la gestion de sa ville, qui fait d'ailleurs l'objet d'une enqu√™te du minist√®re des Affaires municipales. Une ancienne membre de l'administration a aussi d√©pos√© une plainte de harc√®lement psychologique contre le maire sortant. Plusieurs autres candidats tentent de d√©faire M. Leduc, dont une de ses anciennes conseill√®res, Doreen Assaad, et l'ancien maire Jean-Marc Pelletier. L'ex-d√©put√© du NPD Hoang Mai tente aussi de se faire √©lire en tant que candidat ind√©pendant.

Deuxi√®me √©lection post-Vaillancourt √† Laval

Le maire sortant, Marc Demers, a pris les r√™nes de la Ville de Laval apr√®s les ann√©es de r√®gne du maire Gilles Vaillancourt, qui l'an dernier a plaid√© coupable √† des accusations de complot, fraude et abus de confiance. M. Demers estime que sa ville a tourn√© la page de cette √©poque, et croit avoir assaini les moeurs politiques. Selon Danielle Pilette, le maire sortant a accompli sa mission. ¬´Il a fait faire toute une r√©forme administrative sous l'√©gide de l'√âNAP (√âcole nationale d'administration publique). Le probl√®me √©tait au niveau politique, mais beaucoup au niveau administratif aussi, parce que les fonctionnaires √©taient habitu√©s de recevoir toutes sortes d'ordres du politique¬ª, a-t-elle indiqu√©.

M. Demers fait face cette fois-ci √† six candidats, dont Jean-Claude Gob√©, qui avait termin√© deuxi√®me en 2013. Les adversaires de Marc Demers lui reprochent notamment d'avoir effectu√© des nominations partisanes et d'accumuler les surplus budg√©taires sans soulager le compte de taxes des Lavallois ‚Äî le parti de M. Gob√© parle m√™me d'une ¬´taxe Demers¬ª.

√âlections sous tension √† Oka

Pascal Quevillon, le maire sortant de cette ville des Laurentides, s'est attir√© les foudres de la communaut√© de Kanesatake pour avoir donn√© son appui √† un projet de quartier r√©sidentiel qui serait construit sur des territoires revendiqu√©s par les Mohawks ‚Äî situ√©s tout pr√®s de la pin√®de qui avait mis le feu aux poudres de la crise d'Oka en 1990. Tandis que le maire d√©fend le projet, le grand chef de Kanesatake, Serge Otsi-Simon, a annonc√© qu'il soutenait l'une des adversaires de M. Quevillon, Marie-Claude Provencher. Dans un communiqu√© diffus√© au d√©but du mois d'octobre, il a d√©clar√© que ¬´le processus de r√©conciliation entrepris en 2015 ne peut √™tre assur√© sans un changement de gouvernement √† la mairie d'Oka¬ª. Pascal Quevillon, qui avait remport√© l'√©lection partielle de 2014 avec plus de 67 pour cent des voix, fait face √† deux autres adversaires, Sylvain Rh√©aume et Julie Tremblay-C.

Yves L√©vesque brigue un ¬´dernier¬ª mandat √† Trois-Rivi√®res

Le maire fort populaire de cette capitale r√©gionale de la Mauricie souhaite se faire r√©√©lire pour un cinqui√®me et ¬´dernier¬ª mandat, selon ses dires. Il fait face cette fois-ci √† une opposition beaucoup moins morcel√©e qu'en 2013. Un ancien conseiller municipal, Jean-Fran√ßois Aubin, et un homme d'affaires √† la retraite, Andr√© Bertrand, tentent de convaincre les Trifluviens de voter pour le changement ‚Äî pendant la campagne, un ancien greffier de la Ville a invit√© les citoyens √† ¬´cong√©dier¬ª le maire L√©vesque, le qualifiant de ¬´champion de la mesquinerie¬ª. Or, selon un sondage publi√© par le ¬´Nouvelliste¬ª et de Cogeco M√©dia 106,9 FM, pr√®s de 80 pour cent des citoyens sont tr√®s satisfaits ou assez satisfaits du bilan du maire.

Un nouveau visage √† Lac-M√©gantic

Le maire Jean-Yves Cloutier a tir√© sa r√©v√©rence apr√®s avoir dirig√© pendant deux ans cette ville de l'Estrie qui peine √† se relever de la trag√©die ferroviaire survenue en 2013. Plus de quatre ans plus tard, la voie de contournement de train r√©clam√©e par la municipalit√© n'est toujours pas construite ‚Äî un dossier que devra porter le ou la nouvelle mairesse de la ville. Trois candidats sont en lice: le journaliste Ronald Martel, le chasseur de t√™te Jean St-Pierre ainsi que l'ancienne conseill√®re Julie Morin.

Course √† quatre √† Saguenay

‚Äã‚ÄãQuatre candidats tentent de succ√©der √† Jean Tremblay, qui r√©gnait dans sa ville depuis 20 ans. Si les principaux candidats veulent conserver une partie de l'h√©ritage de M. Tremblay, ils sont plusieurs √† vouloir changer le style de gouvernance √† Saguenay. C'est Jos√©e N√©ron, une ancienne conseill√®re de l'opposition, qui semble se d√©marquer si l'on croit un dernier sondage Segma recherche diffus√© par ¬´Le Quotidien¬ª et Kyk Radio X. L'ancien d√©put√© f√©d√©ral Jean-Pierre Blackburn, qui est deuxi√®me avec quelques points de diff√©rence seulement, a d'ailleurs organis√© une conf√©rence de presse jeudi pour que Arthur Gobeil se joigne √† lui afin de d√©faire Mme N√©ron. Selon le m√™me sondage, M. Gobeil recueillerait pr√®s de 18 pour cent des intentions de vote, tandis que le dauphin de Jean Tremblay, Dominic Gagnon, fermerait la marche avec un peu plus de 9 pour cent des intentions de vote.

La donaci√≥n de √≥rganos en M√©xico se ve empa√±ada por la desinformaci√≥n, como muestra el caso de Rafael Espino, un joven de 33 a√±os diagnosticado con insuficiencia renal que pas√≥ "siete a√±os enga√±ado" al pensar que figuraba en lista de espera mientras se somet√≠a a agresivos tratamientos de hemodi√°lisis.

Esta historia comenz√≥ entre n√°useas y desmayos cuando Rafael ten√≠a 25 a√±os y al caminar por la calle se fatigaba constantemente "como si corriera un marat√≥n", el primer indicio de un martirio que le quit√≥ su juventud.

Insuficiencia renal cr√≥nica en fase terminal fue el diagn√≥stico que le dieron los m√©dicos de una cl√≠nica del Estado de M√©xico para mandarlo inmediatamente a sesiones de hemodi√°lisis cada tres d√≠as.

"Nunca se me habl√≥ de un trasplante ni de la posibilidad de que eso pod√≠a cambiar mi vida", dijo, y a√±adi√≥ que la hemodi√°lisis "es un tratamiento que puede ser agresivo, algo que tampoco te explican".

Un d√≠a se le comunic√≥ que necesitaba urgentemente varias transfusiones de sangre pues sus niveles de hemoglobina estaban muy bajos (cinco gramos por cada decilitro), por lo que su esposa y su madre acudieron a un hospital de Ciudad de M√©xico para obtenerla.

All√≠ les aseguraron que su pariente ya estaba en lista de espera para obtener un trasplante, aunque sin recibir ning√∫n n√∫mero de referencia. Pasaron siete a√±os.

"Esos siete a√±os me los pas√© con la ilusi√≥n de que me iban a llamar para un trasplante", record√≥ Espino.

Un d√≠a, por un dolor en el coraz√≥n, Espino acudi√≥ de nuevo al mismo hospital de la capital, donde se le canaliz√≥ al departamento de trasplantes y se le solicit√≥ el n√∫mero de referencia que asigna el Centro Nacional de Trasplantes (Cenatra) tras unos estudios protocolarios de compatibilidad. La familia no ten√≠a tal n√∫mero.

Esto le sac√≥ de la ceguera. "Se puede decir que viv√≠ siete a√±os enga√±ado. Nadie me dijo que iniciara ning√∫n protocolo", asegur√≥ el joven, protestando de la falta de tacto del sistema de salud.

"Hay un √≥rgano para ti"

La donaci√≥n de √≥rganos y tejidos en M√©xico aument√≥ 75 % en el periodo 2010-2016 aunque todav√≠a hay mucho por hacer en la materia, afirm√≥ en octubre pasado el secretario de Salud, Jos√© Narro.

En la actualidad, 13 mil mexicanos est√°n a la espera de la donaci√≥n de un ri√±√≥n y otros 7 mil de una c√≥rnea, seg√∫n la Secretar√≠a de Salud.

Tras realizar pesados tr√°mites burocr√°ticos y costosas pruebas de compatibilidad, casi por justicia po√©tica, tras entrar a la lista de espera correcta solo pas√≥ un mes y 20 d√≠as cuando recibi√≥ "la llamada que todos esperan", la que te dice: "Hay un √≥rgano para ti".

"Despu√©s de ser trasplantado acud√≠ a mi sala de hemodi√°lisis, digo mi sala porque viv√≠ siete a√±os ah√≠, y di una pl√°tica. Les dije que se trasplantaran", cont√≥.

La etapa posterior no es f√°cil, ya que son tres meses de toma de inmunosupresores para que el √≥rgano no sufra rechazo del organismo. No es posible trabajar y, por tanto, quienes no cuentan con seguro social no perciben ning√∫n ingreso, lo que conduce a una situaci√≥n de aislamiento en ocasiones desesperada.

Indic√≥ que su esposa tampoco pod√≠a salir a trabajar porque √©l requer√≠a ayuda constante. "No pod√≠a salir de un aislamiento donde ella me alimentaba, me llevaba el agua y todo", record√≥.

Alejandra Garc√≠a es la persona que le acompa√±√≥ en todo este proceso apenas un a√±o despu√©s de su casamiento, y que, seg√∫n cont√≥, result√≥ complicado ya que conlleva "aprender a vivir tambi√©n con una enfermedad que no sientes f√≠sicamente".

"Vivir con una persona que en cualquier momento puede darle un infarto o ya no va a amanecer un d√≠a es una de las peores cosas de la vida", reconoci√≥.

Sobre el sistema de salud p√∫blica, la joven denuncia el conformismo, que prefiere anestesiar con f√°rmacos que dar esperanza. "Ya mejor dele sus mejores d√≠as y espere a que se muera, mejor ahorre el dinero para su funeral", asegur√≥ que le dijeron en el hospital.

La presidenta de la fundaci√≥n Trasplante y Vida, Carolina Silva, habl√≥ sobre las vicisitudes que pasan algunos pacientes que acuden a su instituci√≥n, que colabora directamente con las instituciones p√∫blicas, y asegur√≥ que "en M√©xico falta cultura de la donaci√≥n".

"Hay mucha falta de informaci√≥n en los pacientes ya que se atienden en instalaciones p√∫blicas con cantidades ingentes de gente", argument√≥.

Sobre la lentitud en los procesos opin√≥ que es algo que "podr√≠amos tener resuelto" pero es "la falta de cultura de los hospitales y la voluntad de hacerlo" lo que rezaga el proceso.

Espino es una v√≠ctima extrema de la desinformaci√≥n que sufren algunos pacientes con bajos recursos en M√©xico y que, poco a poco, parece querer resolverse mediante asociaciones que subsanan el desborde de trabajo de los sistemas de salud.

20.600 Tonnen der Kapseln haben die Deutschen 2015 verbraucht. Zehn Jahre zuvor waren es gerade einmal 800 Tonnen. Ein sprunghafter Anstieg.

Das Ergebnis: 5000 Tonnen Abfall an Aluminium. Wem diese Zahl zu abstrakt ist, der kann sich auch dieses Foto ansehen. Es macht deutlich, welche Sch√§den ein scheinbar harmloser Genuss wie Kaffeetrinken ausrichten kann:

Quelle: Getty

Die Aufnahme zeigt das brasilianische Dorf Bento Rodrigues. Am 5. November 2015 kamen hier 19 Menschen ums Leben, sie wurden von einer Schlammlawine √ºberrollt.

Und neben uns die Sintflut

Ursache war ein Dammbruch im R√ºckhaltebecken der Eisenerzmine Samarco in der brasilianischen Bergbaustadt Mariana. Durchsetzt mit Schwermetallen √ºberzog eine giftige Schicht von Schlamm das Tal. Die Wasserversorgung f√ºr Millionen von Menschen ist seitdem gef√§hrdet.

Schlamm und Tote hier, unschuldiger Kaffeekonsum dort - beides h√§nge zusammen, erkl√§rt der Soziologe Stephan Lessenich in seinem neuen Buch "Neben uns die Sintflut".

‚û® Mehr zum Thema: Wie ein Brasilianer seit 40 Jahren Baum f√ºr Baum den Regenwald rettet

Am Beispiel des Dammbruchs in Brasilien versucht er, die Zusammenh√§nge von Konsum und Ausbeutung der Natur verst√§ndlich zu machen.

Kaffeekonsum und die Zerst√∂rung von Lebensgrundlagen

Die Mine Samarco geh√∂rt dem brasilianischen Konzern Vale und dem australisch-britischen Konzern BHP Billiton. Die lange bekannten Sicherheitsm√§ngel im R√ºckhaltebecken seien ignoriert worden, die beiden Gro√ükonzerne h√§tten die F√∂rdermenge von Bauxit noch 2015 um fast 40 Prozent gesteigert, berichtet Lessenich in seinem Buch.

Bauxit wiederum dient der Herstellung von Aluminium. Und Aluminium steckt dann etwa auch in den kleinen, fein portionierten und leicht verwendbaren Kaffeekapseln.

"Da kann man sehen, dass es da bestimmte Verbindungen gibt", sagte Lennenich am Sonntag im Deutschlandfunk. "Also der lockerleichte, nebenher betriebene Kaffeekonsum hierzulande und die Zerst√∂rung von Lebensgrundlagen von vielen, vielen Menschen anderswo in der Welt."

In der Regel w√ºrden die Verbindungen nicht so klar hervortreten. Im Fall des Dammbruchs mit seinen 19 Toten aber bleibe die ‚ÄúZerst√∂rung von Lebensgrundlagen‚Äù nicht verborgen. In der Tat: Sie ist auf den Fotos √ºberdeutlich.

Quelle: Getty

Das Beispiel zeigt, wie sehr kleine Entscheidungen im Alltag gr√∂√üere Folgen nach sich ziehen k√∂nnen - und wie kompliziert das mit dem Konsum in einer modernen, globalisierten Welt geworden ist.

Wenn jede Entscheidung pl√∂tzlich z√§hlt

"Konsum ist Politik mit dem Einkaufswagen", kommentierte k√ºrzlich die Wochenzeitung "Die Zeit" die Verwirrung, die verantwortungsvolle K√§ufer zwangsl√§ufig √ºberkommt. Wie wahr dieser Satz ist. Der Fortbestand des Regenwalds entscheidet sich eben auch an der heimischen Kaffeemaschine.

Jede Entscheidung will gut √ºberlegt sein, jede Kaufentscheidung kann einen ganzen Rattenschwanz von Folgen mit sich bringen. Manchmal gute, manchmal schlechte, manchmal verheerende.

Im Falle der Kaffeekapseln gibt es allerdings auch mehrere m√∂gliche L√∂sungen, um den Schaden f√ºr die Umwelt zu begrenzen. Man steigt um auf Filterkaffee - oder man gew√∂hnt sich einen Handgriff an: Man wirft die Kapseln zumindest in den gelben Sack. Nespresso etwa, der gr√∂√üte Hersteller von Kaffeekapseln, bem√ºht sich darum, das Recyceln so leicht wie m√∂glich zu machen.

Wie viele Kaffeetrinker die Kapseln dort reinwerfen, wei√ü der Hersteller nicht. Es ist eine Entscheidung, die jedem selbst √ºberlassen bleibt.

Aber auch eine, die Folgen am anderen Ende der Welt haben kann.

(lk)
TITLE: Wenn ihr morgens Kapseln in eure Kaffeemaschine schiebt, solltet ihr dieses Bild kennen

SUMMARY:
ADVERTISEMENTAn incident of unimaginable horror has come to light in Uttar Pradesh.
A 100-year-old woman in Meerut was raped by a 35-year-old drunk man while she was bed-ridden, leading to her death, according to agencies and other reports.
The woman's grandson told the Times of India that the woman was so weak that "she could only manage to utter feeble cries."
"We rushed to where she was and were horrified to find the man forcing himself on her," her 40-year-old grandson said.
Police have arrested one Ankit Punia on charges of rape, murder and sections of the SC/ST Act, the paper reported.
TEXT:
ADVERTISEMENT

An incident of unimaginable horror has come to light in Uttar Pradesh. A 100-year-old woman in Meerut was raped by a 35-year-old drunk man while she was bed-ridden, leading to her death, according to agencies and other reports.

The woman's grandson told the Times of India that the woman was so weak that "she could only manage to utter feeble cries."

"We rushed to where she was and were horrified to find the man forcing himself on her," her 40-year-old grandson said. The incident occurred on Sunday midnight. Police have arrested one Ankit Punia on charges of rape, murder and sections of the SC/ST Act, the paper reported.

The district hospital said she was brought in a "really bad condition". She died at the hospital.

IANS further added that Punia was trying to escape after the horrific assault in Jaani village when neighbours overpowered him and handed him over to the police.
TITLE: 100-Year-Old Woman Dies After Being Raped By Drunk Man In Meerut
